title: Full Stack Developer at Ezra (Toronto, ON, Canada)
description:
Our mission


Ezra’s mission is to enable early cancer detection for everyone by using Artificial Intelligence and the most advanced medical imaging technology available. We believe in empowering people to make their own health decisions, so we are offering Ezra as a direct-to-consumer health membership. Our members visit a partner imaging centre to get a full-body MRI scan, and receive a cancer screening report from an Ezra Medical Provider within 7 days. Our reports are generated by radiologists to quickly and accurately screen for potential abnormalities anywhere in the body. We're also building AI technology designed to assist radiologists in their analysis of MRI images - as well as increase their productivity (AI technology is under FDA review).


Your mission


As a Full Stack Developer at Ezra, you will build the next generation of cloud-based AI services for early cancer detection. Specifically, you'll craft & continuously improve the portal that both our members & our team use to view the results of scans & book touch-points. You'll make the end-to-end experience of cancer screening more accessible by placing information related to our members' health right at their fingertips. You'll also empower our doctors & imaging partners to deliver a seamless member experience through the tools you build.


As a full stack developer, you will: 



  • Develop web-based products used by our patients, doctors and imaging partners

  • Implement non-functional requirements for responsiveness, scalability, & cybersecurity

  • Document your code and participate in peer-to-peer code reviews

  • Design and implement software tests for other members of the team

  • Learn about medical imaging, radiology, cancer and artificial intelligence

  • Contribute solutions to challenging engineering & product problems


Key requirements: 



  • You're always elevating your coding, architecture, code review, & testing skills

  • 3+ experience working with JavaScript, C#, HTML5, CSS3, ASP.NET, AWS & Azure

  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as React.js, Angular.js, & Vue

  • Strong grasp of relational & non-relational databases, & data storage services

  • Familiar with software architecture (n-tier, microservices,etc) and design patterns

  • Familiar with best practices for design documentation, coding styles, and systems deployment (staging, UAT, and production)


Nice to haves: 



  • Core, Azure DevOps, and Azure Portal is highly desirable

  • Experience with medical products or in a regulated environment preferred


What’s in it for you?


On our team, you have the opportunity to be an early employee at Ezra and be part of an all-star team focused on detecting cancer early for everyone in the world. You’re also going to have access to benefits such as: Comprehensive health, dental and vision plans for your and your family; wellness and commuter benefits; competitive vacation policy; a culture that emphasizes learning and work-life harmony; healthy food and snacks; off-sites and happy hours.


Our commitment to diversity and inclusion


We’re aiming to build a diverse team and inclusive company culture. We are an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and do not discriminate based on race, colour, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.

title: Full Stack Java Developer at Rethink Solutions (Toronto, ON, Canada)
description:
• Design, develop, test, improve and maintain a high performance Software as a Service (SaaS) property tax management application.

  • Engage and collaborate with management, team members and quality assurance as appropriate to ensure high quality deliverables

  • Adhere to and promote both industry and Rethink Solutions development standards and best practices

  • Maintain high level of functional and technical product knowledge

  • Initiate and/or actively participate in continuous improvement of RSI processes


Skills & Requirements


Qualifications:



  • At Least 3+ years of experience with JAVA/JEE

  • Solid understanding of design principles and design patterns

  • Knowledge of Java web technologies such as Servlet, JAX-RS, etc.

  • Solid working knowledge of web technologies such as HTML, Javascript and CSS

  • Firm grasp of javascript and javascript ecosystem

  • Experience with Java based front-end frameworks

  • Working experience with Hibernate (or equivalent) ORM

  • Working experience with Java EE 6+ and knowledge of Java EE components such as EJB, JPA, etc.

  • Proven ability to meet deadlines, prioritize tasks and work effectively with minimal supervision in a team environment

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written with both technical and non-technical staff)


Beneficial Skills:



  • Experience creating and maintaining Java APIs (Restful, SOAP, etc.)

  • Experience with Web Authentication methods (OAUTH, JWT, Auth0, etc.)

  • Experience with modern web frameworks and javascript libraries (react, angular, node, etc.)

  • Experience with BIRT or equivalent

  • Experience with Apache Wicket or other component based Java front-end frameworks

  • Well versed in SQL with RDBMS experience

  • Working knowledge of development tools and environments such as Maven, Git, IntelliJ IDEA, etc.

  • Active in developer communities with blogs / meet ups

  • Actively follows current best practices as well as trends in programming

  • An active Github account

title: Senior Backend Engineer at Homer (Toronto, ON, Canada)
description:
HOMER has a newly created opportunity for a Senior Backend Engineer to join our growing team! This role will be based our Toronto office.  


HOMER, a BEGiN brand, is the proven early learning program that provides the best educational start possible. We offer personalized, fun, and proven learning products for kids ages 2-8 to help build confidence, mastery, and a love of learning. We are deeply committed to our members and to their children, and we are building a creative and strategic team to develop a portfolio of early learning products that support learning everywhere.


Reporting into our Director of Technology, the Senior Backend Engineer will be a key member of our engineering team, building the back end services and infrastructure team essential to our growing business. Over time, we expect you to grow by learning and practicing technical ownership, promoting best practices in coding and architecture, collaborating with and mentoring other members of the engineering team through code reviews and paired programming, and becoming a vocal advocate of our engineering forward culture.


Our backend technology stack includes the following:



  • Node.js and TypeScript as the main programming language

  • Python for handling long running internal processes

  • Applications are hosted in AWS

  • We use GIT for source control


You will:



  • Develop and maintain key internal and public-facing back end systems such as user management microservices

  • Design redundant and scalable architectures for high performance web and mobile delivery across multiple platforms

  • Engineer simple and elegant solutions to challenging problems, working towards an overall team goal of 99.99% uptime

  • Design and engineer secure RESTful APIs

  • Updating legacy code to implement cutting edge tech


Must Haves:



  • Proficiency in Node.js and TypeScript

  • Experience with GraphQL

  • Experience with Amazon Web Services

  • Experience in relational and non-relational databases

  • Experience in unit testing and end-to-end testing

  • Experience with MVC frameworks

  • Good knowledge of continuous delivery

  • Good knowledge of microservices

  • Good knowledge of software fundamentals design/architectural patterns. 


Nice-to-Haves:



  • Good knowledge of HTML/CSS 

  • Good knowledge of authentication, encryption and security techniques

  • Experience building CMS and reporting systems

  • Experience developing apps with Ed Tech industry standards. (e.g., PCI and COPPA compliance)  

  • Experience in a startup environment


We like people who:



  • Are enthusiastic about learning and applying new cutting edge technologies.

  • Take ownership of your own work.

  • Have excellent interpersonal and communication skills and are able to convey a very technical situation to less technical colleagues. 

  • Are pragmatic, able to determine when and why it is the right call to take a step back and refactor old code versus putting together a quick fix. 


What you’ll get:



  • HOMER offers competitive compensation including equity and full benefits.

  • Smart, passionate, and engaged co-workers.

  • Excellent top-tier Medical/Dental/Vision benefits

  • The chance to have a big impact, quickly

  • The rare opportunity to make a dent in the universe. We’re bringing a love of reading and learning to children globally!


HOMER is an equal opportunity employer and enthusiastically encourages people from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences to apply. HOMER does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), gender, national origin, citizenship, age, mental or physical disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or any other basis prohibited by law.

title: Full Stack Software Developer (Agile Custom Software and Consulting) at Deutsche Fintech Solutions (Toronto, ON, Canada)
description:
Join our team to work on everything from front-end to server-side code and database architecture. We have an exceptional 25+ year delivery track record, deep technical expertise and disciplined delivery and technical engineering practices. At Intelliware, you’ll build a wide variety of enterprise/consumer facing applications within a team-based Agile environment. The way we build software is strongly influenced by the values of Extreme Programming: feedback, respect, courage, communication and simplicity. We have collaborative project rooms where you’ll work closely with a cross functional team including clients. You’ll find continuous opportunities to learn, share knowledge and teach within your team and within the developer community at Intelliware via monthly educational sessions, study groups and hands-on R&D initiatives.  Intelliware’s niche is delivering custom software applications for complex business and technical challenges. Core development is done in Java, Spring and JavaScript, although the nature of our work allows project teams the opportunity to work with a wide variety of technologies. Recent projects we’ve delivered include technologies such as Angular, React, Node.js, MongoDB, Kafka, Hadoop, Kotlin and Cloud Foundry.


While working within a team in an Agile environment, you will be:



  • Designing high quality applications that are highly scalable and extensible

  • Estimating, tasking and prototyping

  • Contributing clear and maintainable code to a shared codebase

  • Collaborating with cross-functional team members on features, design and implementation

  • Investigating, learning and applying new technologies and processes

  • Clarifying requirements with team and client representatives


’Must Have’ Skills/Experience:



  • Proven experience designing and developing complex applications that are highly scalable and extensible

  • Fluent in Java and/or JavaScript

  • Attention to well-crafted software

  • Bachelor’s Degree in one of: Engineering, Computer Science, Physics or Mathematics (or equivalent education/experience)


’Nice to Have’ Skills/Experience:



  • Exposure to and interest in Agile approaches to software development e.g. automated testing, continuous integration, project rooms, pair programming, etc.

  • Fluent and current in HTML5, CSS and JavaScript frameworks

  • Relational and/or NoSQL databases, SQL queries and object relational mapping tools

  • Distributed computing and platform as a service

  • UNIX, Linux and W3C technologies including HTTP and XML

  • Automated build, test and deployment tools


For more info on Intelliware, check out our Careers Page and Instagram. Intelliware is committed to diversity in the workplace. We are an inclusive employer and welcome and encourage applications from all qualified candidates. Applicants’ needs will be accommodated during our recruitment and selection process so please advise us if you require accommodation.

title: Software Engineer at AbacusNext (Toronto, ON, Canada)
description:
AbacusNext has a great opportunity for a Software Engineer that is excited about delivering features and value to thousands of users. Based in downtown Toronto, Canada, the Amicus Attorney team of developers, QA analysts and product owners strive to create the best user software experience in the legal market. And you could be part of that team.


Requirements:


This position involves high-level .NET programming using the C# programming language, as well as web development using ASP.NET, HTML and JavaScript. Candidate should have an in-depth knowledge of .NET Framework 4.0+, ASP.NET development patterns (including MVC and Razor), and experience using common JavaScript frameworks (such as JQuery & AngularJS). Experience with Microsoft Azure SDK is an asset.



Must be able to write code that is well designed, easily maintainable, sufficiently documented, and follows the patterns and practices set forth in the project’s description. Candidates must continually strive toward improvement and mastery of their field. Following best practices is required.



Candidate must be able to work in a team environment, get along well with others, and possess excellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience in the legal or accounting space is a plus.



Benefits & Perks:



  • Experience great professional and personal growth, we also offer

  • Convenient downtown Toronto waterfront location near Union Station

  • Extended medical benefits (including dental care, vision care & out-of-province travel insurance)

  • Weekly catered lunch

  • Weekly office fruit basket

  • Corporate giving program with donation matching

  • Flexible paid time off

  • Corporate sports team sponsorship's

  • On-site games room with pool table, foosball, basketball & more.

  • Referral program for new hires

  • Regular social committee events (including annual summer & Christmas parties)


Equal Employment Opportunity: AbacusNext is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer.


 Abacus Data Systems Canada, Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Software Developer - Frontend Developer at Hays (Toronto, ON, Canada)
description:
ANGULAR DEVELOPER URGENTLY NEEDED 6 Mont Contact (Will Extend) Leader in the insurance Industry Toronto

Your new company

Our client Intact is a large insurance organisation headquartered in Toronto, with offices all over Canada.

Your new role

In your role as the Angular developer you will Improve and develop software systems to meet users' needs by finding solutions, solving complex problems, code development, testing, debugging and documenting systems. You will engage in all project phases to ensure completion in collaboration with users and communicating status reports. The Angular Developer will make recommendations and participate in improving development and system maintenance processes and ensure systems are optimal and meet quality standards.

What you'll need to succeed



  • 7+ years of experience developing n-tier web applications using Java and Java-based application frameworks.

  • Minimum of 4 years of experience within Angular development

  • Strong knowledge of UX principals and front-end development experience with Angular, HTML, CSS, and AJAX

  • Strong knowledge of server-side Java technologies such as JSP, JSF, Servlets, EJB, JDBC, JMS, WebSphere, Tomcat, Docker, Openshift/Kubernetes

  • Extensive knowledge in CIDC (Concepts in Continuous integration)

  • Experience with Oracle 11+, PLSQL, and database performance tuning is an asset

  • Experience with open source frameworks and tools such as Hibernate, Ivy, Ant, Maven

  • Excellent communication both written & Verbal



What you'll get in return

The client is offering a long term engagement and a very competitive hourly rate for the contract

What you need to do now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Hays Specialist Recruitment is working in partnership with Intact to manage the recruitment of this position Skills & Requirements * 7+ years of experience developing n-tier web applications using Java and Java-based application frameworks. * Minimum of 4 years of experience within Angular development

title: Senior Web UI Developer at Hays (Toronto, ON, Canada)
description:
Toronto West Side Liberty Village Permanent Full Time UI Developer Job HTML CSS JavaScript 90,000 /Year

Your new company
This is a fast growing cosmetics company across globe with network in Asia, Europe, North America and Australia. With the head office in West side of Toronto city, we're hiring 6 new developers to join the team. Aside from all required technologies, we are looking for someone with excellent English language and presentation skills.


Your new role
In the team, there are 6 other developers who's stronger in back-end development, however we need you to be really focusing on Front-end technologies using the original HTML, CSS, JavaScript , and some experience on back-end using .Net technology. You will be able to write code without any frameworks -- this is very key as you are working on the branding side of the business, which involves a lot of creative and cool software development and presentation to the consumers, such as the eCommerce website, marketing creative pages and video campaigns.

What you'll need to succeed
You need to have minimum 5 years after gratification working experience, a passion for programming and create cool stuff with codes, and excellent English presentation skills as you will be working a lot with creative people, marketing and other departments. This is a permanent job.

What you'll get in return
Can you bring your dog or parrot to the company? Yes, working in this company, you can bring your pet into the company in an open working environment where culture is friendly, rewarding and fun. You are not a code machine. You are the key part of the business because your voice will be heard, and you will bring positive influence in the business, and you have lots of opportunities interacting with the business, stakeholders in a fast growing company. The company has grew from 200 people to 900 people in the past 2 years and yet they are still expanding due to the strong market growth.


What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

title: Senior Frontend Cloud Web Developer at Sourced Group Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
description:
Sourced Values


Integrity, Innovation, Service, Quality, Humility, Sustainability


About the role


The Product division of Sourced was formed to provide leading-edge software aimed at accelerating and automating cloud adoption in large and regulated enterprises. In this role, you will be working in a close and highly skilled team of developers to define, design, and develop innovativeweb-based SaaS solutionsto help our customers solve some of the biggest problems in modern IT.


We are open to both full-time and contract-seeking candidates.


What you’ll bring to the role



  • 6+ years of development experience with modern frontend web frameworks such as Vue.js, Angular, and/or React

  • A strong understanding of web and related technologies including HTML5, CSS3/SCSS/LESS, JavaScript, npm/Yarn, Webpack, and Babel

  • Experience designing and developing technical user interfaces and flows

  • Experience with UI test automation tools such as Cypress, Selenium, Jest, and/or Mocha

  • Familiarity with modern SDLC and associated tools including Jira and git


Desirable skills



  • Commitment to continuous learning and adoption of the right processes, technologies, and tools

  • Prior experience working on SaaS products is desirable

  • Familiarity with design software such as Sketch, InVision, and/or XD, and the ability to transform UI designs into working software with close attention to detail

title: Software Developer --Front end at Hays (Mississauga, ON, Canada)
description:
Perm Job Hiring Walmart Front-end Senior Staff Engineer Mississauga Based React Angular

Your new company
Our client Walmart Canada is expanding the technology team in Mississauga. We are now hiring three senior Front-end Developers (minimum 8 years of Front-end development experience) to join the team urgently.

Your new role
We are looking for a strong Senior Software Developer, who will help build a highly scalable and performing eCommerce platform to match our exponential growth. You will have an opportunity to design and develop new innovative features on the current platform and help in transitioning our platform to micro-app architecture using next-gen technologies. You will be responsible to actively participate in the design and architectural discussions for Frontend and API gateway layer. You will also work closely with the Product Owners to develop innovative customer experiences and user interfaces
Position Responsibilities :
  • Design and develop scalable, performant and responsive FE architecture.using either React or Angular
  • Participate in Code Reviews, providing technical mentor-ship to other junior team members.
  • Implement new features by collaboratively working with Product Owners, UX designers, and other fellow Engineers.
  • Help in design and development of API gateway layer which can interact with many other micro-services.
  • Leads the design sessions for medium to large initiatives to come up with high level design.
  • Able to independently handle high impact critical issues.
  • Actively participate in agile ceremonies




What you'll need to succeed
We are only looking for senior Frontend Engineers so you need to have at least 8 years of experience with a BS/MS degree in Computer Science or closely related field or equivalent practical experience. Other key qualification include:
  • Strong knowledge of JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5, asynchronous request handling, and AJAX in highly scalable and available applications.
  • 8+ years of software development experience working in NodeJS, Scala, Ruby on Rails, Python or Java.
  • Experience building responsive UIs which are optimised for mobile devices.
  • Solid understanding of building RESTful APIs.
  • Have a strong passion for developing elegant and well-designed frameworks.
  • Experience in any of the JavaScript framework like React, EmberJS or Angular 1.x/2.x is a big plus.
  • A history of open-source contribution is an asset.




What you'll get in return
You will be working in a leading company, in one of the best technology team with strict and high standard in coding. You will be working with brilliant team members using the latest technologies. The company has multiple platforms so both React and Angular expert can perform really well. The company encourage learning in the team, and provide immerse grow opportunities within the group, i.e. you can apply for another team to learn different business. Your will enjoy competitive salary as base + bonus +3 weeks vacation +personal days, and the flexibility of working from home once a week.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

title: Senior Full Stack Cloud Web Developer at Sourced Group Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
description:
Sourced Values 


Integrity, Innovation, Service, Quality, Humility, Sustainability 


About the role 


The Product division of Sourced was formed to provide leading-edge software aimed at accelerating and automating cloud adoption in large and regulated enterprises. In this role, you will be working in a close and highly skilled team of developers to define, design, and develop high-value software and tooling for use by our customers.


We are open to both full-time and contract-seeking candidates.


What you’ll be responsible for 



  • Designing, developing, and running web-based SaaS solutions to support and accelerate cloud adoption in large and regulated enterprises 

  • Working closely with technical leads and client teamsto gather requirements and provide solutions in the scope of your role 

  • Working in a global organisation and interacting with Sourced team members across a variety of time zones 


What you’ll bring to the role 



  • 6+ years of development experience with backend web technologies such as Django, Flask, Node.js, etc 

  • 6+ years of development experience with one or more modern frontend web frameworks such as Vue.js, Angular, React, or other 

  • Experience building cloud-native applications for AWS, Azure, or GCP 

  • Experience designing and implementing ReSTful APIs 


Desirable skills 



  • Understanding and/or experience implementing loggingand monitoring at scale 

  • Experience designing, implementing, or running SaaS or managed solutions 

  • Experience developing schemas and models for relational databases 

  • Experience with NoSQL databases such as DynamoDB or MongoDB 

  • Experience using caching technologies such as Redis or Memcached 

  • Experience with automated testing at both unit and integration testing levels 

  • Experience with the full SDLC in a modern landscape using CI/CD processes and tools 

  • Knowledge of cloud backup&recovery procedures and technologies

title: Senior Software Developer (Bills Team) at Xero (Toronto, ON, Canada)
description:
Our purpose


Small business makes the world go ‘round – it is at the heart of the global economy. At Xero we want millions of small businesses to thrive with better tools, better information and meaningful connections. We aim to make running a small business more efficient and profitable, and more enjoyable too.


How you’ll make an impact


We seek skilled engineers to help with the development of critical components of Xero’s future infrastructure.  They will assist in developing Xero’s interactions with external business systems, supporting the ingestion of critical business documents, and providing highly scalable applications for the management of key business workflows by our many millions of users. This work will help differentiate our product from our competitors and is a key strategic initiative underpinning our platform for the next 5 years and beyond. This is an entirely new team so a lot of the initial work will be building new features and infrastructure from scratch.


Success looks like


We have existing commitments to deliver features in market as quickly as possible, so an ability to plan quickly and effectively, and to hit the ground running with a focus on delivery will be highly valued. You’ll help build solid, production-ready software fully covered by unit tests and with an efficient deployment pipeline. A lot of work will be developing to well-defined public standards, so an ability to work with these is critical. You should also be a team player and a great communicator.


What you’ll do


You will be working with the wider sales and purchases team to help small businesses get paid faster and smarter. You will work with Product Managers, Engineers and DevOps Engineers to ensure we have a robust and efficient system. We continually strive to make our users lives easier, and you will be championing their cause while building a world class platform.   Xero is a global organization, so you will be working with people across many locations and time zones.


Our stack is constantly evolving. We’ve been Windows focused, but we are moving to a serverless future, fueled by React.js, .Net core, Docker and AWS. We’re always looking at what’s coming next and embrace new technologies where they make sense for us.


What you’ll bring with you


Required Skills



  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience

  • 5+ years professional development experience

  • Knowledge of all of the following: C#, .NET, RDMS

  • Be able to write testable code, as well as automated tests for your own work

  • Ability to work as part of a team and able to take pride and ownership in their work

  • Have initiative and a passion for all things web and a willingness to go the extra mile

  • Ability to work with both remote and co-located developers and other team members


Nice to have skills



  • Experience with Docker, RESTful web services and Amazon Web Services (AWS)

  • Experience with Agile and/or Scrum development methodologies.

  • Kubernetes

  • Serverless (Azure, Google Cloud, AWS Lambda)

  • CI/CD

  • React/Redux/Webpack

  • TDD/BDD/Selenium/Nightwatch

title: Lead Mobile Developer at NorthOne (Toronto, ON, Canada)
description:
We make small businesses more successful through better banking.


Our company is looking for a Lead Mobile Developer to join our growing team as we enter a new phase of expansion  We are a Toronto-based, venture-backed startup at the heart of the FinTech movement that is shaping the way financial services are delivered.


Our product


NorthOne is a mobile, tech-powered bank account built for startups, freelancers, and small/medium-sized business (SMBs). Poor financial literacy has an outsized impact on the costs and failure rates amongst SMBs, and we are on a mission to eliminate these problems. We are more than a banking platform, we are the world class Finance Department that SMBs could never afford.


Our team


We technology. Thoughtful and rigorous product development makes us giddy. That’s why when it comes to software development, everybody plays in the orchestra. We’ve got a fast moving team of full stack developers lead by our VP Engineering who’s spent over a decade building technology at both Fortune 500 companies and startups. Our COO has helped build digital products used by companies like Frank and Oak, Supercell, MachineZone, BMO, and Trivago. Oh, and our CEO? 6 years at McKinsey working on digital customer experience in financial services. We’re building a product that solves real pain, vs the imagined kind. Is this sounding like home yet?


REQUIREMENTS


Today you might be a Mobile Developer, Full Stack Developer, Engineering Manager or the equivalent in your company...or something that we haven’t heard of yet - we keep an open mind.


The most important characteristic for a Lead Mobile Developer joining our team is your attitude. We want you to join because you don't see roadblocks, you see opportunities to be at your best. You know that somehow, you and the rest of our team can figure anything out.


These team skills that will make you successful in this role (note that this comes before all else):



  • You get your hands dirty: You are comfortable diving into new projects, exploring other’s code. Whatever it is, you like to stretch outside your swimlane.

  • You’re curious: You’re excited about the bleeding edge of tech without being dogmatic about any language or framework and are excited to passionately share your views with us.

  • You know that tech is a team sport: You understand that learning from and teaching other great developers makes the whole team better.

  • You’re mission first: You get stuff done and you don’t let anything get in the way of moving our product forward.


The skills that will make you successful in this role:



  • Required skills:


    • Mobile app development experience using React Native

    • Expert knowledge in at least one modern mobile native programming language (Java, SWIFT, Objective C) 

    • Developed multiple mobile applications based on technical and functional specs

    • Some technical management experience

    • Experience release planning around future features and business needs

    • Comfortable working with product and design teams


  • Nice to haves:


    • Worked with secure mobile applications (e.g., finance, health)

    • Experience working with GraphQL

    • Experience in a fast growing startup/scale-up

    • Strong interest in FinTech, finance and entrepreneurship

    • Track record of developing junior and mid level developers into world class senior devs



Few people have been trained for this sort of role. If you are this close to what we’ve described, but aren’t sure, apply. Let’s figure out together if this is where you could shine.


BENEFITS


Our mission is big and audacious, but we're assembling a team to take the challenge head on. 


As a Lead Mobile Developer you'll be joining a team that prioritizes:



  • People: Our company is more than just a business. We’re a band of brothers and sisters supporting each other on our mission to rebuild business banking. We’re really serious about mission, fit, and the people we work with. You’ll be part of a rapidly scaling team that reflects these values and keeps this place special.

  • Diversity: You'll find yourself in an environment that values diversity and inclusivity. Excellence doesn't come in one flavor and neither should we.

  • Leadership: You’re right in the thick of it, making critical decisions that will clear our path forward. 


We offer full health/dental benefits, competitive compensation/equity, and one hell of an adventure.


If you recognize yourself in this job description, let's talk.

title: Intermediate/Senior Front-End Engineer at Safyre Labs (Toronto, ON, Canada)
description:
Who we are


Safyre Labs is the leading developer of Full Stack Integrated e-Commerce/Manufacturing platforms. The Safyre platform powers next-generation online retailers like the award winning and industry-leading personalized jewelry retailer Jewlr.


Founded in 2009 by experienced engineers and serial entrepreneurs in the software industry, Safyre Labs leverages innovation and technology to disrupt the traditional e-Commerce industry. At the heart of our company is our proprietary multi-faceted technology platform; the platform integrates e-Commerce, ERP, and just-in-time manufacturing functions all into one. Located in Toronto, Safyre Labs is self-funded, profitable, and rapidly growing.


Who are we looking for?


We are looking for smart, talented front-end web engineers who are excited to join our small but growing engineering team.


The ideal candidate would be: proficient in CSS/HTML/Javascript/React/Redux, worked with backend MVC frameworks (e.g. Ruby on Rails or Express.js), a great problem solver, passionate about coding and new technologies, likes to take ownership of projects, and wants to make an impact.


Where are we?


We're located in North York, Ontario, near Dufferin St and Steeles Ave.


What's the gig?


You will be working as a Front-End Engineer to help build out our technology platform and power the future of ecommerce.


There will be no shortage of tasks or projects to work on: you will be given interesting and often challenging assignments where you will be expected to learn, adapt, strategize, troubleshoot, and deliver code. We are constantly looking for people to question the "status quo" on how things are done and want ideas on how to do things in a modern and more efficient way.


Technologies we use



  • React/Javascript ES6

  • Express.js, Next.js, Node.js

  • AWS, Docker, Elasticsearch, Redis

  • MongoDB, MySQL, Postgres

  • Linux


Employment Type


Permanent Full-time Position with Benefits

title: Director, Curriculum at App Academy () (allows remote)
description:
The Director of Curriculum is a strategic and hands-on leader who is primarily accountable for the results of a high-functioning instructional team. The Director will work with groups across App Academy to ensure the highest-quality and delivery of content to our growing student body. The Director is charged with leading the efforts to implement and measure all systems needed to maintain a stable capacity of content creators.



Responsibilities




    • Coordinate with the VP of Academics to minimize cost of content creation and source appropriate contractors to augment full-time capacity

    • Establish and enforce content standards, and provide direct feedback to all content creators with respect to the standards and the content

    • Identify, develop, execute, and evolve the professional development programs for content creators

    • Work with the Director of Instruction to garner implementation and evaluation feedback

    • Work with the Director of Software Engineering as the primary stakeholder for the curriculum group

    • Work with the Director of Enterprise Instruction to coordinate curriculum development for enterprise clients







Experience & Qualifications




    • Three years of of professional software development experience

    • Demonstrable above average written and presentation skills

    • Demonstrable knowledge of all of the following programming topics: JavaScript, HTML, CSS, ReactJS and the Flux architecture, Object-oriented design patterns and principles, Microservice architecture, and functional programming patterns and principles







Nice to Haves





      • Three years of teaching adult learners

      • At least one of the following: three years of experience teaching or a M.Ed.

      • At least one of each of the following: five years of software development experience or an M.S. in Computer Science

      • Demonstrable knowledge of at least one of the following languages and associated frameworks: Ruby and Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, Express.js, SequelizePython, Flask, SQL AlchemyJava, Spring, JPA, C#, ASP.NET MVC, and EF









Our Values




    • Take responsibility for student success:.  Everyone works together to enable student success.

    • Follow the numbers.  Decisions should be backed by data.

    • Embrace a growth mindset.  View challenges and failures as opportunities to improve.

    • Start with why.  See the big picture and question the status quo. If there’s a better way of doing things we should investigate it.  

    • Create an inclusive environment.  We work together to promote empathy and respect amongst all students and staff.

    • Build with urgency. Build like careers depend on it.







Benefits




    • Competitive salary

    • Flexible paid time off

    • Employer-sponsored health insurance plans with 100% support for premiums

    • Generous paid family leave program

    • The opportunity to work with driven and talented colleagues committed to lifelong learning






App Academy is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status. We believe strongly that technology companies benefit from diversity and encourage applicants from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

title: Software Developer - Web Frontend at Esri (Ottawa, ON, Canada)
description:
Are you passionate about creating good user experiences on the web? So are we! In the past few years, Esri has put a large effort into making design tools accessible and powerful for experts, stakeholders, and the public. We are dedicated to continually pushing the boundaries of GIS, and you can play a key role in our mission.


At Esri, we develop web applications based on our ArcGIS API for JavaScript. Join our team of exceptional software engineers to design and implement our next generation of web GIS applications, our JavaScript API, and our cloud solution ArcGIS Online. 





RESPONSIBILITIES




  • Develop the UX/UI of a new suite of web apps

  • Conceptualize, design, implement, and test innovative user interface components on top of our JavaScript API

  • Work closely with JavaScript API software developers and product engineers in a highly interactive and creative environment

  • Interact with users to identify and articulate their needs

  • Research and apply state-of-the-art UX practices





REQUIREMENTS




  • Excellent JavaScript/HTML/CSS skills and good sense for software architecture

  • 2+ years of industry experience in UX/UI development including hands-on product design, team programming, and experience with building and shipping software products

  • Strong passion for detailed, innovative, and empathic design, combined with well-rounded design skills (interaction, UI, visual, and motion design)

  • Excellent spatial sense and a good intuition for the aesthetics and technical aspects of information visualization or cartography

  • Excellent communiction skills to clearly articulate the reasons behind design decisions

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment with frequent releases and tight schedules

  • Bachelor’s or master’s in computer science, engineering, mathematics, GIS, or related field, depending on position level 






RECOMMENDED QUALIFICATIONS




  • Experience with some of these web technologies: TypeScript, ES6, Ember, Angular, React

  • Experience with CSS post-processing

  • Experience with accessibility

  • Experience with internationalization

  • Familiarity with GIS applications and technologies

title: Full Stack Web Developer at Spiria Digital (Gatineau, QC, Canada)
description:
Nous vous remercions pour votre intérêt envers un poste chez Spiria, cependant nous vous ne pouvons accepter que des candidats locaux.


We thank you all for your interest in a postition at Spiria, however please note that we may only accept local applicants.


Nous sommes à la recherche d’un développeur multidisciplinaire d’applications web possédant une connaissance avancée en JavaScript et des frameworks tels que React, Vue, Angular. Vous serez l’expert en la matière par votre compréhension des différents langages et du processus complet de développement. Vous contribuerez à une équipe de développement web multidisciplinaire de près d’une centaine de personnes dont plus d’une trentaine basée à Gatineau.


En tant que développeur chez Spiria, vous devrez…



  • Écrire, modifier, réviser,optimiseret déboguer du code informatique;

  • Participer aux activités de test et de contrôle de qualité telles que décrites dans la stratégie de tests;

  • Assurer un rôle-conseil au sein des équipes de développement;

  • Réviser lecode et l’architecture afin de s’assurer qu’ils respectent les standards de développement de l’entreprise, comme les bonnes pratiques de l’industrie;


Les clés de votre succès



  • Excellentes aptitudes interpersonnelles et en communications;

  • À l’aise dans un environnement à délais serrés;

  • Maîtrise du français ou de l’anglais et être ouvert à travailler dans un environnement bilingue;



  • Au moins 3 années d’expérience professional en développement web;

  • Expérience professionnelle avec JavaScript;

  • Maîtrise des librairies et cadres de développement (Framework) tels que React, Vue ou Angular.

  • Expérience avec les tests unitaires.


Ce que nous offrons:



  • Environnement de travail amusant et motivant;

  • Horaire flexible;

  • Multiples possibilités d’apprentissage;

  • Projets stimulants;

  • Fruits, jus et café illimités, parce que café = code!


Apprenez à nous connaître!


Propulsée par la passion des technologies, Spiria conçoit et développe des solutions numériques sur mesure pour les entreprises à la pointe de leur industrie qui veulent optimiser leurs processus, offrir plus de valeur ajoutée à leurs clients et générer de la croissance par la transformation numérique. Tout en grandissant, nous restons fidèles à nos amours d’origine : qualité logicielle, innovation technologique et création collaborative.


https://spiria.com/fr


https://www.facebook.com/spiria/


https://twitter.com/spiriadigital


https://www.linkedin.com/company/spiria/


https://www.spiria.com/fr/blogue/


***


We are seeking a web application developer with advanced knowledge of JavaScript and frameworks like React, Vue, Angular. You will be a subject-matter expert due to your understanding of these languages and of the entire development process. You will contribute to a multidisciplinary web development team of some one hundred members, of which about 30 are based in Gatineau.


As a Developer at Spiria, you will…



  • Write, modify, review, optimize and debug code;

  • Participate in testing and quality control activities as per the testing strategy;

  • Have the chance to act as an advisor within the development teams;

  • Review peer code and architecture to ensure compliance with company development standards and industry best practices;

  • Provide technical leadership within the project team.


What you’ll need to succeed



  • Excellent people skills and communication skills;

  • Ability to work with tight deadlines;

  • Fluent in French or English, comfortable with working in a bilingual environment;

  • At least 3 years’ professional experience in Web development;

  • Professional experience with the JavaScript stack;

  • Knowledge of the most common libraries and development frameworks such as React, Vue and Angular;

  • Experience with unit testing.


How we like to give back



  • A fun, motivating work environment;

  • Flexible schedule and remote work policy;

  • Several different learning and development opportunities;

  • Interesting and diverse projects;

  • Constant supply of fruits, juice and coffee. Because coffee = code!


Get to know us!


Powered by a passion for technology, Spiria designs and develops custom digital solutions for industry leaders who want to run better businesses, deliver more value to their customers and generate growth through digital transformation. As we grow, we stay true to what we love: quality software, technological innovation, and creative collaboration.

https://www.facebook.com/spiria/
https://twitter.com/spiriadigital
https://www.linkedin.com/company/spiria/
https://www.spiria.com/en/blog/

title: Full Stack Developer- ecommerce at CaptiveAire (Durham, NC)
description:
Company Profile:


CaptiveAire is the nation’s leading manufacturer of commercial kitchen ventilation systems, and now provides a complete solution of fans, heaters, ductwork and HVAC equipment.  For over 40 years, we’ve led the industry with innovative technologies, unmatched service, competitive pricing, and rapid lead times.


CaptiveAire maintains a network of over 90 sales offices in the U.S. and Canada and six strategically located manufacturing plants in North Carolina, Iowa, Oklahoma, California, Pennsylvania and Florida.


Job Description: This role will be joining a small team who are working on external facing web applications for end customers. This position is specifically for our Software as a Service (SaaS) web applications. These include configuration and purchasing of our products. You can view them here:


Fan Sizing/Configuration: https://specbuilder.captiveaire.com


Parts Purchasing: https://store.captiveaire.com


This position requires someone that has a passion for clean software design using C# and .NET. You should have knowledge of both server and client with a primary focus on server side build out and developer infrastructure. This position will also involve helping with new application features and maintenance of the existing codebase as secondary responsibilities


Required Skills:



  • 5+ years of continuous experience with C#; specifically. v4.0+ is preferred

  • 5+ years of Typescript/Javascript/ES6

  • 5+ years of experience using SQL Server; T/SQL, or equivalent relational database

  • AngularJS or similar client-side framework

  • SOLID/DDD/CQRS patterns knowledge


Preferred Skills:



  • Dependency Injection

  • .NET Core/WebAPI5

  • CQRS/ES/Actor knowledge

  • Open source contributor

  • Linux Knowledge

  • Docker/Docker Compose/Swarm Knowledge

  • E-Commerce/Manufacturing industry experience

  • NoSQL experience (MongoDb preferred)

  • Client-side build knowledge (Webpack/NPM/Gulp)


Benefits:



  • Medical, dental and vision insurance

  • Disability & life insurance based upon election of medical insurance

  • Paid holidays, vacation, and sick days based upon tenure

  • 401k with employer match

  • Flexible spending account (FSA)


Salary:


We offer a competitive salary based upon experience


CaptiveAire hires developers that are expected to be independent with very little hand-holding and technical training required. You should be comfortable taking on medium to large projects and/or features and be able to bootstrap them from the ground-up. You should also be comfortable diving into well-entrenched, custom, in-house applications which drive the entire company. We are easy-going, don't have a lot of processes to get in our way, and basically want to deliver top-notch, quality software to run the company. As part of the CaptiveAire IT team, you will have many opportunities to contribute directly to the success of the company.


CaptiveAire is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We review applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Backend (UK) at Numbrs () (allows remote)
description:
At Numbrs, our engineers don’t just develop things – we have an impact. We change the way how people are managing their finances by building the best products and services for our users. 

Numbrs engineers are innovators, problem-solvers, and hard-workers who are building solutions in big data, mobile technology and much more. We look for professional, highly skilled engineers who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced, value-driven environment.

Join our dedicated technology team that builds massively scalable systems, designs low latency architecture solutions and leverages machine learning technology to turn financial data into action. Want to push the limit of personal finance management? Join Numbrs.


Job Description


You will be a part of a team that is responsible for developing, releasing, monitoring and troubleshooting large scale micro-service based distributed systems with high transaction volume. You enjoy learning new things and are passionate about developing new features, maintaining existing code, fixing bugs, and contributing to overall system design. You are a great teammate who thrives in a dynamic environment with rapidly changing priorities.


All candidates will have



  • a Bachelor's or higher degree in technical field of study or equivalent practical experience

  • experience with high volume production grade distributed systems

  • experience with micro-service based architecture

  • experience with software engineering best practices, coding standards, code reviews, testing and operations

  • hands-on experience with Spring Boot

  • professional experience in writing readable, testable and self-sustaining code

  • knowledge of AWS, Kubernetes, and Docker

Ideally, candidates will also have



  • experience with Big Data technologies such as Kafka, Spark, and Cassandra

  • fluent with functional, imperative and object-­oriented languages;

  • experience with Scala, C++, or Golang

title: Analyste Programmeur .NET full stack at Novexe (Montreal, QC, Canada)
description:
Drouin RH est fière de s'associer à Novexe dans sa croissance à Montréal. Novexe, formée d'une récente fusion d'entreprises bien établies en développement logiciel, offre de la consultation en solutions infonuagiques. Elle embauche et forme des horlogers du monde digital à fort potentiel, qui veulent vivre une expérience de travail riche en rebondissements, dans un environnement de travail des plus stimulants.

Joins-toi à la nouvelle équipe de Montréal en pleine croissance! Tu travailleras dans un environnement technique principalement constitué de la stack .NET, SQL, C#, AngularJS & Azure sont quelques bons exemples. 



  • Défi: développement et intégration de fonctions avancées dans un système de gestion d'abonnement

  • Besoins: tu dois pouvoir prendre en charge de façon autonome le développement de fonctionnalités spécifiques, tout en étant capable de mettre ses compétences au profit de son équipe, sur place comme à distance

  • Expérience: quelques années d'expérience dans un contexte de développement logiciel professionnel 

  • Savoir-être: habile communicateur démontrant un grand niveau d’autonomie

  • Savoir-faire: aptitudes et réflexes bien développés dans les technologies citées 

  • Lieu de travail: Centre-ville de Montréal, métro McGill


Une nouvelle carrière pour certains, le tremplin vers une carrière d'un autre niveau pour d'autres
 Montréal regorge de projets incroyablement captivants en développement web. Et ta boîte de courriel et de messagerie LinkedIn regorge probablement d’offres d’emploi de toute part. Mais connaissais-tu Novexe?

C'est la chance de se positionner dans une équipe locale en croissance, avec une organisation déjà solidement établie à Québec. Certaines équipes sont sur des projets clés en main, d'autres travaillent à titres d'experts en clientèle, ainsi que sur des produits développés à l'interne et vendus par la suite à des entreprises privées et organismes publics.

Travailler avec les dernières technologies, sur des projets stimulants et dans un environnement entièrement cloud... Rien de mieux pour se garder motivé!

Pour entrer en contact avec nous, soumets ta candidature via le formulaire. Tu peux aussi communiquer avec l'équipe RH à candidature@drouinrh.com, ou avec Gabriel Beaudoin à gbeaudoin@drouinrh.com L'utilisation du masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.

title: Full Stack Web Developer at Art & Logic, Inc. () (allows remote)
description:
Art+Logic is looking for Full Stack Web Developers to work with us on interesting custom software projects. We’ve been around since 1991, and we’re still going strong. 


Our ideal developers thrive in the environment of variety and challenge that is inherent to custom software development, working with us in a long-term relationship over many projects for numerous clients.


Since we do custom software development, the skills and needs for each project can vary widely. This goes beyond just the languages we use, to the industries and problem domains we work in. We look for generalists; most importantly those who are excited to learn and take on new challenges. You can expect to grow both in your strength and your versatility when working here. We want to help you do so.


We work remotely all over the United States and Canada. We expect you to be able to work well on your own and comfortably with teams. You won’t have someone looking over your shoulder so you'll need to be communicative and reliable, and hold yourself accountable. We depend on each other.


Art+Logic is run by humans, who work and create using technology. Things can go wrong and we need to respond to the unexpected by being kind, considerate, fair, flexible, and calm. We treat our clients and peers as respectfully as we would like to be treated.


Here’s an example of some projects we’ve worked on recently, so you can better understand the wide range of projects and challenges we undertake:



  • Implementing a Django-based DoD CAC card login

  • Writing a data model layer using SQLAlchemy to provide an object-oriented view of a legacy relational database schema. This model layer provides all business rules and data integrity using advanced python3 features. This data model in turn serves a REST API (python-pyramid) consumed by an advanced single-page web application written with Marionette (Backbone)

  • Created Windows tablet application to communicate with client's modbus hardware and upload data to Python/Django/Vue webapp for analysis and display


What we want from you: (aka: skills)


We currently have a high demand for Python, specifically Django, and JavaScript web framework experience. 


However, more important than that, we are looking for people who are curious and looking for opportunities to learn. People who like learning and creating on their own. Those who are able to drive themselves or even lead others when completing projects. Developers who are able to organize and express their ideas. Communication is paramount here.


Relationship Details:


We are looking for Contractors (1099) for long term open-ended relationships. Work hours are flexible; requiring reasonable overlap with normal working hours to support team communications, and not just nights and weekends. Our rates range from $35-$55/hour. We are ONLY looking for people in the United States and Canada.


We want you to enjoy working for us, and to be able to have a life outside of work. Since you're not commuting you can embrace the freedom of working from where you enjoy living, and use the saved time for your personal life and relationships. We don’t ask our developers to work consistently over 40 hours/week. 


It’s important to us in the hiring process that we allow developers to demonstrate their abilities by actually developing something, because a list of previous employers or educational background aren’t always indicators of what someone can do. All applicants are asked to submit a solution to a programming challenge that emulates a task we might assign on a project.

title: Full Stack JavaScript Developer - Junior (Remote) at GitStart () (allows remote)

title: Remote Senior Full Stack PHP/React Developer at Scalable Path () (allows remote)
description:
Scalable Path is looking for a Senior Full Stack PHP/React Developer to join the team and work on a client project. This is a remote, full-time position.



CLIENT COMPANY DESCRIPTION:


The client is building a tool for the Clinical Trial industry that helps them recruit, qualify, schedule, and manage clinical trial participants.



DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


You will be building a web application that manages the intake and onboarding of new users/patients (includes a dynamic questionnaire with multiple user journeys, video conferencing with a doctor, and scheduling with multiple facility sites). Additionally, you will be building a CRM/Management dashboard with multiple user personas/permissions to manage different users/patients throughout their patient journey.



RELATIONSHIPS - WHO YOU'LL BE WORKING WITH:


You will be reporting to the Head of Product, initially as the sole developer on this project. More developers may join the project later. There is also a designer involved in the project who will be providing wireframes and final designs. The client is in the America/Los Angeles (-07:00) PDT time zone.



REQUIRED SKILLS:


- Strong written and spoken English skills


- PHP (Laravel strongly preferred)


- MySQL


- JavaScript (React)


- CSS


- HTML


- Ability to lay down the initial framework of an application (fresh start)


- Comfort with scrappy startup environments


- Web application experience with mobile-friendly/responsive site design.


- Comfort integrating with various APIs, such as Twilio video integration.


- Ability to give technical guidance/advice on what tools and architectural decisions to make based on requirements.


- Experience setting up hosting and deployment on AWS (DevOps)



DESIRED (NICE-TO-HAVE) SKILLS:


- Bootstrap


- Establish best practices for eventually attaining SOC 2 / HiTrust and other similar security attestations.





START DATE:


May 04, 2020



EXPECTED CONTRACT DURATION:


Ongoing



HOURLY RATE:


The pay rate for this role is from $35 to $55 USD per hour, depending on experience and capability.

title: Java Backend Developer at Leaf Logistics () (allows remote)
description:
As a Back End Engineer, you will work closely together with architects and engineers to advance the development of our modern, micro-services based platform, and deliver exciting new product features to our customers. You will contribute to the architectural and infrastructural design of our applications, and leverage your experience to optimize services for performance, scalability, and security. The role will challenge you to work in a highly agile environment, address strategic and implementational topics, and work on various parts of the application stack, including the core trading services and matching engine.


Responsibilities



  • Build high-quality, scalable, and resilient applications and (web) services that support Leaf’s trading and analytics platform

  • Contribute to the architectural and infrastructural design of the platform and its components

  • Support planning of tasks using technical and functional expertise

  • Support leadership in establishing, documenting, and enforcing technology standards, best practices and approaches to be leveraged by the engineering team

  • Mentor and support other team members through code reviews and continuous feedback

  • Take initiative to research, troubleshoot and resolve bugs and issues as they arise

  • Be a flexible team player, stepping into a variety of roles, as needed


Qualifications



  •  4+ years experience in development back ends with Java 8, incl. features like Streams, Serialization, Multi-Threading, Annotations

  • Advanced knowledge of Spring/Spring Boot and ORM frameworks like Hibernate, JPA

  • Strong experience in designing and developing modern, distributed, microservices-based applications with RESTful APIs, with particular attention to security, scalability, availability, and performance

  • Profound understanding of object oriented programming and design patterns

  • Strong experience in relational database design and development (preferably with PostgreSQL) and understanding of NoSQL databases and in-memory stores (e.g. Redis, DynamoDB, Hadoop)

  • Experience working with event/message based communication platforms such as Kafka, ActiveMQ etc

  • Working proficiency in build and development tools (e.g. Gradle, Jenkins, SonarQube)

  • Experience with test frameworks (e.g. jUnit, Mockito)

  • Preferred: Knowledge in cloud technologies/infrastructure (esp. AWS)

  • Preferred: Prior experience in designing and developing financial systems (e.g. trading, risk, or compliance systems) and/or logistics systems

  • Preferred: Experience with other languages, such as Python

  • Preferred: Experience in front end development using modern JavaScript frameworks like React/Redux, Angular, Knockout, Ember, etc.

  • Strong analytical, project leadership and communication skills

  • Ability to work both self-directed and collaboratively to deliver results in a fast paced, startup environment

  • Unbelievably positive attitude, sense of humor and/or thick skin

  • Consummate team player, able to wear multiple hats, and assist team members when needed

title: Frontend Developer at Banjo (South Jordan, UT)
description:
Want to be part of a tech company that is changing the world for the better? 


Most companies have a mission statement. Banjo has a mission—to save lives and reduce human suffering by ethically using A.I. to get everyone live, validated information, so they can make better decisions, faster. 


Banjo is the world’s first Live-Time Intelligence platform that gives decision-makers the ability to KNOW INFORMATION NOW, to understand what is happening live, anywhere. With Banjo you will know more, so you can do more. Imagine how our world will change when decision-makers know exactly what is happening, where it is happening, the moment it happens.


Banjo is looking for talented engineers to join our frontend developers who push boundaries and make sophisticated single-page applications. You will think both analytically and creatively to build flexible and high-performance client applications that support a real-time user experience. We are looking for engineers who are focused on performance, scale, and quality in everything they do. We move fast but also put a premium on precision. Our team members have diverse backgrounds but all of us share a passion for solving challenges and doing it on a small, agile team which means everyone has a huge impact.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Work as part of a focused, committed team that values contribution from everyone and expects everyone to bring creative ideas to bear in solving some of the hardest technology problems in the industry

  • Have an opportunity to work with data and technology seen nowhere else (seriously)

  • Develop, monitor, and maintain services that power the Banjo’s live understanding of what’s happening in the world. This includes systems that bring in real-time data from hundreds of thousands of sources, manage analysis of such data, and manage storage and propagation of that data to downstream products

  • Inherent curiosity and ability to learn new technologies, plus the ability to figure out the best tools for a given problem. We don’t suffer from ‘Not Invented Here’ syndrome and try hard to use the best tool for the job


EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE



  • 7+ years of experience with frontend engineering with proven ability to build and extend customer frameworks

  • Expert knowledge of JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 as well as experience with HTML Templating, CSS Preprocessors, Node/Rails

  • Extensive experience with any of the major Frameworks (React, Angular, Vue, etc.)

  • Eagerness to tackle big problems that have unknown solutions at the outset

  • Focus on using data and objective, empirical methods to understand where we are and how to improve

  • Experience working on small, fast-moving, high capability teams

  • Experience designing and leading important systems software projects, using modern languages and technologies. We don’t care as much about any one specific piece of technology expertise as with your ability and experience solving hard problems.


PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES OF THE SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE



  • Possesses an innate sense of urgency to deliver for the business while also effectively working collaboratively as part of a team



  • Owner mentality



  • Effective time management, organization and prioritizing skills. Ability to manage and prioritize multiple deliverables and to meet deadlines

  • High attention to detail, able to complete tasks quickly

  • Proven success delivering results individually and as part of a team in a fast-paced, demanding, high-growth environment

  • Continuous improvement mentality with an ability to evaluate processes, seek out and implement internal or external best practices

  • Creative problem solver with a demonstrated ability to ‘think outside the box’ when confronting challenges


WORK ENVIRONMENT


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The term "qualified individual with a disability" means an individual with a disability who, with or without reasonable accommodation, can perform the essential functions of the position. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to communicate professionally in person, over the telephone, through email and other electronic means, move about the office, handle various types of media and equipment, and visually or otherwise identify, observe and assess. The employee is occasionally required to lift up to 10 pounds and is required to travel unless otherwise specified in the job description.


NOTICE


At Banjo, we value inclusion and embrace diversity. Banjo is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. Banjo prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual identity, gender identity, marital status, veteran status, nationality, citizenship, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or any other unlawful consideration. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


The intent of this job description is to provide a representative and level of the types of duties and responsibilities that will be required of positions given this title and shall not be construed as a declaration of the total of the specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Employees may be directed to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically presented in this description. 


Candidates must pass a background check and drug test to be considered for this position.

title: Paid Research Study for Developers With Experience with Microservices at User Research International () (allows remote)
description:

Working with some of the biggest companies in the industry, we aim to improve your experience via paid research studies. Whether it be the latest video game or productivity tools, we value your feedback and experience. We are currently conducting a research study called Coding Tool Study. We are looking for currently employed Full-Time Developers who use .Net Framework. This study is a one-time Remote Study via an online meeting. We’re offering $150 for participation in a one hour session and $200 for a 2 hour session in this study. These studies provide a platform for our researchers to receive feedback for an existing or upcoming products or software. We have included the survey link for the study below. Taking the survey will help determine if you fit the profile requirements. Completing this survey does not guarantee you will be selected to participate.  If it's a match, we'll reach out with a formal confirmation and any additional details you may need.

Study: Coding Tool Study
