title: Site Reliability Engineer at Everlaw (Oakland, CA)
description:
Join a growing, venture-funded startup! We manage hundreds of terabytes of data and dozens of AWS Instances across multiple VPCs. Our clients use Everlaw to operate on mission-critical and highly confidential data. Our Infrastructure team, with the help of our full-stack engineers, has laid the groundwork for our infrastructure, and we are looking to expand the team to take our infrastructure tooling and workflows to the next level. We have a history of building reliable software (we had 99.97% non-maintenance uptime last year). You’ll help us keep it that way—and get even better—as we expand our offerings and the amount of data that we host. You’ll become an early member of our Infrastructure team, working closely with our other team members and developers to improve our site reliability with respect to:



  • Monitoring and driving improvements to the performance and reliability of our servers and services

  • Improving and maintaining the tooling, logging, and alerting to enable that monitoring

  • Developing our on-call program by improving our playbooks, tooling, and best practices

  • Participating in the on-call rotation

  • Contributing to redundancy and failover mechanisms for our production architecture

  • Participating in new release deployments

  • Aiding in critical issue resolution as needed (during work hours or otherwise)


Qualifications




    • You have experience administering a cloud environment and Ubuntu Linux servers

    • You are familiar with the command line and scripting

    • You are obsessed with automation and process improvement

    • You have the ability to debug and diagnose technical problems

    • You are known for excellent communication and collaboration skills

    • You are comfortable administering an always-on platform

    • You are comfortable with autonomy and know when to take initiative

    • You are committed to security best practices



Pluses




    • You have past experience developing and participating in SRE teams

    • You are fluent in one or more compiled languages

    • You have specific expertise in Amazon Web Services



Benefits




    • Competitive salary 

    • Substantial equity 

    • 401k with company matching

    • Health, dental, and vision

    • Flexible Spending Accounts for health and dependent care expenses

    • Paid parental leave and sick leave

    • Seventeen paid vacation days plus ten bankable federal holidays 

    • Annual allocation for Learning & Development opportunities and applicable professional membership dues

    • Company-sponsored life and disability insurance



Perks




    • Work in Downtown Oakland, just steps from the BART line and dozens of restaurants

    • Select your preference of hardware (Mac or PC) and customize your desk setup

    • Bond over team lunches and out-of-the-box events 

    • Voted one of "San Francisco Bay Area's Best and Brightest Companies" and one of "Inc Magazine's Best Workplaces"

title: Python Developer at Picnic (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Picnic is an app-only supermarket. We’re data-driven with software at our core. Our world-class developers write immaculate code to support the world’s fastest-growing supermarket. We’re on a quest for like-minded people to be part of the future of digital grocery shopping.


Where you fit in


Our developers are integrated, involved, and essential to each part of our company. From route planning, scaling our customer analytics to handle millions of messages, to how many bananas we should have in our warehouse on a Thursday – they write, plan, and predict.


As one of our Python Engineers, you take ownership of projects, learn, and work collaboratively with your colleagues. You constantly design, test, evolve and evaluate the nuts and bolts of our operation while offering a creative and analytical approach.


The high-quality code that stems from your fingertips is stylish, sexy, and robust. But you also love to share, teach, and guide others in their quest for excellence. You get more out of seeing someone else build something great under your guidance than building it yourself.


We don’t hide our developments. We open-source with the community that helped us grow. If you require more motivation to apply - check out our page: http://picnic.tech.


What challenges await you



  • Design, develop, and test new data-related features for our platform

  • Create high-quality code that is scalable, reliable and reusable

  • Help our analysts with any engineering questions or challenges they may face

  • Optimize supply chain systems to maximize operational performance and efficiency

  • Analyze and improve the scalability and security of our data platform

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables


Who you are



  • Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent

  • Expert in Python (at least 3 years of experience)

  • Experience with relational databases and SQL

  • Experience with NoSQL solutions like MongoDB, Elastic Search, and RabbitMQ 

  • Experience with creating and maintaining Python packages

  • Experience with building microservices


‍ Technologies you'll use



  • Python 3.7

  • RabbitMQ

  • Pipenv and Git

  • PostgreSQL, MongoDB

  • AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Travis CI


Hungry for more? Check out https://stackshare.io/picnic-technologies for an overview of our tech stack.

title: Senior Backend Engineer - Forecasting at Glovo (Barcelona, Spain)
description:
At Glovo we are constantly looking for passionate and experienced engineers to join our team Barcelona office for the dispatching team. You are someone who loves working in a high-paced startup environment. You enjoy tackling different problems and take pride in delivering strategic, well designed, flexible and easy to use solutions. You work well with other top-level engineers and value constructive feedback that helps you grow as a professional. You are not afraid of getting your hands dirty with a platform or technology that you don’t know, and are always eager to learn something new.


BE A PART OF A TEAM WHERE YOU WILL:




  • Develop software using modern engineering approaches and agile principles


  • Own your deliverables from start to finish


  • Deliver high quality solutions


  • Participate in high-level technical decisions


  • Make our technology and our team scale as the business grows


  • Mentor and empower other developers around you


  • Not be limited to one product but be involved in all aspects of Glovo


  • Be an active participant on our Engineering community by contributing to committees, RFCs, workshops


YOU HAVE:




  • Computer science or similar degree


  • 5+ years of relevant experience


  • Strong Java Skills and deep understanding of the JVM: memory management, multithreading, profiling, etc.


  • Extensive knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming and Software architecture, etc.


  • Strong will to adhere to best practices in development: Solid Principles, Clean Architecture, etc.


  • Sound experience with API design, relational databases and ORMs


  • You have shipped and maintained distributed services with a DevOps mindset


  • You know how to deal with complex codebases


  • Ability to empathize with a diverse range of engineers


  • Communicate well and be willing to engage with your teammates in group problem solving


  • Good English


NICE-TO-HAVES:




  • Experience running code in the cloud and using laaS and PaaS solutions, especially AWS


  • Experience with Docker and/or Kubernetes


  • Kotlin or Go skills


  • Native mobile skills (iOS-Swift and/or Android-Kotlin)


EXPERIENCE OUR GLOVO LIFE BENEFITS:




  • Enticing Phantom Shares plan


  • Attractive Relocation package (if applicable ;))


  • Comprehensive Private Health Insurance


  • Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food


  • Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)


  • Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!


  • Discounted Gym memberships


  • Flexible working environment


WHAT YOU’LL FIND WHEN WORKING AT GLOVO:




  • Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.


  • Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.


  • Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.


  • Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.


  • Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

    If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!



Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia. 


For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

title: Software Engineering Manager, enabling engineers to help scientists cure cancer at Synthace Ltd. (London, UK)
description:
Software Engineering Manager - London


WEST LONDON, PERMANENT - FULL TIME


We're looking for a technical Software Engineering Manager who loves helping software engineering teams be as effective as they can be, and wants to apply this valuable skill in a business with a with a strong and vital purpose - creating the software for a revolution in computer aided biology. 


THE PROJECT 


Named by the World Economic Forum as one of the world's 30 Technology Pioneers 2016, and one of Gartner's 'Cool Vendors in Life Sciences' 2018, Synthace is completely revolutionising biology in a way that has never been done before!


This is made possible through our revolutionary cloud based platform for designing biological experiments, simulating them, translating instructions for automated lab equipment, and visualising complex data sets from the results.


All of this is done by Antha, which is already impacting how scientists work with biology in major companies like Microsoft, BASF, Merck and GSK.


Antha lowers the level of entry for scientists wanting to introduce automation to their work, while allowing specialist technicians to get even more out of the existing equipment in the labs. It is directly contributing to faster, more efficient research into hard to cure diseases such as Cancer. 


If social impact is important to you, it doesn't get much better than this. 


RESPONSIBILITIES 


Reporting to the VP Engineering, you'll manage and coach 10-15 software developers within our growing team (likely to be ~40 engineers in 2020). You will have primary responsibility for the functioning of the team, its priorities and productivity. You will have delivery responsibility for certain projects but are likely to be often working cross-functionally with other parts of the engineering team to deliver on our ambitious roadmap. 


ABOUT YOU 


You will have come from a development background but have recognised that you get a particular kick out of achieving results by bringing teams together to solve complex problems.


You will be serious about supporting and empowering engineers to be as good as they can be. Ours is a culture of trust, empowerment, transparency and teamwork. This will need to be your philosophy also. It's not about individual heroics, it is about enabling the team to perform.


You will have several years’ experience in an engineering management function (following a successful development career) in a technically complex space - preferably delivering business SaaS solutions. You need to be able to win and keep the trust of talented senior engineers and also develop more junior talent. You need to be comfortable giving engineers the space to make technical decisions but provide support and guidance when required.


You don’t need to understand computer aided biology but it will be important that you want to learn, and that you see the opportunity to grow your abilities in a new area as a serious attraction to the role. We take our work very seriously and we want you to develop the same passion.


WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:



  • Hire, grow and manage a great software development team

  • Guide, coach and mentor software engineers through regular 1 on 1s and professional development plans

  • Support tech leads within engineering teams to get the most out of individual contributors

  • Provide project management and technical leadership when required

  • Work with VP Engineering and product management to develop, refine and communicate the roadmap

  • Do detailed resource planning and allocation; make the case for recruitment as required

  • Work with other engineering managers, tech leads and VP Eng to drive consistent software development standards and practices across the engineering team

  • Work with the engineering team to design technical solutions as necessary

  • Work with customers and partners where necessary to develop solution specifications and plans

  • Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders (biology team, business development) to ensure all are appraised of project status and issues

  • Commit to and deliver on project objectives

  • Nurture and encourage the existing friendly, collaborative culture


WHAT WE'RE IDEALLY LOOKING FOR:



  • 5 successful years as an individual contributor developer

  • 3+ years as an engineering manager in a complex environment

  • Experience coaching and enabling engineers in a high performance culture

  • Exposure to Agile methodologies

  • Exposure to product management methodologies

  • Confident and experienced in interacting with customers and external partners

  • Commercially minded and able to guide the engineering team on making commercially smart technical decisions

  • Relevant academic qualifications or equivalent experience


BONUS POINTS FOR:



  • Exposure to science-based business domain

  • Background in cloud computing

  • Product experience that includes physical devices (e.g. robotics)

  • Exposure to our technology stack (React, Typescript, Go, Google Cloud Platform, Kubernetes)


WHY JOIN SYNTHACE?



  • Work with genuinely extraordinary people

  • Open, collaborative, and friendly culture

  • Challenging, groundbreaking and exciting work

  • Competitive salary & benefits, 10% pension, equity, and more! (Full list on careers page)

  • Chance to be a part of the 'fourth industrial revolution', helping us to create tools and systems that allow scientists to do things like cure Cancer faster!

title: Teamlead Data Science / Machine Learning (f/m/div) for our venture PAIR Finance at finleap GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
description:
Your role


You will be responsible to develop and implement a vision for our Data Science team and be the strategic and operational leader for the development of a growing team. You collaborate on an iterative design process and lead the data scientists in all the related topics. You will develop meaningful data models using Python and data mining/ML methods. You also concept, implement analytical models including creative designs for visualizing large amount of data/data sets. Experimenting new technologies and best practices to grow technically and finding clever solutions to encounter unique challenges on the way is your forte


Our requirements



  • Strong theoretical background in probability theory, applied statistics, machine learning and reinforcement learning

  • Experience in Python and numerical processing libraries

  • Experience with MySQL or PostgreSQL

  • Successfully built and deployed machine learning and/or reinforcement learning models in the production environment

  • Ability to model financial and behavioural data mathematically as well as statistically

  • Communication skills are very good, high proficiency in English and ideally in German


What do we offer



  • You will have the opportunity to participate in one of the most innovative Fintech start-ups in Europe and to further develop the company, as well as to permanently change the debt collection market

  • You will be able to make your own decisions and take responsibilities for your team and the results

  • We will double our size within the next two years, which provides you with a great growth opportunity and grow together with us in the challenges of a revolutionary concept in a very traditional industry

  • You will work with professionals and successful entrepreneurs and you will be part of a strong international team that combines success and fun in a young and dynamic environment - you will be part of the "Pair Finance family"

  • You will be part of one of Europe's fastest growing FinTechs communities: PAIR Finance is part of the finleap ecosystem, which already founded over 15 internationally successful companies

  • You will be able to connect with Berlin via the innovative and technology-driven start-up scene


About us


PAIR Finance is a Fintech company developing a revolutionary concept for managing debt collection. We combine multi-channel digital communication with proven data-driven behavioural research and AI to accelerate and personalise the collection process. We assess the situation of each debtor individually and tailor our approach accordingly, thereby achieving higher repayment rates without straining the customer relationship.


"Based in Berlin", supported by our investors Zalando, finleap and IONIQ, and honoured by Handelsblatt with the ‘Diamond Star’ award in the ‘Later Stage Fintech' category, PAIR Finance offers an excellent opportunity for deep-dive in the fintech industry.



We are looking forward to your application!

title: Software Engineer, Infrastructure at Asana (San Francisco, CA)
description:
Software Engineer, Infrastructure


San Francisco


The Infrastructure team builds the foundation we need to support our web and mobile applications, as well as our robust API. We build and operate the software that enables Asana’s security, scalability, and speed. Each day, we combine industry best-practices and innovation to support this product-focused company.


We’re looking for an Infrastructure Engineering Generalist to build and operate software to make Asana secure, scalable and fast. You’ll be combining industry best-practices and your innovation with a ground-breaking reactive framework. You’ll design software to process, query, search, analyze, and store data for applications that are continually growing in scale. You will work with a world-class team of engineers on deploying and operating existing systems, and building new ones for problems that are unique to our problem space.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design, build and operate services that are the foundation of Asana’s collaboration and communication software

  • Design and implement tooling and automation for clustering, scaling, monitoring and alerting

  • Participate in the on-call rotation, investigate and resolve production problems


REQUIREMENTS



  • Have expertise in programming and computer science, and have a strong interest in distributed systems

  • Focus on eliminating risks and build reliable, scalable and performant systems

  • Are looking for an environment where you and your teammates empower one another to become the best versions of yourselves


Does the above sound like it might be you? Then we’d love to hear from you. Our goal is to provide a hiring and working experience in which all people know they are equally respected and valued. So whatever it is that makes you unique—your gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, citizenship, educational background, socioeconomic status—we value it, and we’d love to see what you might add to our team.

title: Senior Machine Learning Software Engineer (m/f/d) at Quoori GmbH (Hamburg, Germany)
description:
The Role


Are you looking to influence the design and development of a consumer product that will touch millions of people? Are you a self-starter with a passion for both your work and the start-up adventure? Do you have exceptional skills in statistics and programming? Are you looking to play a foundational role at a very quickly-growing company? If yes, we should talk.


We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning (ML) Software Engineer (m/f/d) to help us design and develop machine learning and deep learning systems. This person in this role will be implementing appropriate ML algorithms and running machine learning tests and experiments. Your ultimate goal will be to shape and build efficient self-learning applications. 


What you will do: 



  • Design machine learning systems

  • Study and transform data science prototypes

  • Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools

  • Develop machine learning applications according to requirements

  • Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods

  • Run machine learning tests and experiments

  • Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results

  • Train and retrain systems when necessary

  • Create new and extend existing ML libraries and frameworks

  • Own designs that have an impact on the fundamental architecture of the product

  • Provide technical recommendations & expertise to senior leaders


 Desired Qualifications/Requirements:



  • Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role

  • Masters in Computer science or equivalent long term business experience

  • Strong knowledge and hands on experience with Java or C++

  • Ability to implement algorithms and optimize for processing performance

  • Proven experience with examples of AI driven solutions

Why you’ll love working at Quoori:

Benefits

title: Software Engineer I (Java, .Net, Python, Kotli and continuous-integration) at British Columbia Investment Management Corporation (BCI) (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
description:
Reporting to the Manager, Technology Integration, the Software Engineer I is responsible for the development and support of key enterprise software integrations. The Software Engineer I collaborates and communicates with members of cross-functional teams and delivers business value to internal customers. She/he will develop integrations in an Agile hybrid environment and enable the effective and efficient delivery of quality products.


The position can be based in either Vancouver or Victoria with travel between the two cities.


QUALIFICATIONS


MUST HAVE:



  • Bachelor’s degree in Technology, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field

  • A minimum of 2 years experience as Developer or Software Engineer with responsibility for development, testing and production support

  • Development experience using programming languages such as: Java, .Net, Python, Kotlin

  • Experience with version control tools such as Git, TFS, SVN

  • Excellent customer-service, listening, communication and problem-solving skills

PREFERRED:

  • Applies knowledge of Agile methods and participates in team activities, ceremonies and efforts to continuously improve processes including backlog development or grooming, sprint planning and team retrospectives

  • Applies knowledge of DevOps practices including continuous deployment, continuous integration, test-driven development and automated testing

  • Applies knowledge of cloud technology concepts and platforms essential for the development of cloud products

  • Ensures technical artifacts are accurate, accessible, maintained and communicated

  • Undertakes special projects or assignments as required

  • Performs other related duties as required

title: Emerging Technologies Data Scientist - Opportunity to Gain/Hold Clearance at Varen Technologies (Columbia, MD)

Analytic Processing. Analyze, develop, demonstrate, and evaluate prototype solutions for the processing of data within the advanced analytic capability. This may include the development of advanced machine learning software solutions that augment and assist mission-users with operational decision-making, including extracting additional information, extracting information faster than humans, and algorithms to help with data visualization.

MUST BE A US CITIZEN

title: Senior Software Engineer - Portfolio Data Transparency at Bloomberg LP (San Francisco, CA)
description:
Bloomberg Portfolio Analytics (PORT) empowers the biggest players in the financial world to manage their portfolios, assess exposures, and make decisions that move the markets. Our flagship product on the Bloomberg Professional service is a mission-critical tool used daily by money managers, mutual funds, hedge funds, and pension funds around the world. PORT provides industry-leading quantitative financial tools and overnight batch report generation. Investment professionals rely on our solutions to understand factors impacting the returns of their portfolio over time, monitor intraday market movements in real-time, estimate potential losses under extreme market conditions via stochastic risk analysis, and generate new trading ideas.


Our highly scalable system processes billions of data points and complex calculations each day. The enterprise use and scale of our product impose technical challenges around stringent latency, availability, and throughput metrics. We are experiencing tremendous growth of our product and user base, and we are constantly looking to innovate upon our existing software and technologies.


Bloomberg’s PORT Engineering department is globally distributed, and the San Francisco-based Data Transparency team is the newest expansion. We apply modern data science tooling, such as Jupyter notebooks and Apache Spark, to enable data transparency and improve data quality across the PORT application stack. Our products help other PORT developers and SREs understand and validate the billions of data points that are consumed by our systems daily, ultimately improving the quality of that data for our end users.


We have:


 - Unique, compelling datasets curated by Bloomberg over decades of partnerships with the world's leading financial institutions
 - Tens of terabytes of constantly growing data across various stores at the core of our platform that delivers hundreds of thousands of reports daily
 - Supportive colleagues, many with significant involvement in the open source projects we leverage in our products
 - An inclusive office community, offering frequent technical training, professional development opportunities, and various employee communities


We'll trust you to:


 - Apply your practical experience with large data sets to the challenges of our dynamic environment
 - Own your contributions from development to deployment and beyond
 - Collaborate with teammates locally and around the globe
 - Be comfortable with both compiled and interpreted programming languages, and switching between them as necessary


You need to have:


 - 4+ years professional programming experience with Python, Java, Scala, or comparable languages
 - Experience with large, scalable distributed systems
 - Strong knowledge of data structures and understanding of algorithms
 - Pragmatic problem solving skills


We'd love to see:


 - Demonstrated success evangelizing new tools and encouraging contributions from a community
 - Familiarity with Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, Jupyter notebooks, and associated infrastructure
 - Knowledge of Docker-based workflows and Kubernetes
 - Highly skilled in both object-oriented and functional programming

title: Senior Software Engineer (Elixir) (m/f/d) at MEDWING GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
description:
MEDWING is building end-to-end staffing and workforce management platform to solve healthcare's rising shortage of professionals. We are well-funded by prominent investors and have already established a solid team of top-tier entrepreneurs and senior engineers.


We’re now looking for a Senior Software Engineer with Elixir experience for one of our cross-functional agile teams. Working closely with your team-mates, you will sit in the driver's seat in delivering impactful products.


Your Key Responsibilities

  • Design and develop backend of one of our applications, implementing RESTful and GraphQL APIs.

  • Integrate the application with our internal services, event bus and 3rd-party APIs.


Requirements



  • Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with technical and non-technical team-mates

  • Strong knowledge and 3+ years of work experience with at least one of our backend languages: Ruby, Golang or Elixir. Experience with Phoenix Framework.

  • Comfortable with AWS technologies, including CloudFormation, EC2, Route 53, Elasticache, RDS, Elasticsearch, AWS Lambda

  • Experience with automated testing and TDD

  • Experience in React, Ruby, Golang, Kafka or AWS Lambda is a plus

  • Experience with DDD, Event-Driven Systems, Service-Oriented Architecture, EventSourcing and CQRS is a plus

  • Structured, proactive working style

  • You are a team player


Benefits



  • Be part of a skilled agile cross-functional team

  • A high degree of individual responsibility and impact

  • Very experienced team of founders and well-funded by prominent investors

  • A unique company culture incl. free drinks, amazing coffee, fruit baskets and great team events.

title: Java Developer at Global Scale Solutions GmbH (Mnchen, Germany)
description:
Your profile 

Your profession excites you and have a genuine interest in what you do. You are looking for an employer who appreciates you as an individual and who is interested in helping you develop your personal and professional career path. Taking responsibility for your work means more than just showing up to the office every day. You’re willing and eager to help team members who are struggling with their own tasks. The quality of your work is of a consistently high standard. Dealing with your colleagues in a respectful way is important to you, as well as possessing a system of values. However, you're not lacking a good sense of humour to keep the team spirit up!


You’re fluent in English and you enjoy working in a multicultural, interdisciplinary environment. Knowledge of German language is a plus but not a must.

  • Mastery of your own toolset (IDE, operating system, debugging tools, etc.)

Non-EU residents: Please note that you need to fulfil the german Bluecard requirements in order to apply for this position. 


What we're offering you

title: Senior Verification Engineer (Methodology) at Arm (Cambridge, UK)
description:
Job Description


Senior Verification Engineer (Methodology) - based at Arms Headquarters in Cambridge, Cambridgeshire.
Parking available onsite.


About the role


We are searching for a talented and experienced Verification Engineer to join the Central Engineering Group at Arm, Cambridge! As part of this team, you will collaborate with members of processor design verification to provide solutions to verify next-generation microprocessors. This job will be in our main office in Cambridge and work with teams across the globe and help define, develop, and improve processor verification infrastructure and methods to support the latest innovations in CPU architecture and microarchitecture.


This position requires a strong knowledge of computer architecture and organization, including common microarchitectural structures and instruction-set architectures. Qualified candidates looking for an environment in which to make a significant contribution, collaborate with a skilled and creative team, and develop leading-edge top-level verification technologies to ensure the highest quality products are encouraged to apply.


If you are a design verification engineer who would like to step back and look at verification strategies more globally then this job could be for you!


Job Requirements


What skills, experience and qualifications do I need?


We are looking for new team members with a consistent track record with constrained-random verification including development of a suitably complex verification environment. Be comfortable using SystemVerilog to develop verification components and be familiar with the tools and processes for developing test benches and finishing all aspects of the verification process. You are capable of developing verification flow making the best use of EDA tools as well as using scripting (python) for verification automation.


Essential Attributes



  • Significant experience of implementing functional verification environments for complex IP.

  • Experience developing re-usable and scalable code whilst having good knowledge of UVM.

  • Strong scripting skills (Preferably Python) – being able to develop scripting to support new flows.

  • Solid understanding of computer architecture fundamentals

  • You possess the ability to quickly understand and apply complex specification details and capable of owning all stages of a project to completion.

  • Enthusiasm for complex technical challenges.

  • Strong communication skills and ability to work well as part of a team as well as experience working and communicating with remote design centres.


Desirable Attributes



  • Experience with instruction driven verification of processors

  • Knowledge of C/C++, Scala/Java and good software principles.

  • Experience with formal verification.

  • Experience with Arm architecture

  • Experience with Architecture Specification Language (ASL)

  • Mark Down Languages: (Sphynx, Natural Docs, MarkDown, Rst)

  • CI methodology (Jenkins)

title: Software Development Engineer in Test at OpenX Technologies, Inc. (Pasadena, CA)
description:
OpenX is looking for talented and highly motivated engineers to accelerate and improve the quality of OpenX Digital Advertising Platform. You will have a chance to work in all aspects of agile application development, including our highly efficient and available serving platform that serves billions of requests per day. As an engineer in test, you will own components, processes, and workflows that demand professionalism, excellent communication, teamwork, and documentation skills.

Key Responsibilities



  • Involved in all phases of product development, starting from requirements to validation and deployment

  • Work in a focused and nimble team that collaborates on common problems across products and across focus areas

  • Own components, processes, and workflows that demand professionalism, excellent communication, teamwork, and documentation skills

  • Create, maintain, and improve automation test suites/frameworks

  • Monitor and maintain CI pipelines

  • Work with experienced team members to conduct root cause analysis of issues and review new and legacy code

  • Effectively communicate and report issues to project teams

  • Be exposed to a broader set of problems, which allows for fast career growth and proximity to abundant technical problems


Required Qualifications



  • At least 2+ years of SDET experience

  • Proficiency in Java, Python or a similar OO language and can test any part of the stack utilizing our test framework by way of automation

  • Experience with working in large, cross-functional teams

  • Experience designing and implementing test automation frameworks

  • A deep understanding of web applications and RESTful APIs

  • Rock solid Computer Science foundation

  • Experience working within a CI/CD environment

  • Excellent troubleshooting skills to triage complex issues

  • Ability to digest and learn the integrations of complex systems

  • Strong quality and automation mindset

  • Passion for continual growth and self-development

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent degree


Desired Characteristics



  • Passion for software test development and proven ability to test enterprise distributed systems

  • Experience with automation tools such as TestNG, and so on

  • Experience with automating asynchronous web applications and RESTful APIs

  • Experience using tools such as Jenkins that build Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery systems

  • A background in utilizing cloud computing services such as Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud Platform

  • Experience working in a fast paced environment

  • Familiarity with advertising technologies and the advertising ecosystem


Company at a Glance


OpenX is focused on unleashing the full economic potential of digital media companies. We do this by making digital advertising markets and technologies that are designed to deliver optimal value to publishers and advertisers on every ad served across all screens.


At OpenX, we have built a team that is uniquely experienced in designing and operating high-scale ad marketplaces, and we are constantly on the lookout for thoughtful, creative executors who are as fascinated as we are about finding new ways to apply a blend of market design, technical innovation, operational excellence, and empathetic partner service to the frontiers of digital advertising.


OpenX Values


Our five company values form a solid bedrock serving to define us as a group and guide the company. Our values remind us that how we do things often matters as much as what we do.


We are one


One team. No exceptions. We are a group of strong and diverse individuals unified by a clear common purpose.


Our customers define us


We know our business flourishes or dies because of our customers.


OpenX is mine


We are all owners of OpenX. We stake our personal and professional reputations on the excellence of our work.


We are an open book


We are eager to teach and share what we know with others.


We evolve fast


We take risks and confront failure openly. We recognize and repeat success aggressively. We actively seek out and provide constructive criticism. Defensiveness is for weaklings!

title: Senior Python Engineer in Fintech at Flowcast Inc. () (allows remote)
description:
We seek an ambitious and self-motivated Software Engineer to join our core engineering team to keep up with customer demand. The ideal teammate is an experienced professional looking to take ownership of critical components of our proprietary machine learning platform.


As a Senior Python Engineer, you will be responsible for:



  • Work within all areas of the platform from our web interfaces and 3rd party API to backend integrations

  • Designing and coding highly-scalable machine learning models for real-time prediction, streaming and batch processing.

  • Working alongside other machine learning engineers, data scientists, and product teams to build AI decision engines for financial institutions and Fortune 500 corporations.

  • An outstanding communicator with sound interpersonal skills.

  • Strongly interested in technology and continuous learning.

  • Able to work autonomously and resourcefully in a fast-paced startup environment.


You should have:



  • 3+ years of professional software engineering experience in data-intensive environments.

  • Familiarity with concepts in data mining, data engineering, and backend API development.

  • Advanced skills and experience using Python, SQL, Bash and other scripting/compiled languages.

  • Experience with or exposure to Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Git, Jenkins and Docker-based continuous-integration & deployment pipelines.

  • Proven track record of collaboration with a variety of decision-makers to drive impact.
