title: Middle or Senior Robotics Developer / Specialist at Aeolus Robotics () (allows remote)
description:
Job Responsibilities

Lead and/or collaborate in the design, development, and testing of robot algorithms, in one or more of these areas:

- Robot motion, especially reactive planning and replanning techniques, and machine learning for skill acquisition.
- Robot vision, SIFT and other approaches to both face and object recognition, vision processing in service of SLAM, and surface modeling in service of manipulation.
- Manipulation and grasping, especially software compliant approaches that are compatible with a variety of grips and objects, e.g. a cupping motion, a pinching action, and a more generic grasp.
- Hardware design, especially of compliant end-effectors. 
- ... and more ...


About you


You are looking for the place to stretch yourself, able to work within a senior, highly performant product team, and aren't afraid of a challenge.  You are a self-starter with the motivation and skills needed to effectively operate on your own time in your own way while being responsive to the needs of your team mates and the team as a whole.


You love working on the metal and/or deep in low-level or scaled algorithmic code.  You are effective at quickly understanding and operating on algorithms taken from research in AI, Robotics, and Vision, or you have have experience with sensors, motors, and other devices.  You are comfortable working alongside experts in these areas, or are an expert yourself. You have a proven track record of delivering ideas into working prototypes at high velocity.  You have commercial/agile development teaming experience. You've architected some serious systems and may have even been a team lead.


Skill Set / Experience


We welcome people with passion on designing robots to join us. Among our whole bunch of positions there may be one for you which reflects your dreams of perfect job so make sure you check every single one of them!


Flexible Hours, Permanent position or contract work


You can work in one of our offices (Taipei, Vienna, Wroclaw or Tokyo), but some of these roles permit 100% remote cooperation.


You will work in a scrum-based agile development cycle. You will be working alongside founders, researchers, and engineers to design and build first-generation robotic solutions for mass consumer adoption.


Whether you prefer contract work or a permanent position, we can accommodate you.

title: Core Java Developer at Flow Traders (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
What will you do?


Software engineers in Flow Traders are working on applications that support the core business of the company. Our systems make it possible for Flow Traders to be present and competitive on exchanges worldwide. There is all kinds of code to write, from systems on (or close to) the critical path from receiving market data to placing orders, to systems handling huge amounts of data in reliable, performant and traceable manner.


Our future colleague will be writing code, creating new designs and maintaining existing applications with a focus on performance and stability. Our business users are typically only a walk away, which helps to create short feedback loops and to see your changes provide value in the shortest time possible.


To enable that, we strive to follow best software engineering practices and are supported by the best working environment, latest technology and continuous support from all parts of Flow Traders organisation.                                       


How you do it


We work in small teams, grouped by business area. Each team is typically responsible for a set of related applications, and works in tight collaboration with business owners. We maintain libraries shared across the teams to enable code re-use and to have a common view on application architecture. We write extensive unit tests, and have a QA team that supports us with integration testing. We follow agile practices, tailored to the problem area and preferred team approach.


Some of the things we use in development process:



  • Java 8


    • Guava, Jetty, Lucene, Mockito, SLF4J

    • Spring MVC, Hibernate

    • Swing, JavaFX, Mustache


  • Maven, Git

  • Atlassian stack


    • Bitbucket for code review. We do all work in pull requests, which are reviewed by other developers.

    • Bamboo for continuous integration.

    • JIRA, Confluence


  • SonarQube for continuous code quality inspection

  • IntelliJ IDEA

  • Python for scripts/testing

  • MariaDB, Cassandra


A day in the life


Morning is normally started with a standup meeting with your team. This is an opportunity to catch up on progress of development, raise problems and discuss plans for the day. Business representative is also present, so questions to trading can be resolved instantly. After standup, you go back to your desk to program, review code on pull requests submitted by colleagues, and discuss functionality with traders. Sometimes a production issue is raised by support, and help from development is needed to provide advice. At lunch time, you join your team for lunch in the canteen and enjoy a company-provided lunch. During the day, if there are no pressing issues or you feel that you need a break, you can unwind at the pool table or table tennis, or do a workout at the gym. After the day is done you can join your colleagues to celebrate a successful release or just socialize at our bar.


What you need to succeed



  • BSc or MSc in Computing Science or equivalent

  • 5+ years' post-graduation work experience

  • Core Java experience

  • Previous experience in the financial industry is highly advantageous

  • Experience in parallel and multithreaded programming

  • Knowledge of algorithms and data structures

  • Interest in achieving maximum performance from available hardware and software

  • Ability to communicate with technical and business colleagues

  • Working experience in professional software development

  • Fluency in English

title: Associate Director, Product Infrastructure Engineering at Oscar Health (New York, NY)
description:
Hi, we're Oscar. We’re hiring an Associate Director, Product Infrastructure Engineering to join our Engineering team in our New York City office.


Oscar is a technology-driven, consumer-focused health insurance startup founded in 2012 and headquartered in New York City. Our goal is to make health insurance simple, transparent, and human. We need your help to do so.


About this role:


Oscar engineers work on some of the most challenging problems in tech — helping users navigate the complex health industry through beautiful user applications, elegant distributed system design, making sense of noisy data, statistical learning, and language theory. We invest in our people, our tools, and our processes so we can focus on solving big problems while learning from one another.


Associate Director, Product Infrastructure Engineering at Oscar:


Product Infrastructure exists to support teams at Oscar that work on the product. “Product” at Oscar typically means “web”, so a large portion of the work that the Product Infrastructure team does relates to the Web: JS build tools, core libraries, frameworks, and long-term architectural vision. Product Infrastructure works “bottom up”—driven by engineers and technical leaders—on projects that we think will make an impact, make engineers more productive, and support company goals and objectives.


Specific management responsibilities include:



  • Coaching and mentorship. Ensure everyone on your team is getting clear, constructive, and frequent feedback on their work and that they have the support they need to grow as technical contributors.

  • Career development. Understand the aspirations of your teammates and help them to take on more responsibility for the work they are most passionate about.

  • Team execution. You are ultimately responsible for the overall performance of your team, which can be minimally defined as “ensuring the right objectives for the team are established, and that they are met at the right time”. But we’d really like you to help your team knock it out of the park.


You won’t be on your own. Engineering management is a critical and complex role that we take very seriously at Oscar and we support each other to do it well.


About You:



  • You have 7+ years of software engineering experience, including prior management experience.

  • Strong backend engineering experience, preferably with Python

  • You make the people and teams around you better through mentorship, collaboration, and guiding developers towards best practices.

  • You believe that team performance is even more important than individual performance, and have a track record of leading and managing high-functioning teams.

  • You understand the “inclusion” part of Diversity & Inclusion and can help us improve and maintain a great culture where the best ideas prevail.

title: Smart and Brave Java Devs Exist Here? at Zerocracy (Moscow, Russia)
description:
We are moving a huge Fortune-100 company to the open source market. You may join our team while it's still young. There is a big challenge in front of us: transition existing large software products to the open source territory and do it right. You will not only work with existing software, but mostly create your own products. You will not work for us. We will help you work for the market!


It is full-time on-site employment by a large enterprise (Zerocracy only runs the promo campaign here). You will have a very competitive salary, a full package of benefits, and all that.

title: Senior Salesforce Developer at Eagle Creek Software Services () (allows remote)
description:
Senior Salesforce Developer

Eagle Creek Software Services is a CRM, BI, and eCommerce services firm and the largest dedicated provider of on-shore and rural sourcing services in the US. Eagle Creek Software focuses on implementing, upgrading and extending the useful life of CRM, BI, and allied technologies. People are attracted to Eagle Creek for our focus; for our success, (rapid growth since 1999); for the opportunity to work on the largest and most innovative projects in the US with Fortune 1000 clients; and for our reputation for high quality. 


Duties



  • Participate in the development of  Salesforce applications based on client needs for integration, implementation, and customization projects

  • Mentor and train, formally and informally, Eagle Creek’s Jr. and mid-level resources

  • Foster and maintain development and integration standards, best practices and related deliverables with the EC team

  • Participate in pre-sales efforts and strategic project planning

  • Ability to travel for initial project set-up and major milestones as required

  • Additional duties as required


 Required Technical Skills



  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, related field, or equivalent

  • 3+ years experience with end to end Salesforce.com implementations, integrations, and enhancement projects

  • 2+ years APEX and VisualForce development for custom Salesforce functionality

  • Salesforce development certification (highly desired)

  • Hands-on development skills


 Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Senior Node.js Engineer (TypeScript) at Velocity Black (Vilnius, Lithuania)
description:
As our Senior Node.js Engineer, you will be building the backbone of our service, ensure low latency performance, great test coverage and participate in detailed code reviews. You will be involved in advanced architecture sessions combined with spearheading the interfaces for our web, mobile and other applications making this an exciting and challenging role.


You will be working with TypeScript, NestJS, TypeORM, Ts.ED, RabbitMQ, Redis, CircleCI, Docker, Kubernetes and many more. We encourage each other to contribute across the stack and constantly seek to learn new technologies.


Our backend stacks are split between Node.js, .NET-Core, MySQL, PostreSQL and MSSQL databases, orchestrated in a Docker/Kubernetes micro-service architecture on Google Cloud Platform.


The ideal candidate should have most of these qualities


Admiral communication skills – ability to converse concisely is imperative within our small but rapidly growing global teams and global providers, hence this is critical for success!


Learning and development – not only yourself but the whole team;


Be a pragmatic and versatile self-starter: self-motivated, have a stellar work ethic and hold yourself to high standards;


Problem solver – as a team, we help each other out whenever and however we can;


‍ Detail Focused – we’re obsessive in our pursuit of perfection and the best customer experience;


‍ Enthusiastic and innovative – we’re building things we care about and we love what we do!


Confidence & Focus – hold yourself to your highest standards – we’re obsessive in our pursuit of perfection and the best customer experience;


Requirements


3+ years professional Node.js development experience;


High level of proficiency using JavaScript (ES6/7) and TypeScript;


Thorough understanding of scope and tradeoffs of micro-service architecture;


Deep understanding in designing and developing REST APIs;


Strong understanding of systems using real-time interactions (web sockets, long-polling, eventual consistency);


Strong test focus, BDD and TDD practices including implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests;


Nice to have: Experience with data science technologies (BigQuery, ElasticSearch, recommendation engines)


Nice to have: GraphQL experience


Nice to have: Understanding of event based programming and domain driven design

title: Team Lead Backend Engineering - PHP at Durstexpress GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
description:
Intro:


We are a fast growing team of over 100 experts from various fields, dedicated to creating the most customer-centric delivery experience in Germany. Our collaboration is guided by long term thinking, trust and teamwork. We believe in metric-driven strategy and offer a workplace shaped to fuel your ideas and ambitions. Oh, and free drinks, of course.


Your Future:



  • You are the contact person for your team in all technical and especially personal matters

  • Lead our PHP Engineering team ( currently 3 PHP Engineers), which is responsible for the improvement of our Webshop (Magento)

  • You and your team will shape the development process and optimize it in collaboration with our UX department regarding performance and user experience

  • Your team will be in charge of the architecture of our modular service-oriented system and share technical solutions and product ideas

  • How? Design review, pair programming, code review or technology discussions - it´s your decision, feel free to inspire us with new ideas from your side!

  • Participating in continuous education and training is not only important for you - but even more important for your team!


Technologies we use:



  • PHP7

  • Symfony, Laravel or other Frameworks

  • eCommerce experience with Magento, especially in Headless mode

  • SQL experience (MariaDb, MySQL)

  • BDD, DDD, Clean Code, Unit and integration testing

  • Git and GitFlow

  • Modern UI framework experience

  • Is a plus: Other CMS Applications (Pimcore, Shopware, etc.)

  • Is a plus: Experience woith Cloud and Kubernetes


Your Strengths:



  • “A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way”

  • Several years of relevant work and leading experience is mandatory

  • Ideally a degree in Computer Science, engineering or a similar subject

  • Following straight leadership principles like: Honesty, Empathy & Confidence

  • If you have excellent communication & strong analytical skills plus a mindset to get things done - you might be the right person for our growing team!


Our Promise:



  • Personal responsibility & scope for design from day one

  • Free choice of hardware & noise-cancelling headphones

  • Personal training budget & language courses

  • Flexible working hours and home office days

  • Corporate events & budget for teambuilding

  • Height-adjustable tables & ergonomic chairs

  • Chilled drinks & fresh fruits

  • 30 days of vacation

title: AppSec Engineer (Static and Dynamic Testing) at Hays (Atlanta, GA)
description:
AppSec Engineer (Static and Dynamic Testing) - CTP - Atlanta, GA - $60.00-$62.00/hr



Hays Specialist Recruitment is working in partnership with Truist to manage the recruitment of this position

The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.

FinTch has been experiencing aggressive growth in the IT Industry and the FinTech Capital of the World is right here in Atlanta! This industry is not slowing down and now you can be a part of it at some of the biggest players in the game. Truist will be the 6th largest bank in the country once the integration is completed between SunTrust and BB&T. Join us to help make this happen and work with cutting edge technology!


Role Description
The Application Security Engineer will be part of a team responsible for working with the various business teams to ensure applications are protected by identification of application vulnerabilities. This will include the dynamic and static analysis of code. This will include the use of both manual and automated testing tools.

Skills & Requirements
* Strong technical knowledge of AppSec and Dynamic and/or Static Application Code Analysis
* Experience with Cybersecurity framework like OWASP, NIST, COBIT, ISA, and ISO
* Strong verbal and written communication

title: Senior Software Developer at Formstack (Fishers, IN) (allows remote)
description:
Formstack transforms the way you collect data and put it to work. 

We are looking for a Senior Software Developer to help us accomplish this mission! 

Formstack is a 14-year-old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom for those who can perform. We are seeking people who demonstrate an ability to work effectively with individuals from diverse cultures and backgrounds.

Who You Are:

You are an experienced full-stack developer talented in Node.js, Java, and JavaScript. You are a supporter and advocate for a completely serverless AWS stack (Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB, and S3).  You are a problem solver and are motivated to learn. You are able to help plan features from problem statements and loosely defined requirements. You are able to break large projects in manageable chunks to make them easier to work on and consume. You aren't scared to be wrong and don't always have to be right, and you have the ability to leave your ego at the door. You can set measurable goals for yourself and you take the team and personal responsibility seriously.  There are opportunities to develop UI elements in React yourself, so a basic understanding of front-end technologies (Angular.js, ReactJS, CSS, and web components) is desirable.

What You Will Do:

  • Your primary focus will be the development of server-side capabilities on our eSignature SaaS platform and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. 
  • You will execute projects, fix bugs, write tests, reduce technical debt, and maintain our documentation. 
  • You will collaborate with various teams on a daily basis to make sure what we are creating will support both our internal and external stakeholders. 
  • You will work with a Scrum methodology to make sure features ship as they are planned and scheduled.

What We Are Looking For:

  • Knowledge of Node.js and frameworks such as Express to build RESTful APIs returning JSON
  • Understanding the nature of asynchronous programming, its quirks and workarounds, and experience writing or using JavaScript promises and/or async/await
  • DevOps experience and mentality - You recognize the importance of automating all build, test, and deploy activities for an application and have experience with CI/CD tools such as CircleCI, Jenkins, GitHub Actions and provisioning tools such as Terraform or Cloudformation.
  • Solid foundation in writing queries and updating NoSQL databases such as AWS DynamoDB 
  • Experience using the AWS Javascript API to interface with S3 and DynamoDB
  • Good understanding of server-side and client-side javascript build tools and environments such as npm, yarn, Lerna, webpack, and babel 
  • Understanding of serverless tools (AWS Lambda, serverless.com and/or Claudia.js frameworks)
  • Basic understanding of front-end technologies, such as HTML5, and CSS3 and React/AngularJS
  • Creating database schemas that represent and support business processes
  • Implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
  • Familiarity with object-oriented development with Java a plus - especially with using Java APIs for PDF manipulation such as iText, Apache PDFBox, or JPedal

Bonus Points:

  • Mobile app development experience
  • Experience working with well-performing agile teams
  • Experience working on a SaaS product
  • Experience integrating with 3rd party web applications (through REST API))
  • AWS certifications

What Formstack Offers:

  • Free health plans, as well as company-paid Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance Benefits for full-time employees.
  • Unlimited PTO for all employees
  • 401k with matching company contribution for full-time employees
  • The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job
  • Company-paid conferences and extended learning
  • Yearly company gatherings

Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? CLICK HERE to hear from some current Formstackers about what matters most!

Formstack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.

All data collected in our application process from resume collection to application questions is used for recruitment purposes only. We will store it in our applicant tracking system, JazzHR, and will not share this data with anyone else. We will keep your data until the role is filled and only continue to store it if we feel you may fit future roles.

Thank you for your interest in Formstack!

title: Engineering Managers (f/h/x) Live, Code and Build teams in Paris at Doctolib (Levallois-Perret, France)
description:
Doctolib, an eHealth Startup founded in 2013 now used daily by thousands of doctors and millions of patients we are hiring Engineering Managers to build new feature teams and work on new products.



  • Build products used by millions of people every day

  • Scale-up, mentor and manage a team of full-stack Developers

  • Take end-to-end ownership of the team’s production, quality and delivery.

  • Collaborate across every area of our tech business


Join our team of engineers as a manager at Doctolib and coach, mentor and lead a team as one of our Engineering Managers. You will be both a technical leader and a people manager. Coaching & training your team members and building an amazing engineering organisation at Doctolib. Make technical decisions every day. You will drive a high performing team, focusing on maximizing efficiency and empowering developers to build better products. 


We take a full-stack approach to management, while you may not code every day you will lead from the front and get stuck in from time to time. Your core focus will be Improving the performance of the team you manage. You will also collaborate closely with product leaders to ensure the roadmap is delivered to the best of our ability. You will team up with our People team to recruit, develop and retain talent. You will influence our tech brand, represent Doctolib in the community and help millions of people get access to the healthcare they need.


We do daily deployments on a CI pipeline with 13K+ tests. Everything runs on Ruby on Rails, backed by PostgreSQL and Redis. Front side, we bet on React even for our Mobile apps. 


Changing healthcare is not easy, our engineering managers are solving the most complex of the challenges we face. You will care deeply about test-driven, pragmatically engineered code and work every day on things like keeping our site hyper-secure, ensuring zero downtime and incident management. 


Under the hood, our systems integrate with doctors and hospitals booking systems so patients can access the healthcare they need at any time. We build systems that help tens of   thousands of doctors focus on taking care of their patients. 


As a Manager, you will lead and mentor your colleagues on all aspects of how the product is evolving. You will be a role model with your technical background as a full-stack developer and have demonstrated strong team leadership in the past. 


You previously aced back-end functionalities on MVC frameworks, have the ability to adapt to the most efficient technologies to solve issues, bring solutions to the table, develop super robust and secure products with eXtreme programming practices. 


We are a team of 70 developers and 12+ managers across Paris and Berlin. You will have the opportunity to travel between offices, go to conferences, contribute to open source, interview future colleagues. We want you to help us build an amazing team and a brilliant company. You will have the support of our leadership academy and ongoing training from day one.


Here at Doctolib, we all share the same obsession: provide the best experience for our users and change the way people access healthcare.  


We are moving into our new offices in west Paris by the beginning of 2020. Get in touch and we can tell you more.


Apply now. Join us on this mission. We are excited to help you grow with us.

title: Software Developer at European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) (Hinxton, UK)
description:
We are seeking a talented backend software engineer to join the Open Targets Core Team in the development of the Genetics Portal. Open Targets (OT) is a public-private partnership aiming to systematically identify and prioritise drug targets by integrating complex biological data in a pre-competitive environment. The Open Targets Genetics Portal (https://genetics.opentargets.org) leverages the increasing amount of human genetic data in order to publicly facilitate the drug discovery decision-making with a focus on target identification and prioritisation.

You  will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team, where we use a range of cutting-edge technologies, to process, store and aggregate the vast amount of human genetic data available. You will have the opportunity to build on the most recent statistical genomics analysis and provide a robust infrastructure to expand the deck of available applications in public and private instances of the Portal. Our current technologies include ElasticSearch, Spark, ClickHouse and a variety of Google cloud services including Dataproc and BigQuery.

Your role


The main responsibilities will involve:

  • Data processing pipelines in Python or Scala using the Spark Framework

  • Design and implementation of GraphQL web services in the Play Framework

  • Deployment in a cloud environment (Google Cloud) and keeping our services
    performant across multiple geographical regions.

  • Ensuring the open source nature of the Open Targets project as a public
    resource for target identification and prioritisation.

  • Help to improve the orchestration of the backend components


Working in a multi-disciplinary team embedded in the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI), you will have the opportunity to join a thriving community around large-scale biomedical data. We seek a colleague who wants to keep up with cutting-edge infrastructure and take ownership on the upcoming Open Targets projects.

You have




  • BSc or higher degree in Computer Science orBioinformatics.

  • Experience delivering production quality software on a regular release cycle to meet project needs.

  • Experience in software development with Python or Scala and shell scripting.

  • DevOps experience, as well as having working knowledge in Bioinformatics.

  • Experience of working in a continuous deployment environment, with source control and managed releases is required. 

  • Ability to work in a highly collaborative Agile team, interfacing with web developers, data analysts and data providers.


We encourage candidates with all levels of expertise to apply.

You might also have




  • A proven track record of working on large-scale data analysis projects and understanding the challenges posed by collaborative projects

  • Previous experience of working on other biological data projects



Why join us


At EMBL-EBI, we help scientists realise the potential of ‘big data’ in biology by enabling them to exploit complex information to make discoveries that benefit mankind. Working for EMBL-EBI gives you an opportunity to apply your skills and energy for the greater good. As part of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL), we are a non-profit, intergovernmental organisation funded by over 27 member states and two associate member states. We are located on the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK, and our 600 staff are engineers, technicians, scientists and other professionals from all over the world.

EMBL is an inclusive, equal opportunity employer offering attractive conditions and benefits appropriate to an international research organisation. The remuneration package comprises a competitive salary, a comprehensive pension scheme and health insurance, educational and other family related benefits where applicable, as well as financial support for relocation and installation. For more information about pay and benefits click here

We have an informal culture, international working environment and excellent professional development opportunities but one of the really amazing things about us is the concentration of technical and scientific expertise – something you probably won’t find anywhere else.

If you’ve ever visited the campus you’ll have experienced first-hand our friendly, collegial and supportive atmosphere, set in the beautiful Cambridgeshire countryside. Our staff also enjoy excellent sports facilities including a gym, a free shuttle bus, an on-site nursery, cafés and restaurant and a library.

What else you need to know


To view a copy of the full job description please click here.

To apply please submit a covering letter and CV through our online system.

Applications are welcome from all nationalities and this will continue after Brexit. For more information please see our website.

Visa information will be discussed in more depth with applicants selected for interview.

EMBL-EBI is committed to achieving gender balance and strongly encourages applications from women, who are currently under-represented at all levels. Appointment will be based on merit alone.

This position is limited to the project duration specified.

title: Senior Scala/Kubernetes Engineer at Luna (Krakw, Poland) (allows remote)
description:
Overview


Luna is looking for a senior cloud software engineer to take charge of the design, development, and evolution of the new SaaS offering for Luna, a project said by Singularity University to have the potential to change the lives of one-billion people. If you bring strong technical skills and have a passion for collaboration, this role could be for you.


As a senior cloud software engineer, you'll be leading the effort to design and develop our new SaaS offering, providing a web-based version of Luna to our clients. Your work will be integral to the next phase of Luna's development, as we expand our offering beyond the open-source project. You'll be able to work with a world-class team of skilled engineers, community managers, and business developers (from Bloomberg, GitHub and PayPal to name a few), and put your indelible stamp on Luna's future.


What You'll Do


As a senior cloud software engineer you'll be in charge of building the SaaS offering for Luna, hosting both the language and its IDE in the cloud. This will involve:



  • Working closely with the internal teams to design a secure and scalable SaaS architecture.

  • Developing a SaaS solution based upon that design with robust tooling and reliability, as well as inbuilt support for collaboration.

  • Hosting the architecture on a cloud provider without becoming too dependent on any one given platform.

  • Contributing to the evolution of this vibrant open-source project by bringing a new component to its ecosystem and product offering.


The Skills We're Looking For


We have a few particular skills that we're looking for in this role:



  • 3+ years experience in designing secure, scalable, and collaboration-ready SaaS architectures.

  • A strong commitment to security and scalability that permeates your approach to design.

  • Experience with Kubernetes deployment and administration using EKS.

  • Experience with Scala and Akka.

  • Practical knowledge about AWS networking and storage architectures, and how they integrate with Kubernetes.

  • Experience managing AWS resources using Terraform.

  • Experience working in an SRE capacity on monitoring, incident handling and continuous service improvement.

  • Experience building and delivering CI/CD pipelines to ensure service stability and reliability.

  • Experience employing Devops practices such as the 'continuous everything' and 'everything as code' styles of work.

  • Experience working with Git, and preferably GitOps.


It would be a big bonus if you also had:



  • Skills working with Azure and GCP to help expand beyond AWS in the future.

  • Experience working in close conjunction with multiple product teams to ensure that the solutions you provide meet their needs.

title: DevOps / SRE Platform Engineer at Classpass (San Francisco, CA)
description:
Our growing team is a passionate, hard-working bunch that believes in having a real impact on our customers' lives. We take work – and working out – seriously. We’re as inspired by the 100 million reservations made to date as we are by the life-changing stories we receive from our members and studios, which is why we work together every day to innovate, create, and discover new ways we can make the world a more active place.


About the Right Team Member


As a Platform Engineer, you will help accelerate our engineering team as we deploy frequently to production for 100+ services. You will help create systems, tools, and practices so that we can scale with increasing confidence.


Requirements: 



  • Professional experience designing, building, and operating distributed systems at large-scale in an AWS environment.

  • Use existing commercial and open source tools to create a robust, reliable, and performant platform.

  • Determine when these tools are insufficient and decide when it's time to write our own (and then write them).  Our go-to languages are Python and Java.

  • Excited by big, complicated problems and try to solve them with creative, elegant, and simple solutions.

  • Communicate problems and their solutions to other engineers as well as a less technical audience.

  • Look at a process and you instinctively want to automate it.

  • You value simplicity and strive to eliminate unnecessary complexity.

  • At least 5 years of professional programming experience.

  • You treat infrastructure as code.  Prior experience with Terraform is a plus.

  • Passionate about your craft and want to be surrounded by like-minded individuals.

title: Senior Network Engineer - Remote, Boston, New York, or San Francisco at Underline () (allows remote)
description:
We are driven by a singular mission: to ensure the vibrancy of our nation through building intelligent community infrastructure. We work with communities across the United States to design, finance, and construct open access fiber-optic networks. We believe these networks are the essential foundation for ultra-fast access to information, a competitive market for content and services, job formation and reskilling for workers, distributed healthcare services, new wireless solutions, and resilient modern infrastructure including responsible energy creation.  


We’re looking for a full-time senior network engineer to join our Engineering team. 


Our Engineering team responds to the needs of the business, delivering well-designed and strategically aligned technology solutions in network architecture and design, customer acquisition, network service provider connectivity, and operations and support systems.


Join us as we help support the vitality and resilience of communities. 


Responsibilities



  • Lead the design of open access community fiber-optic networks

  • Create network diagrams showing switches, fiber connections, bandwidth capacities, and other networking attributes

  • Create detailed bills of materials, and assist in sourcing materials

  • Rack and stack equipment in data center in community or region (some travel required)

  • Install and configure network operating systems for SDN access

  • Build a virtualized edge infrastructure

  • Connect network to AWS environment

  • Assist with connection of network to NOC vendor

  • Maintain infrastructure-as-code in git repositories

  • Configure and maintain VPN connections as required

  • Deploy network monitoring software and enable monitoring of community networks

  • Ensure security and compliance for perimeter and internal services 

  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues on our internal network as needed (community network operations will be outsourced)

  • Assist in evaluating vendors for network equipment, materials, and construction

  • Provide IT support on an ad hoc basis for our regional offices and employees

  • Advise in strategic technology decisions for internal systems and open access community fiber-optic networks


About You



  • You are hungry, humble, and curious

  • You have excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills

  • You are an intrinsic self-starter and enjoy taking on new challenges

  • You want to be part of the early stages of a company where everything you build matters

  • You thrive in a collaborative environment, comprised of diverse subject matter experts in finance, government, infrastructure, and tech

  • You care about building critical intelligent infrastructure to increase community vitality and improve resilience

  • You see everyone in the company as your customer, always striving to delight by providing top notch customer service

  • You’re an innovator and you want to help develop creative technology products that help communities upgrade their infrastructure and that help investors find our innovative investment opportunities


About Us 



  • We offer bold solutions to drive positive, sustainable change 

  • We approach our work with humility, integrity, and intellectual rigor

  • We are agile and relentless in pursuit of our mission 

  • We have a mentality of service: to our mission, and to each other

  • We are dedicated to building and sustaining a culture of flourishing

  • We optimize our efforts to create positive sum for community and capital


Requirements



  • At least 10 years experience in Network Engineering, preferably in the telecommunications industry

  • At least 3 years experience with Software Defined Networking and SD-WANs

  • Familiarity with major municipal network architectures and standards such as GPON, Active Ethernet, DOCSIS, and HFC

  • Solid foundation in DevOps and infrastructure-as-code principles with tools such as Ansible or Terraform

  • Deep knowledge of network protocols and standards, especially ethernet routing, switching, bridging, virtual LANs, QinQ, OpenFlow, and ONAP

  • Hands-on experience with fiber-optic network equipment, cabling, and connections

  • Expert with Linux operating systems, and especially with Linux networking

  • In-depth experience at scale with at least one virtualization technology such as VMware

  • Proficiency in shell scripting such as Bash, and with at least one scripting language such as Python, Javascript, etc.

  • Familiarity with IT compliance areas such as change management, incident response, and configuration management

  • Vendor management experience, including initial and annual diligence and contract negotiation

  • Familiarity with access control, centralized systems management, inventory management and directory management such as LDAP/ActiveDirectory and SSO

  • Familiarity with network and connectivity troubleshooting from both a user endpoint perspective as well as server and networking infrastructure perspective.

  • Cisco, Juniper, or similar network design, configuration, and/or operations certifications a big plus



We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We maintain exceptionally high standards for talent and recognize that there are many paths to developing expertise. We don't discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factors. If you have the skills we need and the ambition to grow fast with us, that's all that matters.

title: Senior C++/Java Developer for Android Platform (m/w/d) - Munich at Paradox Cat GmbH (Mnchen, Deutschland)
description:
You will:



  • Build next generation infotainment systems with us based on Android Automotive

  • Grasp an overview of a huge system like Android OS

  • Solve problems and dive deeply into the AOSP code base

  • Design and implement new concepts in form of applications or services

  • Communicate promptly with stakeholders when blocked


You have:



  • A degree in computer science, a comparable qualification, or equivalent experience

  • Extensive knowledge of at least one programming language (C++, C, Java, Kotlin)

  • Over 3 years of experience developing for Linux OS and customizing it

  • Minimal familiarity developing for Android using Android SDK and NDK

  • Expert knowledge of distributed Version Control Systems such as Git

  • Proficiency in collaborative web-based Code Review systems (preferably Gerrit)

  • Understanding of C++ Build Systems (Make/CMake)

  • An excellent standard of written and spoken English


You might also have:



  • Good knowledge of written and spoken German

  • Experience with AOSP development (Android HAL, System Services, SDK Addons)

  • Experience with Linux Kernel

  • Ability to use at least one scripting language (Bash/Python)

  • Working knowledge of containerization software (lxc, docker)


We offer:



  • Independent, self-managed work with responsibility as part of a small team of top developers

  • Exciting, long-term projects in the HMI environment with plenty of opportunity for you to drive your own personal and professional development

  • A yearly training budget for external courses

  • Professionally managed projects with a good work-life balance

  • 30 days of annual leave


Got questions? Just ask your HR & Recruiting Manager Maximilian Eberle. jobs@paradoxcat.com

title: Software Engineer (Monitoring System) - Working in Japan at LINE Fukuoka (Fukuoka, Japan)
description:
*Please apply to only one position at a time.


Both Japanese speakers and Non-Japanese speakers welcomed!


Whilst there are many English speakers at LINE successful applicants may be asked to attend a Japanese training course for at least 3 ~ 12 months after joining. The training is paid for by us, and is an excellent chance to pick up new language skills. We encourage employees to reach JLPT N2 within a few years of joining.


Job Description:


This role is responsible for the development of tools based on the Prometheus monitoring platform which support the work of the engineers here at LINE. By monitoring and forecasting resource usage we can develop tools that help us deal with issues before they occur. Using our self-developed tool ‘Promgen’ our engineers can take control of their own monitoring by creating their own Prometheus and Alertmanager configurations.


Specific Responsibilities Include



  • Develop and support monitoring system for the LINE Family services

  • Developer support/process improvement

  • Resource monitoring, resource and performance prediction tool development

  • Development of the Prometheus ecosystem and surrounding relevant tools


Tech Stack


Prometheus, SaltStack, Python, Django


Required Skills:



  • 3+ years of experience in maintaining and operating web services

  • 3+ years of experience in operating and troubleshooting Linux-based servers

  • Development experience in multiple programming languages (any language welcome)


Preferred Skills: 



  • Familiarity with Prometheus and the greater Prometheus ecosystem

  • Saltstack/ Ansible/ Configuration management experience

  • Django experience

  • Log management tools (fluentd, Elasticsearch)

  • OSS contribution experience


Who We’re Looking For:



  • Those with the curiosity to explore new technologies, the willingness to learn new things, and the courage to challenge themselves constantly

  • Gifted communicators who can explain complex ideas to anyone regardless of background


Working Hours: 


Discretionary and flexible according to ability and speed of work; if projects are completed on time there is no need to stay in the office for extended periods of time.


Salary: 


Minimum salary starting from 6 million Japanese yen per annum (salary based on experience and ability).


*Other details to be discussed during the interview process.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Ruby) (m/f/d) at MEDWING GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
description:
MEDWING is building end-to-end staffing and workforce management platform to solve healthcare's rising shortage of professionals. We are well-funded by prominent investors and have already established a solid team of top-tier entrepreneurs and senior engineers.


We’re now looking for a Senior Software Engineer with Ruby experience for one of our cross-functional agile teams. Working closely with your team-mates, you will sit in the driver's seat in delivering impactful products.

Your Key Responsibilities



  • Contribute to product development by providing pragmatic solutions to problems.

  • Design and develop the backend of one of our applications, implementing RESTful and GraphQL APIs.

  • Integrate the application with our internal services, event bus, and 3rd-party APIs.


Requirements



  • Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with technical and non-technical team-mates

  • Strong knowledge and 3+ years of work experience with Ruby and Ruby on Rails

  • Comfortable with AWS technologies, including CloudFormation, EC2, Route 53, Elasticache, RDS, Elasticsearch, AWS Lambda

  • Experience with automated testing and TDD

  • Experience in React, Golang, Elixir, Kafka or AWS Lambda is a plus

  • Experience with DDD, Event-Driven Systems, Service-Oriented Architecture, EventSourcing, and CQRS is a plus

  • Structured, proactive working style

  • You are a team player


Benefits



  • Be part of a skilled agile cross-functional team

  • A high degree of individual responsibility and impact

  • Very experienced team of founders and well-funded by prominent investors

  • A unique company culture incl. free drinks, amazing coffee, fruit baskets, and great team events.

title: Senior Software Engineer at Lutron Electronics (Coopersburg, PA)
description:
Visa sponsorship provided



Senior Software Engineer
Lehigh Valley, PA


Job Description


Senior Software Engineer


Philadelphia, PA // Coopersburg, PA


You Will Be Working On


·         Working hands-on with eCommerce and IoT systems to design and implement customer-facing software capabilities


·         Using API-driven design to unify business functions across multiple teams


·         Building cloud infrastructure leveraging AWS, Azure, Kubernetes and Golang

Lutron offers a competitive compensation and benefits package and a dynamic and professional work environment. Lutron Electronics is an Equal Opportunity – Affirmative Action – Employer. We welcome qualified, motivated applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.

title: iOS Developer at Octave Group (Montreal, QC, Canada)
description:
iOS Developer
Montreal, Canada
(French Version follows)

Do you want to join a team of passionate individuals who are driven by the impact they can bring in the conception and development of cutting-edge features?

In this role you will develop the next generation of media and lifestyle iPhone applications that people want to use every day. You will also collaborate with cross functional teams to define, design and create new features as well as work with designers and product owners to bring our TouchTunes and Apple Music for Business mobile products to the next level!

What your day-to-day looks like:



  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product owners, design, product management, and other developers to define, design, and release new features that people want to use every day

  • Work with outside data sources and APIs

  • Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability

  • Work on bug fixing and improving application performance

  • Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency


What you bring to the table:



  • BS / BA degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent

  • At least 3 years of experience with iOS development       

  • Strong object-oriented programming and design skill

  • Experience with both Objective-C and Swift 

  • Experience using network-based resources

  • Experience in writing multi-threaded, asynchronous code

  • Deep understanding of software design patterns for clean, consistent, simple and efficient code

  • Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills

  • Passion for quality and attention to detail

  • Passion for clean, consistent, simple and efficient code

  • Strong mobile application UI development skills


Nice to have:



  • Experience with reactive programming

  • Experience with AVFoundation Framework

  • Extended knowledge on MVP, MVVM or Viper


 What’s in it for you:



  • Working alongside a bunch of super talented and friendly people

  • A fun, diverse, open and fast-paced environment focused on family atmosphere and creating an off-the-hook user experience

  • Challenging and stimulating projects

  • Working with modern techs, in a culture that likes to drive constant innovation

  • PC or Mac, you pick

  • 50% off your monthly OPUS subscription

  • Free Access to a virtual health care application. Long gone are the days of waiting 8 hours at the clinic!

  • Conferences, training on the latest and greatest techs, weekly presentations and more..

  • Very competitive insurance package which is mostly covered by Octave Group

  • Beautiful offices right next to Jarry Park 

  • Flexible hours and working environment


Développeur iOS
Montréal, Canada


L’usage du masculin dans ce document a pour unique but d’alléger le texte.


Vous aimez créer des applications raffinées et intuitives en gardant l’esprit orienté vers l'utilisateur, tout au long du cycle de développement ? En tant que Développeur iOS, vous vous approprierez la création de fonctionnalités impressionnantes qui feront une différence dans la manière dont les usagers interagissent avec la musique par le biais des iPhones. Vous y parviendrez en travaillant avec des équipes multidisciplinaires qui sauront tirer parti de votre contribution, afin d'apporter de l'innovation à nos produits mobiles Touchtunes et Apple Music for Business !

Ton quotidien ressemblera à ceci:



  • Collaborer avec des équipes interfonctionnelles, regroupant les responsables et gestionnaires de produits, les concepteurs et autres développeurs pour définir, concevoir et lancer  de nouvelles fonctionnalités

  • Travailler avec des sources de données et des API externes

  • Coder des tests unitaires incluant les cas marginaux, pour assurer la robustesse, la facilité d'utilisation et la fiabilité générale

  • Corriger les bogues et améliorer les performances des applications

  • Découvrir, évaluer et continuellement mettre en œuvre de nouvelles technologies afin de maximiser l'efficacité du développement


Ce que l’on recherche:



  • BS / BA en ingénierie, informatique ou équivalent

  • Au moins 3 ans d'expérience de développement iOS

  • Solides compétences en matière de programmation et de conception orientées objet

  • Expérience avec iOS Objective-C et Swift

  • Expérience de l'utilisation des ressources basé sur le réseau

  • Expérience en écriture de code asynchrone multi-threaded

  • Solide compréhension des modèles de conception logicielle

  • Passion pour un code propre, de qualité, cohérent, simple et efficace

  • Fortes compétences en matière de développement d'applications mobiles UI


Atouts :



  • Expérience de la programmation réactive

  • Expérience avec AVFoundation Framework

  • Connaissances approfondies sur MVP, MVVM ou Viper


Ce que l’on te propose:



  • Évoluer aux côtés de personnes super talentueuses et amicales.

  • Un environnement amusant, diversifié, ouvert et dynamique, axé sur une atmosphère familiale et la création d’une expérience utilisateur optimale.

  • Des projets stimulants et amusants.

  • Travailler avec des technologies de pointe dans une culture d'innovation constante.

  • PC ou Mac, ton choix.

  • 50% de réduction sur l’abonnement mensuel à OPUS.

  • Accès gratuit à une application offrant un support de santé virtuel. Fini les attentes interminables en clinique!

  • Conférences, budget de formation sur les technologies les plus récentes et les plus performantes, présentations hebdomadaires et plus…

  • Avantages sociaux compétitifs principalement couverts par Octave Group.

  • Superbes bureaux à deux pas du parc Jarry.

  • Horaires et environnement de travail flexibles.

title: Dart / Flutter Developer - Shop Applications at ABOUT YOU GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
description:
We are currently looking for a skilled Dart /Flutter Developer to support us building the fastest & most intuitive shopping app using a brand new tech stack!


The Shop Applications Team constantly improves the App, Mobile Website and Desktop Website. These big-scale products are each visited by several million people every month. The team’s focus is to provide the most inspiring, convenient, intuitive, and easy-to-use shopping experience for our customers. They constantly challenge themselves to raise the bar of what is “state of the art” in customer-facing products.



Challenges the team will be working on in the next 12 months:



  • Improving the customer experience by continuously implementing new features, optimizing user flow, and increasing technical performance

  • Optimizing the eCommerce performance based on A/B Tests and KPI goals



What you will do



  • Implement new features in our App version using Dart and Flutter to reach the highest performance standards

  • Work closely together with other experienced developers, product managers, QA, and designers to ship new components and features

  • Be a mentor to more junior team members and always act as a good example regarding coding standards and code reviews

  • Work on the implementation of high-leverage features to optimize UX and conversion rates

  • Draft architectural decisions together with our Tech Lead and explore new technologies

  • Have a direct impact on team processes by regular agile retrospectives




Who you are



  • You have 3+ years of experience in building complex customer-facing applications

  • You are very proficient in App development and had first touch points coding in Dart, alternatively experienced in related technologies (e.g. Typescript, C#, Swift and/or Objective C)

  • You have a deep understanding of the basics and worked in a fast-changing environment before

  • You have a very good understanding of React

  • You write well-structured, efficient and maintainable code and actively keep the quality of the code base in check

  • You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

  • You are used to working in an English speaking environment





Nice to have:



  • Touchpoints with Typescript / Native Development ( Swift / Objective C )

  • Previous work experience in the AWS ecosystem

title: Senior Android Developer at Backbase (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
The Job in short
As a Senior Android Engineer in the Mobile SDK team, you will use Java and Kotlin to build secure, enterprise-grade capabilities used by developers and end-users.

Meet the job
You will design, build and extend core capabilities for the Backbase Mobile Platform from tooling to secure authentication based on our IAM solution. We love clean, testable, and maintainable code as we are building a product that is continuously evolving. Customers use our product to power and create their mobile apps.

You will be part of a small multidisciplinary agile team that is responsible for delivering an end-to-end solution, from concept to production-ready software.

As a team member, you will contribute to all aspects of product development, starting from gathering feedback and implementing actual functionality, to writing tests, documentation and supporting adoption.

In our teams, we use the following mobile technologies:
- Java
- Kotlin
- Python (tooling)
- Jenkins (groovy pipelines)
- Maven and Gradle

We like to keep work interesting and we encourage our developers to develop their personal strengths. Whether it’s deep-diving into technology, Agile processes, or moving into full-stack development, at Backbase we offer you the room to grow.
  
How about you
You are a result-oriented engineer who is familiar with agile software development practices and methodologies. You care about code quality and you thrive in a complex domain. Security and other non-functionals don't scare you and you have what it takes to uphold our high standards.


Are you ready to engage with a product that will never be finished?

title: Software Engineer - Junior/Intermediate at General Dynamics Mission SystemsCanada (Ottawa, ON, Canada)
description:
Available in Ottawa, ON and Dartmouth, NS


As a software developer, you will be developing software using modern development techniques, to create new capabilities, enhance existing capabilities, and improve the way we develop and deliver solutions to our customer.


Part of an agile development team and will work within a test-driven development approach to contribute to all parts of the software development process, including designing, implementing, and testing software features for the product. Our software engineers perform analysis of logical interface documents from third party vendors to determine how equipment can be integrated. You will also develop and document software in C/C++ to exchange data with equipment and appropriate user interfaces to allow presentation of received data and control of systems via their external interfaces.


Essential Skills:



  • Experience with technical writing

  • Understanding of Software Engineering principles and applying those techniques, tools and knowledge to the task at hand.

  • Positive approach to learning and trying new things.

  • Strong problem solving and root cause analysis skills.


Assets:



  • Experience using a software source control tools such as Clearcase , Git or equivalent

  • Experience with Linux

  • Experience with C, C++, Python development

  • Experience with general AI tools

  • Experience with algorithmic and signal processing software


Must be able to obtain and maintain Canadian Security clearance and a positive CGP (Controlled Goods Assessment). Eligibility to work in Canada either as a Canadian citizen or PR (permanent resident)

title: (Senior) Game Data Analyst (f/m/d) at Kolibri Games (Berlin, Germany)
description:
Are you the kind of person who wonders what kind of people play idle games? Are you the kind of person who - through an unbiased lens - wants to figure out not only what people do but try to understand why they do it? And can you take that knowledge and transform it into action points that are easy to understand and make the game more fun, rewarding, and engaging to play?


This is the kind of curiosity, initiative, and knowledge we expect from the ideal candidate for Game Data Analyst here at Kolibri Games. You will work alongside our Product Director, analyzing in-game metrics and offering insights, evaluations, and direct recommendations that will change how our games evolve for the better. 


In this role, you will dive deep into the data by building visualizations and down-to-earth reports - applying a mixture of psychology or economics - to understand how the game works and what players do. You will demonstrate your expertise by actively sharing that knowledge and insight in an easy to understand way - and in doing so become a pivotal contributor to the success of our games.


Responsibilities



  • Partner with Product Managers and Marketing Managers to identify key strategic questions, metrics, and actionable tests.

  • Provide end-user friendly, recommendations and insights to product managers, game designers, leadership, and marketing.

  • Research and develop cutting edge data-mining, data collection, and statistical techniques and apply them to game design, monetization, and other key business behaviors.

  • Build and educate a world-class team of analysts to bring agile data-driven decision making throughout the company.


Required skills



  • 3+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst

  • Previous experience using Data Visualization Tools such as; Looker, Tableau or similar

  • Professional experience with at least Python, R or similar

  • The ability to understand data and communicate this in a coherent manner to technical as well as non-technical team members

  • Confidence presenting to multiple people with the ability to clearly and concisely explain key findings

  • Ability to work within a fast-paced environment


Desirable skills



  • Previous experience within a Free to Play games studio

  • Strong SQL skills in an enterprise data environment

  • An interest in machine learning, data science, business intelligence, and data technologies


Your Benefits – We’re game to support you



  • Competitive Salary - We believe that top performers should receive top payment

  • Training Budget - We believe in learning. A generous personal learning budget to spend on learning and development, including books, workshops and attending conferences. We also offer in-house training such as coding and German classes

  • Flexible working hours and Home office – We believe in a good work-life balance

  • Equipment - State-of-the-art technical equipment, including laptops and phones, which may also be used in your free time

  • Health and Fitness - We pay €50 towards a monthly gym membership or a fitness activity

  • Relocation - Relocation support to help you move to Berlin

  • Pension - Opportunity to save for your pension tax-free 


 Bonus Level – We love to have a good time, too



  • Food and Drinks - Fresh fruits to keep you healthy and fresh coffee to keep you alert. We also have a fully stocked fridge with Smoothies, Coke, Club Mate, beer etc

  • Parties and Team Events - Apart from our regular parties, BBQ’s and movie nights we also have a team event budget you can use to buy games or sports equipment to make working here even more fun

  • Company Holidays - Every year we go on an amazing company holiday to relax and bond as a team. Last summer we went to Greece!

  • Friday Celebrations - Company-provided dinner and drinks on Friday afternoons



Kolibri Games is an equal opportunity employer. We come from 25 different countries and many different backgrounds. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of their age, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, physical appearance or disability. 


We are an international studio, so don’t forget to send in your application in English. Although it is not mandatory, we always appreciate a cover letter stating your motivation to join us.


We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Unity Lead: Bring an entirely new game to life, from start to finish at Goodgame Studios (Hamburg, Deutschland)
description:
Unity Lead Engineer


In this role, you get the rare opportunity to bring a new game to life and develop it from start to finish. You lead and execute the technical design as well as the implementation of the Unity client, where you set up the project structure, decide on tools and workflows, work with server developers and are a guide for junior developers who can learn from you. You work directly with game designers and artists and report to the Studio Technical Director.


About yourself



  • You are an experienced senior software developer and lead engineer with relevant years of successful experience leading a small, focused team of developers

  • You have shipped at least one commercially successful (Top 100) Unity game and have relevant years of personal experience working as a Unity engineer in the games industry

  • You’re self-organized, motivated, focused and disciplined; a do-er & maker

  • You have excellent knowledge of the Unity game engine, 2D, C# and OOP principles

  • You have experience with iOS and Android Mobile Development

  • You have an excellent understanding and practical experience of applying Software Architecture, how to structure a Unity project that scales, its workflows, pipelines, etc

  • You have knowledge on Git and eventually Perforce

  • Your understanding of and experience with cross-platform development and client-server applications is excellent

  • You are used to working in agile, fast-paced environments

  • You are a team player and leader, an extroverted, excellent communicator who loves to work in an international team

  • Your written and spoken English is excellent

  • A valid work and residence permit is a plus


Responsibilities



  • Take an active part in game creation and specification

  • Client development of complex multiplayer mobile games

  • Collaborate in the development of innovative new games in interdisciplinary and international teams

  • Build Prototypes of concepts based on the game design

  • Creating and improving our asset workflows

  • Deliver high quality and well-structured code

  • Share knowledge, help and mentor colleagues

  • Must love to roll­up your sleeves and get dirty with Unity3D; integrating textures, animation, meshes, adjusting lighting, setting camera angles, optimization, audio


 WE OFFER



  • A professional team of experts that has fun at work

  • Your professional growth is important to us. We provide agile structures, flat hierarchies, and ongoing training opportunities

  • Results-oriented teamwork that values employee contribution and empowerment

  • Competitive compensation and a balanced work-life balance

title: Developer / Software Engineer (Agile / Scrum) at Hays (Orlando, FL)
description:
Developer / Software Engineer (Agile / Scrum) - Contract - Orlando, FL - $69.00-$72.00/hr


Hays Specialist Recruitment is working in partnership with The Walt Disney Company to manage the recruitment of this position

The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.

When's the last time you walked by Chewbacca on your way in to the office? If the answer was "never," then this is the role for you! The Disney Guest Experience team is looking to add top level talent on highly-visible, highly confidential projects to help bolster upcoming enhancements to several of their Orlando theme parks. Working in a lean production environment with an extremely exciting development stack, you'll help contribute to experiences customers touch in the theme parks every single day - and you'll be able to see them using it out of your very desk window. If you're a progressive engineer looking to make the next step in your career, please apply!



Role Description
The Software Engineer will be involved in the design, development, testing and implementation of new features, software fixes, enhancements to existing applications. Will be working with business partners to understand the requirements and work with technical architects and engineers to implement solutions.

Skills & Requirements
* Hands on experience dealing with complex custom applications and frameworks such as content transformation, conversion and assembly.
* Experience with cloud architecture and implementing cloud solutions.
* Experience with complex data analysis, data migrations, and system integration, strong object-oriented programming skills.
* Experience with source control and build deploy tools such as Git, Jenkins, Maven, CICD etc.
* Experience with Agile development methodology such as SCRUM.
* Team player, solution provider and proactive thinker with good communication skills
* Experience with Couch-base No SQL Databases. MySQL and Oracle, Maria relational Databases.
* Monitoring tools like App Dynamics and Cloud Watch
* Experience with docker containers and AWS S3.
* Hands on experience on Cloud Build and Deployment.
* Ability to learn quickly, take directions from Architects and implement solutions.
* Ability to work on multi-projects simultaneously
* Design and develop applications using java/j2ee technologies in a fast-paced complex environment.
* Experience with Content Management is a plus.
* Work with Infrastructure and other application teams to resolve live site/production issues
* Upgrade infrastructure and vendor tools
* Perform test cycles to identify possible complex integration issues in a complex environment
* System development documentation including functional requirements, use cases, test plans and test cases
* Works with various IT teams to analyze and implement solutions provided by architects to meet the business requirements.
* Follow software development methodologies, version control, and migration standards.

title: Test Engineer / QA Automation (Selenium, Behave) at Tenet3 (Dayton, OH)
description:
Tenet3 is seeking a Test Engineer to join our DevOps team in Dayton, OH. At Tenet3, we continually try to break our own software so that we can build it back, better than before. Test engineers at Tenet3 aren't manual testers -- you will write scripts to automate tests and integrate your tests into the continuous integration / continuous deployment pipeline. You will navigate Tenet3's code repositories, identifying weaknesses, problem areas and performance shortcomings in the code.


Essential Job Duties


You will use test automation tools such as selenium and behave to develop tests that keep Tenet3 software working across browsers and platforms under rapid development cycles. You will:



  • Automate repeated tasks and build test coverage through existing or new infrastructure

  • Lead/collaborate on improving developer and engineering team's test coverage, release velocity and production health

  • Collaborate with the engineering and design to ensure features work according to specifications

  • Participate in peer reviews of code written by other developers

  • Troubleshoot production problems related to software applications

  • Assist in the evaluation and recommendation of application integration and testing tools

  • Assist in preparing estimates for implementing new system enhancements


Skills/Qualifications



  • Eligibility to establish and maintain a Department of Defense Top Secret security clearance

  • 3 years of relevant work experience, including development and/or test automation experience

  • Deep knowledge of testing methodologies, creating test cases and debugging

  • Experience testing JavaScript applications on a collaborative team

  • Experience interacting with APIs (REST, SOAP or GraphQL)

  • A work portfolio with clean, well-tested code (Github, Codepen, personal website or equivalent)

  • Familiarity with databases

  • Knowledge of Unix/Linux environments


Education/Experience


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or a similar discipline.


Company


Tenet3 is a cyber analytics company based in Dayton, Ohio. We develop software products supporting advanced machine learning, property graph analysis, and enhanced human cognition. Our tag line is Cybernetics. We seek synergies between human insights and machine automation. Working together our software platforms and human analysts enable a concept we call “explainable security.” This offers our customers a unique window into the trustworthiness of complex, interconnected, cyber-physical systems. Successful software drives our growth. We need you, your talents, and your experience to drive our success.


Benefits



  • Generous PTO

  • Additional sick days

  • Floating holidays

  • 100% paid medical, vision, and dental for employee & family

  • HSA with company contributions

  • Education reimbursement for higher education, conferences and self-study

  • 401(k) Retirement Plan with company match and profit sharing

  • Short and Long-term Disability

  • Life Insurance

  • Casual environment with smart, creative people

  • Flex time

  • Free coffee and snacks

  • Monthly wellness classes with free lunch


Salary Range


$65k - $95k (paid relocation available)

title: Senior Software Engineer at Loggi (Lisbon, Portugal)
description:
Our business


Logistics in Brazil is inefficient and costs 12% of GDP to the Brazilian economy while consumers expect ever more convenience and timely deliveries. Through technology (mobile, AI, automation, IOT), we have created a next generation logistics network which is fast, cost-efficient and reliable.


With SoftBank, Microsoft, GGV Capital and others, the new investment round has brought Loggi’s valuation up to US$1 billion!


"We believe that the main bottleneck lies in the quality of delivery. And so we are very clear about where we want to operate." (Arthur Debert; CPO & Co-founder)




Our Engineering Team


Loggi’s engineering team is focused on solving highly complex problems, mixing up very experienced professionals and early career employees, in an environment fortified by learning, sharing of experiences and respect. Together, we will build  the logistics network of the country, developing unique algorithms, systems and processes.


Our leaders have already left their mark in the national and worldwide tech scenario, working in companies like Google and UOL. They  are engaged in finding how to develop a group of more than a thousand programmers to explore the knowledge borders and connect the country.


We believe and invest in everyone's potential: Loggers from today will be the next CTOs in 5 years!



Our expansion


The Technology market is well heated in Portugal and Lisbon is the technology hub of the moment. You will find many learning opportunities, new ways of working and exchange knowledge with professionals from all over the world. We want to bring together a team of top talents and leaders to develop highly innovative solutions, helping us to create the next generation of logistics: fast, cost-effective and reliable.


“Building technology for the logistics world gives us the opportunity to solve complex problems on a large scale.”’ (Eduardo Thuler, Portugal Site Lead)



Our culture


Loggi has its own style: casual, spontaneous and empathic.


We value transparency, and we are interested in diversity and social responsibility. We are high tech, far from conservative, and we’re always up to speed! Above everything, we expect desire and the ability to acquire knowledge and learn fast.


Being part of Loggi should mean you can be who you are—or want to be—without feeling excluded.



About the challenge


You will architect and develop high quality scalable solutions, being part of multidisciplinare squads seeking an amazing and efficient experience for the users!


As the technical focus point on a squad, we’ll count on you on the development of ideas and solutions that solve complex problems and generate great results for the team.


Loggi’s engineering team works with a wide variety of technologies and techniques to solve our challenges. We try to see beyond the buzzwords to develop software in a pragmatic and efficient way.


To spark your curiosity, we work on python/django, kotlin/micronaut; predictive models trained with sklearn and keras/tensorflow; native and hybrid apps, and PWAs; algorithms of optimization based on or-tools, Systems in Azure and AWS, with and without kubernetes. In addition we also use Looker and ELK for dashboards and analysis.


Above everything, we expect desire and the ability to acquire knowledge and learn fast.



We value Software Engineers who have



  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in software development or 6+ years in academic / technical field, regardless of language/technology;

  • Good knowledge of algorithms and data structure;

  • Experience working in a collaborative way, with others engineers, product managers and designers;

  • Autonomy, analytical mindset, problem solving abilities supported by best practices in coding;

  • Willingness to work full-stack and easy transition between technologies and languages;

  • Familiarity with agile trends.



Benefits



  • Accommodation and visa support

  • Competitive compensation package, including the possibility to earn equity ownership

  • Financial incentive for your technical development

  • Meal and transportation allowance

  • Health and life insurance

  • No Dress Code!

title: PHP / Symfony Developer (m/f/d) at AVANTGARDE - "Creating Fans" (Mnchen, Deutschland)
description:
Stellenbeschreibung


Digitization is changing the way we communicate with each other and with our environment. Especially digital event solutions have become an absolute must-have today. Benefits:

title: Senior Software Developer/Engineer - iOS/Android (Senior, Remote) at TopDevz () (allows remote)

If you’re passionate about mobile platforms and translating code into user-friendly apps, we would like to meet you. As an iOS/Android developer, you’ll collaborate with internal teams to develop functional mobile applications, while working in a fast-paced environment.
