Your portfolio is strong and shows a wide variety of digital design, and human-centered-design methodologies underpinned by collaboration and a team approach.

You are also energized by jumping into something new. We are building the Digital Experience Design team from the ground up while also delivering compelling experiences. We are early in establishing the org, design maturity, approaches, and ways of working, and you would have the opportunity to help drive this in our new location. You contribute to driving a team atmosphere of positivity, empathy, connection and compassion to create psychological safety to foster a culture of craft, community and collaboration. You are experienced in remote working and reporting to a remote manager.

We are interested in candidates with a variety of Experience Design Skills:
- Digital UX Product Design
- Human-centered-design methodologies
- Interaction Design (Wireframing & Prototyping)
- Information Architecture
- Visual Design
- Strategic Concept Development
- Usability Testing / UX Research


And as a person, your friends will say you have the following soft skills:
- Self-Motivation
- Negotiation & Collaboration
- Verbal & Written Communication
- Critical & Logical Thinking
- Resourcefulness
- Tolerance of Change
- Networking
- Mentorship


TOGETHER AS A TEAM
At Group Digital, we set the digital agenda to enable IKEA to become the world´s leading multichannel home furnishing company.

We drive the development, provision and operation of our digital products and services using new and existing technology with agile delivery methods. At the same time, we provide a home for digital skills to both develop and extend technical, people and business skills needed to continuous development and growth.

Where our Digital Transformation is allowing us to create new ways we meet and interact with our customers and co-workers, our Experience Design team is responsible for shaping what the future actually looks like. The team has a clear vision: to create everyday digital experiences for the many people through our human-centric methodologies that enable design, inspiration and innovation. This is where we need your help to help us get there!

title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer at DornerWorks (Grand Rapids, MI)
description:
DornerWorks, a leader in embedded engineering design, is seeking an experienced Embedded Software Engineer to join our talented engineering team. Based in Grand Rapids, you will be creating the newest devices on the freshest silicon. You will keep up with industry trends, participate in software design decisions, and continue to add to your development portfolio. If you are someone who hits their stride working with other talented embedded engineers, this is the opportunity you have been seeking.

What you will do:



  • Develop embedded software

  • Collaborate with your team and with customers

  • Contribute on technical project teams

  • Inspire innovation

  • Influence best practices

  • Mentor colleagues in your areas of expertise

  • Grow your expertise partnering with our outstanding team



Working at DornerWorks is a little different than most companies. We get the opportunity to work with a variety of customers in nearly every industry to help them produce standout products. Our customers engage us to develop all or part of new product development or existing product rework. You will work with a team of embedded software and hardware engineers as well as IoT and separation technology team members to produce really cool things. Then we do it over again for a new customer or project, often with a new DornerWorks team.

Experience we like to see:



  • Multi-threaded real-time embedded application development experience

  • Familiarity with many embedded communication standards (SPI, I2C, UART, RS-XXX, Ethernet, CAN, LIN, USB, etc.)

  • Experience with multiple microcontrollers, cores, and technologies (ARM, Freescale, Microchip, Texas Instruments, etc.)



DornerWorks specializes in safety critical embedded solutions, including HW, SW, IoT, and FPGA. Engineers at DornerWorks are making aircraft safer, hostile threat identification quicker, hospital patients more comfortable, coffee tastier, and grilling more fun. Join DornerWorks and be a vital part of our team that works together creating fun and exciting embedded solutions. Learn more about DornerWorks and our culture from our website at www.DornerWorks.com

What we need from you:



  • BS in Electrical Engineer (BSEE/BSE), Computer Engineering (BSCE), or Computer Science (BSCS)

  • 7+ years of professional success in embedded software development

  • Unrestricted right to work in the US without requiring sponsorship



What we offer you:



  • Competitive compensation and benefits

  • A health work/life balance that is not just a catchy phrase; it is one of our core values

  • Compressed work week, with the opportunity to take every other Friday off and flexible hours

  • A collaborative team where you can work with other outstanding technical minds.

title: Jr to Mid-Level iOS Developer - Healthcare IT at Avenel - An Allscripts Solution (Litchfield, IL)
description:
Avenel – An Allscripts Solution – Litchfield, IL


We’re looking for smart people to help us build a revolutionary new take on the Electronic Health Record (EHR/EMR). Our premise is simple. Technology should enhance a relationship with patients and help clinicians provide even better care. 


Why work for us? This isn’t your typical corporate job. With the culture of a startup and the security of a publicly traded company, every person plays an integral role in mission-critical work. When you work for us, we’ll help you grow your skills and knowledge while working with the most talented people of your career. We are solution-seekers, community builders, and life-changers.



Ideal candidate has the following:



  • Familiarity with Swift and the iOS ecosystem

  • Experience consuming REST APIs

  • Has published at least one app in the App Store





#22172

title: vLocity Developer (Salesforce) at Eagle Creek Software Services (Eden Prairie, MN)
description:
Duties



  • Participate in the development of  Salesforce applications based on client needs for integration, implementation, and customization projects

  • Mentor and train, formally and informally, Eagle Creek’s Jr. and mid-level resources

  • Foster and maintain development and integration standards, best practices and related deliverables with the EC team

  • Ability to travel for initial project set-up and major milestones as required

Required Technical Skills

  • 2+ years experience with end to end Salesforce.com implementations, integrations, and enhancement projects

  • 2+ years APEX and Visualforce development for custom Salesforce functionality

  • Experience integrating business processes across disparate systems and multiple Salesforce instances using web services, SOAP, XML, REST, MSMQ, workflow, XML, HTML, UML and JavaScript

  • Development of  custom objects, fields and formulas, custom reports, and dashboards

  • Integration experience with other Salesforce Applications and External systems

  • Development of SOAP and REST based web services used for custom development

  • Solid understanding of SaaS and CRM development processes and methodologies

  • Create supporting technical documentation and detailed design specifications

 Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: QA Test Engineer at FortressIQ (San Francisco, CA)
description:
At FortressIQ we’re developing process cognition technologies that understand how businesses operate. We’re improving people’s work lives by helping to automate routine tasks, allowing them to focus on higher value work and more meaningful interactions. We’re applying the latest advances in computer vision and machine learning to deliver the insights and tools businesses need to empower the digital workforce. We’ve built the first AI platform that can understand a company’s workflows through simple observation, dramatically improving their organizational understanding. If you’re interested in designing and building a new category of business tools, and radically improving operations for some of the largest companies in the world, join us. To do that, we’re building enterprise-grade products that need to scale—to thousands of bots, hundreds of users, and real-time data throughput—while giving our customers the experience they expect. That’s where you come in.


What You'll Accomplish




    • Helping build out our testing infrastructure

    • Working within our product engineering team to test and validate new features, as they’re released to customers

    • Working to constantly improve our QA environment

    • Working with Trello boards to improve and streamline FortressIQ development process

    • Test and promote release candidate builds to production ready docker containers

    • Work with Docker and Kubernetes to deploy and test FortressIQ applications in any cloud provider infrastructures, such as GCP, Azure, AWS and Minikube

    • Generate Jenkins CI/CD pipeline definitions to automate applications and services builds and deployments



What You'll Need




    • The ideal candidate is used to automating repetitive tasks, has worked on top-flight QA infrastructure for Enterprise products, and most importantly, is creative

    • Strong testing and software engineering experience, preferably on high-volume customer-facing software-as-a-service products

    • Hands-on experience with testing and debugging modern web browsers and extensions

    • Experience in testing HTTP/HTTPS, REST endpoints

    • Hands-on experience with SQL queries and PostgreSQL database

    • Experience in creating custom test automation scripts and using test automation frameworks

    • Hands-on experience with many of today’s best QA, testing and automation platforms—and the knowledge to know when to use which

    • Experience with CI/CD tools, containers, and modern commercial cloud providers



Bonus Points




    • Experience working in agile software development environment

    • Experience in web load and stress test automations



About FortressIQ FortressIQ defines security, insights and governance in enterprise business automation and AI. Based in San Francisco, and backed by Lightspeed Ventures and some of the other best names in venture capital, we’re building the defining platform for managing automation within the Global 2000. We believe that algorithms and bots work best when they’re managed like employees: given the tools they need to succeed while being held to clear standards of success. Our mission is to help this new ‘digital workforce’ thrive within the enterprise by addressing the security, compliance and data problems endemic to using today’s automation platforms at scale.

title: IT Engineer at DISQO (Glendale, CA)
description:
DISQO is a next-generation consumer insights platform. We provide the highest quality consumer data to the world's largest market research agencies, analytics companies, and brands. We operate one of the world's largest true consumer insights panels. This data helps our clients understand user behavior, build better experiences, and make better decisions. We utilize cutting-edge technology and innovative, out-of-the-box strategies to collect and analyze insights which help shape the products and services of tomorrow.


At DISQO, we are on a mission to transform the future of insights. Every day, we help people tune in to their customers, help our audience amplify their impact on the brands they love, and help the world build better products and amazing experiences.


What you will do:


Your primary focus will be on our back-end IT engineering. Our ideal candidate will be passionate about designing, organizing, modifying, and deploying a cloud-based, service-oriented IT infrastructure and the processes that support it.  If you have a proven track record of delivering such systems to internal customers, then this role is for you.


What you bring to the table:



  • 4+ years of overall experience in IT engineering roles with increasing responsibility.

  • Experience building a cloud-based, service-oriented infrastructure from inception to roll-out

  • Experience planning and managing IT projects using agile / scrum frameworks and JIRA.

  • Experience planning IT infrastructure changes and roll-outs in a way that anticipates the needs of varied needs of all levels of the organization

  • The ability to champion processes that enable scaling of our IT infrastructure.

  • Experience with mixed (MacOs and Windows) environments

  • Experience with the roll-out and maintenance of MDM, asset management, and personal backup solutions

  • An awareness of infosec considerations and the ability to balance security requirements with delivery and ease-of-use

  • Knowledge of network engineering and basic network protocols and services such as TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS, and VPN.

  • Experience with the following technologies: Endpoint protection (Crowdstrike), Cisco Meraki, OKTA, GSuite Administration, JumpCloud, Jamf


Perks & Benefits:



  • 100% covered Medical/Dental/Vision for employee

  • Equity

  • Unlimited Vacation

  • Flexible work hours

  • Catered lunches 3x a week

  • Stocked pantry

  • Happy Hours

  • Onsite Fitness Program

  • Discounted Gym Membership

  • Quarterly Offsites

  • 401K

  • Life Insurance

  • FSA

  • Paid Maternity/Paternity leave

  • Employee Assistance Program

  • Travel Assistance Program


DISQO is an equal opportunity employer


Recruiting firms that submit resumes to DISQO without first entering into a written contract will not be entitled to any compensation on candidates referred by that firm.

title: Salesforce Developer (Visualforce / APEX) at Hays (Denver, CO)
description:
Salesforce Developer (Visualforce / APEX) - CTP or Perm - Denver, CO

Hays Specialist Recruitment is working in partnership with Pinnacol Assurance to manage the recruitment of this position.


The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.


Large Salesforce Team with some true experts in DX communities, mastering Lightning Web Components and speaking at DreamForce conferences. You will get the chance to learn from these people as well as the consultants they have hired to guide them through their internal Business Transformation. You won't find a bigger SF shop in town. Excellent work/life balance. Tons of company perks. They foster learning and will pay for your SF certifications so you can perfect your craft. Gain sharing adds a nice chunk to your pocket and its paid quarterly. They have big hearts and love big ideas. Celebrate continuous improvement, innovation, compassion, teamwork, integrity and excellence. Speaking of celebrating, they love having fun at work. They host holiday parties, on-site painting classes, and employees love their yoga classes and book club!


Role Description
As a Salesforce Developer, you will be responsible for the development, integration, and deployment of custom solutions using Apex and Visualforce to enhance the Customer platform.

Skills & Requirements
* Provide innovative solutions leveraging Salesforce's Force.com capabilities and make recommendations to support a rapidly increasing org.
* Develop custom code using Visualforce, APEX, and other technologies to build customized solutions supporting business initiatives/processes.
* Implement best practices by developing, refining, iterating, integrating, testing, staging and deploying maintainable technical solutions.
* Use analytical skills and judgement to solve problems and make decisions in a rapidly changing environment.
* Communicate complicated problems to team members to ensure we are coming up with the right solutions.
* Accountable for effectively leading, communicating and managing change ensuring sustainability of process and performance enhancement.
* Remain current on the external environment for industry leading tools, technology, analytics and best practices to continuously improve Cake's customer value proposition.

title: Cloud Native GO Backend Developer (w/m/d) at Schwarz IT KG (Weinsberg, Germany)
description:
DEINE AUFGABEN



  • Entwicklung und Betrieb aller Kubernetes Operatoren für die Cloud-Plattform der Schwarz Gruppe

  • Durchführung von Problem- und Fehleranalysen und Identifikation nachhaltiger Lösungen

  • Automatisierung und kontinuierliche Optimierung aller technischen Prozessabläufe



DEIN PROFIL



  • Leidenschaft und Begeisterung für neue Technologien und Themen rund um Softwareentwicklung und Kubernetes

  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Programmierung mit Python und/oder GO

  • Erfahrung in der Anwendung der 12Factor Prinzipien

  • Idealerweise Kenntnisse in weiteren Programmiersprachen und/oder Frontend-Technologien

  • Kenntnisse hinsichtlich Continuous Deployment bzw. Test Driven Development Prozessen

  • Eigeninitiative und zielgerichtet Arbeitsweise in unserem Team

  • Gute Englischkenntnisse


UNSER ANGEBOT



  • Verantwortungsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit

  • Individuelle Angebote zur persönlichen und fachlichen Weiterentwicklung

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und gute Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf

  • Sicherer Arbeitsplatz und ein motiviertes Team

  • Attraktive Vergütung und Sozialleistungen

title: Infrastructure/Site Reliability Engineer at Wildlife (State of So Paulo, Brazil)
description:
About the Team


An engineer in our team works with a global scale infrastructure and has a great impact on millions of players. To guarantee the best experience possible, we count with several Kubernetes clusters spread around the world and connected to each other. We are in the cutting edge of open-source infrastructure technology, we adopted Kubernetes in production little after the project was launched and today we use technologies such as eBPF and Cilium in our network stack.


We handle billions of logs daily and have hundreds of nodes and thousands of containers to serve more than 1 million requests per minute. We know this number will only grow and we're looking for engineers that can help with the challenges of provisioning and operating infrastructure at large scale.


About the Role 


Wildlife Studios is searching for infrastructure/site reliability engineers to join our team. We seek an engineer with solid programming, network, and operating systems knowledge. Since we are always looking for new tools and technologies that better solve our problems, we value professionals that like to learn new things, are autonomous and proactive to bring and implement their ideas.


We'll need you to understand our systems flows, diagnose problems in the production environment, identify points of improvement and automation, and guarantee that we have the necessary infrastructure to create the best games in the world.


Who you are




    • Player focused. We are player-oriented and infrastructure has a great impact on their experience. You have empathy with our players and focus on ensuring they have an amazing experience. You aim for a top-level infrastructure, guaranteeing the highest availability possible.

    • Automation is key to scaling. We look for engineers that have a history of projecting and executing automation projects in order to get rid of any manual and repetitive tasks.

    • Calm and pragmatism. When everything seems to be falling apart around you, you have a plan and keep calm.

    • Bleeding edge. You are curious and like to study new technologies, test new solutions and measure the impact brought by changes. We want to ensure we are using the best stack possible 



What you’ll do




    • Develop, monitor and optimize infrastructure clusters (Kubernetes, Elasticsearch, MongoDB, Kafka...).

    • Define monitoring and observability patterns.

    • Troubleshoot and manage incidents in production.

    • Automate and improve infrastructure provisioning (Infrastructure as Code).



What you'll need




    • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent experience.

    • Linux knowledge. You should be able to discuss in detail what happens under the hood (SO, kernel, network).

    • Solid knowledge in at least one programming language. We work mostly with Go and Python.



Plus




    • Experience with large scale production systems and technologies.

    • Experience with Kubernetes.

    • Experience with monitoring systems (eg: Datadog, Statsd, Grafana, etc).

    • Experience with infrastructure as code tools (eg: Ansible, Terraform, etc).

    • Experience with messaging systems such as Kafka and Emqtt.

    • Experience with database management (Postgres, MongoDB, Cassandra, Redis, ElasticSearch).

    • Experience with CI/CD pipelines (eg: Jenkins, Travis, etc).



We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build the best gaming company, where everyone thrives.

title: Technical Product Owner - eCommerce Platform at Yum! Brands, Inc. (Chicago, IL)
description:
Who we are:


Our story might surprise you. We’re the world’s largest restaurant company—encompassing KFC, Pizza Hut, and Taco Bell—but there’s a lot more going on behind the scenes than just frying chicken, baking pizzas, and serving up tacos. We put this delicious food in the hands of customers through apps, websites, kiosks, POS, and other digital dining experiences – and we are only getting started. Here in Chicago, we’re building out a bold team of hackers to help Yum! Brands deliver the next generation of software to 49,000 restaurants in more than 145 countries. That’s a huge responsibility, which is why we’re on a mission to find the most fearless engineers to join our software startup within Yum!.


Yum!'s vision for the future is simple: a world with more Yum!: with our iconic brands in more places, and more ways for consumers to access them. The key and not-so-secret ingredient in our recipe for growth is our unrivaled talent and culture, which fuels our results. And like all companies who win consistently, our brands, employees, and franchisees will need to continually adjust to stay relevant now and in the future. The software we’re building does just that: it serves people in new ways to make team members more productive and customers happier.



What we need:


Our dynamic eCommerce Platform team is rapidly growing as we optimize our digital ordering channels and technology innovations to create competitive advantages for our restaurants around the globe. We are seeking a Product Owner who can provide direction to technical teams. In this role, your customers will be product and engineering teams building front-ends (web, mobile, etc.) on top of our eCommerce platform. You will work with these internal customers to understand their needs, document requirements, and extend the platform.



You will:



  • Work collaboratively with engineers and testers on your agile delivery team

  • Work directly with front-end teams building applications for domestic and international markets

  • Partner with product management to define and prioritize roadmaps

  • Elicit requirements, synthesize and document them into stories for the product backlog

  • Break requirements into iterative sprint-sized stories that optimize speed-to-value

  • Manage and refine the product backlog, assemble sprints, and perform release planning

  • Articulate business and customer value to development team and use it to guide prioritization

  • Participate in the release process as the product expert to surface any issues prior to release

  • Ensure that roadmaps and the product backlog are visible, transparent, and clear



You have:



  • A BS/BA degree or equivalent experience

  • Outstanding written, verbal, and presentation skills

  • Agile product owner experience in a SaaS or PaaS environment

  • Working knowledge of REST API design and usage

  • Hands on experience producing and/or consuming REST API’s

  • The ability to run meetings and drive agenda

  • Effective influencing skills

  • Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) – preferred, not required

  • Certified ScrumMaster (CSM) – preferred, not required



A few of our perks:



  • 4 weeks of vacation PLUS holidays

  • 5 sick days

  • 2 paid volunteer days

  • 401k matching

  • Medical, dental, vision

  • Life insurance

  • Half day Fridays

  • Generous parental leave

  • A world-famous recognition culture

title: Data Scientist wtih Tableau Exp. at Softvision (Oakland, CA)
description:
We are looking for a Data Scientistto work with our cross-functional team and join our world-class community of talented experts.



Responsibilities



  • Make recommendations regarding the collection, extraction, and transformation of large data sets

  • Interpret data and analyze results

  • Translate analytical insights into clear recommendations; identify trends and patterns to inform business decisions and product design

  • Leverage Python to analyze complex data

  • Design and develop customized interactive reports and dashboards in Tableau; schedule in Tableau Server

  • Define and develop a data migration strategy between different products and platforms

  • Develop creative ways to identify and use data that significantly impact key business metrics

  • Assess the potential usefulness and validity of new data sources 

  • Utilize statistical approaches to build predictive models

  • Mentor other team members/ analysts to grow their skills and careers 


Required Skills:



  • B.S. in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Engineering or equivalent work experience

  • Must have 5+ years of experience and proven track record in solving business problems through fact-based and scientific analytics

  • Advanced knowledge of statistical programming language Python 

  • Experience in predictive models, predictive analysis and data modeling

  • Extensive experience developing Tableau reports

  • A clear understanding of logical and physical database design and data

  • Strong database skills (MySQL, SQL Server) and ability to write, optimize and tune complex SQL scripts

  • Deep understanding of statistics and algorithms



At this time we will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position. No 3rd Party Agency Candidates please.

title: Travel junkie (+ experienced iOS developer) for fast growing travel scale-up at Polarsteps (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Polarsteps is on a mission to inspire and connect people through travel.


Our rapidly growing team of 15 (and counting!) is building the place to go to for travelers that want to plan, track and remember their adventures around the globe. In the last 3 years we have welcomed over 2.000.000 users who added steps in 180+ countries. Our app was featured in Apple's WWDC keynote speeches of 2017 and 2018, and just a few months ago Google created this amazing short video about us. Surely, this puts a huge smile on our face, but our adventure has only just begun!


iOS development at Polarsteps


We care deeply about ensuring a seamless, top quality user experience for every one of our travelers. We provide a fundamentally new type of product and are continuously iterating and innovating to turn it into the best travel app out there - that's why we've been featured multiple times in the App Store and hold a close relationship with Apple. As an iOS engineer at Polarsteps, you can expect to work with a small team across these challenges. This includes everything from fine tuning the performance of our app to building complex state-of-the-art interfaces.


All new code we write is in Swift, and we're not married to any particular architecture - we use what makes sense where it makes sense. So no, we're not creating a VIPER stack for that settings screen with one switch and two buttons. We are also not obsessed with test coverage percentages, what we aim for is reasonable qualitative coverage. And yes, that nicely refactored class will be reviewed by a peer before it's merged to master.


Our ideal candidate



  • Is a seasoned, professional and pragmatic developer with a feel for product and 5+ years experience

  • Loves to travel

  • Enjoys solving complex challenges

  • Has worked with Objective-C in the past, but enjoys all the bells and whistles of Swift

  • Doesn't need to have a Computer Science degree, but holds a sound understanding of CS fundamentals

  • Has extensive experience with large apps published in the App Store.


If (most of) this applies to you, then you’re the rainbow unicorn we’re looking for!

title: Robotic Software Engineer - Newbie to Lead at KEF Robotics (Pittsburgh, PA)
description:
Robotic Software Engineer


Full time - Pittsburgh, PA - Open immediately - US Persons Only


KEF Robotics Inc. is seeking talented Robotic Software Engineers to join our four-person team. We’re a new company (founded December, 2018) on a strong trajectory in a disruptive technology area, and have already attained a number of significant milestones:



  • We were featured in the New York Times in our first 100 days as a company

  • We finished as the top qualifier in Lockheed Martin’s AlphaPilot competition in our first six months as a company, ahead of numerous talented research groups

  • We won our first contract without a proposal (We don’t mind proposals. But don’t love them either...)

  • ...we’re “professional” drone racers


We’re looking for smart, bold, driven, humble researchers who bring a great attitude to work and want to help us draft out, build, and polish a great company.  We want the types who dig in to their work and try to solve technical problems, and who are fearless learners and active questioners. We’re working on our first product, and we need your help to get it perfect.


KEF was founded by an experienced and proven R&D team, which arrived at drone autonomy after achieving recognition as the premier spacecraft navigation software development team in the world (The tech we pitched and built was going to land us on the Moon and Saturn’s Enceladus!). We’ve honed an ability to operate efficiently with zero baloney or baggage.


At this early stage we’re offering substantial equity, and we offer big-company benefits where we can: subsidized healthcare for all employees, unlimited vacation (take it), and a generous 401k match. While we tackle huge technical challenges and demand excellence, working hours are reasonable -we presume that the best talent will seek robust lives outside the office.


contactus@kefrobotics.com - Linkedin & Facebook - www.kefrobotics.com


Responsibilities:



  • Develop state-of-the-art autonomous drones capable of flying rapidly through challenging environments

  • Research and implement new approaches within guidance, navigation, and control (GNC) and machine learning (ML) 

  • Optimize algorithms for real-time computation on embedded platforms

  • Field test UAVs in a variety of environments, both indoors and outdoors

  • Improve physics based simulation environments and validate autonomous behavior within simulation


Strongly Recommended Skills:



  • Empathetic and collaborative team player 

  • Proficiency with C++ and Python

  • Experience with robotics state estimation and simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) algorithms

  • Experience programming for embedded environments

  • Familiarity with Linux and Linux tools

  • Experience in developing computer vision algorithms


Bonus Skills:



  • Machine learning and experience programming within a popular ML framework (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc)

  • Hardware prototyping skills (3D printing, soldering, assembly)

  • GPU programming (CUDA / OpenCL)

  • Familiarity with nonlinear optimization techniques

  • Familiarity with ROS (Robot Operating System)

  • Unreal Engine / Unity experience

  • Julia programming experience

  • Clear, concise technical writing skills


Salary range: $75k - $120k


Health Care: $200/month subsidy per employee


Equity Available: Yes


401k Match: 3:1 company match on 4% of salary

title: Software Engineer - Platform at Jimdo GmbH (Hamburg, Germany)
description:
Software Engineer - Platform


At Jimdo, our mission is to help small businesses start, grow, and ultimately thrive online. Small businesses face new challenges with very little support or recognition. We know how hard this can be because we have been in their position. That’s where you can help us—by designing intuitive tools to help small businesses solve complex problems.


With a forward-leaning and self-driven attitude, we continue to find new ways to help our customers get their ideas out into the world. As a team, we run at a steady pace to achieve what we aim for. We learn best by gathering data, trying new things, and sometimes even falling down along the way. It’s the lessons we learn in the process that make us better problem-solvers for small business owners.


If you’re motivated by our mission and excited to roll up your sleeves, try new things, learn from mistakes, and make a difference to small businesses around the world, we would love to work with you.


The Team


As a result of a growing engineering organization and the necessity to support more diverse business and engineering needs, Jimdo founded a new group of engineering teams that focus on engineering effectiveness.


The Platform Team is focused on building and advancing our in-house platform that runs all of Jimdo’s backend systems. We bundle two decades of experience running high-traffic services in an opinionated platform that enables our engineering teams to build and operate reliable and scalable services. The team continuously advances the platform based on changing business and engineering needs and strives for close collaboration.



What You'll Do



  • Design, build and operate our in-house Platform-as-a-Service that enables engineering teams at Jimdo to build and operate scalable backend systems.

  • Work with engineers across the company to build new features on the platform that improve engineering effectiveness.

  • Develop and improve engineering standards, tooling, and processes.

  • Debug production issues across services and multiple levels of the stack.



What We Value



  • Jimdo's success is rooted in no small part in consequently using state-of-the-art cloud services. We are looking for engineers that have a solid grasp of cloud technologies and have a strong interest in distributed systems.

  • More than 150 million users access our services every day and serve 25 million websites. It is our first- and foremost duty to ensure industry-leading uptime and as little impact as possible when things don't go as planned. You fit right in when you have worked in this environment before and share the same values.

  • We leverage different tech stacks and languages depending on the problem we try to solve, so we value people who are able to pick up new languages when necessary. Right now Go is our default choice.

  • You have excellent problem-solving skills. You use a systematic and thorough approach. You think from first principles. You have a bias for action.



Simon is looking forward to receiving your application and if you have questions regarding the application process, you might find the answer in our FAQ.

title: Data Engineer  Algorithmic Trading  Machine Learning at 7 Chord inc. (Brooklyn, NY)
description:
This is an exceptional opportunity for a high caliber recent graduate or junior level engineer to join a successful revenue-generating trading technology firm with a ground-breaking AI product. You will work with some of the brightest minds in data science to find innovative solutions for storing, accessing, combining and synthesizing real-time data.

What You'll Do:


  • Design modern streaming data architecture: message ingestion, storage management, normalization and noise filtering.

  • Serve as the data wrangler and ETL expert for the company.

  • Own relationships with the market data vendors. Design and implement market data feed handlers, storing and warehousing solutions.

  • Work with data scientists to facilitate technical design of complex data sourcing, transformation and aggregation logic across data types.


Qualifications:


  • 2+ years of professional experience in an enterprise-level environment.

  • MSc in Computer Science preferred.

  • Excellent knowledge of data warehousing, data modeling and data transformation.

  • Experience with handling large volumes of real-time / streaming data.

  • Exceptional Java, Python, Anaconda Stack, SQL skills. KDB/q a big plus.

  • Familiarity with messaging technologies (RabbitMQ, Kafka or Kinesis).

  • Experience with data lakes.

  • Understanding of FIX is preferred.

  • Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps culture.



Comp, Benefits, Perks:


  • Competitive salary. Equity. Enormous growth potential.

  • Subsidized health insurance, transportation benefit and 401K.

  • Continuing education stipend.

  • Free state-of-the-art gym and wellness center on premises. Access to the open private waterfront space, half-court basketball court, outdoor terraces, training and conference facilities, cafeteria and lounge.


Office is located in the Brooklyn Navy Yard’s brand-new green Dock 72 building with the stunning views of downtown Manhattan. Brooklyn Navy Yard, a 200-year-old industrial park and the fastest growing NYC tech hub, is home to 350+ companies employing over 10,000 people, expected to grow to 30,000 in 2020. 10-minute ferry ride from Wall Street or 34th street. 7 min shuttle from Dumbo’s Jay Street or Barclays Center Atlantic Terminal subway stations.

Please send your resume, including your linkedin and/or github profiles to: careers@7-chord.com

title: Technical Product Manager / Software Architect (m/f/d) at knowis AG (Regensburg, Deutschland)
description:
Acting in the Product Management Department you work and impact the strategic direction of our products. Collaborating with our engineering departments, translating prioritized aspirations into innovative IT concepts and IT architectures to derive and identify the best suitable architecture and design is your daily business and passion. You drive the adoption, the transformation to and the implementation of cloud technologies. You provide technology consultancy around that technologies (e.g. cloud, container technologies). Our roadmap will also be influenced by your permanent market screening regarding technology trends, competitors and market solutions.


YOUR PROFILE:



  • Strong technical background in cloud technologies and architectures (e.g. Kubernetes/ OpenShift, docker, Microservice Architecture, etc.)

  • Ability to design, analyze and understand complex software solutions using container and serverless technologies

  • Good experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)

  • Interest in technical trends in the software industry and in general

  • Ability to work well with internal teams, including developers, engineers, architects, quality assurance and operations Ensure requirements are fully understood and that implementation plans match expectations

  • Eagerness to proactively look for process improvement opportunities, to challenge conventional practices and to adopt new methods

  • Problem-solving capability, decisiveness and result-driven approach

  • Planning and organizational skills, high level of dedication, flexibility and independence

  • Exposure to Agile development methodologies

  • Fluent in German and English (written and spoken)

  • Very good presentation and strong communication skills

  • Willingness to travel (up to 20%)

title: Senior Datapath Software Developer at Solace (Ottawa, ON, Canada)
description:
At the heart of our PubSub+ messaging broker lies the datapath. This area of hardware and software is responsible for moving messages with at high rate, with low latency and utmost reliability. The datapath spans custom built hardware, containing FPGAs and a Cavium network processor, and software running on Intel server processors. Software in this area is highly multi-threaded and performance oriented.


We are looking for energetic developers that relish the challenge of building complicated features with C++ in this multi-threaded environment. Candidates should enjoy going deep to learn about hardware interfaces, processors and their cache hierarchy and details of the Linux kernel.


The Ideal Candidate 



  • 5+ years experience writing multi-threaded performance-oriented code in C++

  • Knowledge of network protocols (TCP/IP, Ethernet)

  • Keen interest in software interactions with hardware

  • Experience in designing high efficiency data storage systems

  • Experienced in using messaging brokers such as Solace, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, Kafka

  • Able to work independently with high level guidance to achieve goals

  • A team player who enjoys collaborating with cross-functional teams

  • Detail-oriented to ensure designs meet requirements, are easy to use for internal customers, and built to high quality


 Required Skills:



  • Expert in C++

  • Expert in multi-threaded programming

  • Expert in debugging complex applications with core file and code

  • Proficient in at least one scripting language like Python/Ruby/ Perl

  • Experience in network programming (POSIX sockets)

  • Experience with real-time applications in Linux


Desirable Skills:



  • Experience achieving high rate disk storage and retrieval within Linux systems

  • Experience with Linux kernel

  • Experience with Cavium Octeon network processors


What Makes Us Great:



  • We are in the heart of Kanata North

  • We believe in work life balance

  • Competitive compensation, benefits (we cover the premiums for you) & vacation

  • Flexible work environment

  • Many Solace sponsored social events, on and off premise (from cake and pie monthly, golf tournaments, holiday parties, team outings – we like to keep things simple and fun!)

  • We are one of the top-ranked employers on Glassdoor

title: Security Engineer - Analytics (m/f/d) at relayr GmbH (Mnchen, Germany)
description:
Relayr is the Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) powerhouse delivering the most complete solution for risk-free digital transformations. We unleash data insights from existing equipment, machines and production lines to improve our customers’ business outcomes. 


We provide a unique combination of first-class IIoT technology and its delivery with powerful financial and insurance offerings — all from a single source trusted by hundreds of companies worldwide. With around 300 employees, we are a truly global family with locations in Germany, the USA, Poland, Italy, France, and the UK. Named twice the hottest start-up in Berlin by WIRED magazine and a winner of The Spark - the German Digital Award, relayr is now part of the Munich Re group.   


Our analytics team pushes the boundaries of technology. We tackle challenging problems in the fields of data engineering, data science, and machine learning research to develop solutions from early prototypes to fully-fledged production-ready systems. Currently we are seeking a Security Engineer - Analytics to join our team and be based in our Munich office.


At relayr we try to embed security into all our products, ensuring our customers achieve their business goals and desired outcomes, while at the same time focusing on safety and security of our solutions. Security at relayr is an inter-team discipline, which means that you will work closely together with our Engineering and DevOps Teams. Your main responsibility will be to assist the Analytics Team in all security-related topics like General Security Consulting, Security Architecture and Development of Best Practices Guidelines. As a thought leader in security, you will help the team to spot potential security issues before they find their way into our final products. We are looking for someone with a very strong technical background and experience in software engineering.



Tasks:



  • Perform risk assessments

  • Coordinate penetration tests

  • Consult the Analytics Team in all questions regarding Product Security

  • Manage all security related aspects of our Analytics Cloud Platform

  • Establish and maintain security related processes

  • Train developers in best practices for application development (Java, Python, C++)

  • Develop and maintain best practices guidelines

  • Set up Security Requirements for our projects

  • Perform Code Reviews for security critical developments

  • Interface with other security staff in Berlin and Katowice



Requirements:



  • 3+ years experience in Security Engineering (or a related position)

  • Good understanding of Analytics / Big Data (Java, Spark / pySpark)

  • Good understanding of OWASP Top 10 / OWASP IoT Top 10

  • Knowledge about Dependency Management / Static Code Analysis

  • Knowledge about Secure Software Development Life Cycle

  • Knowledge about Exploit Mitigation Technologies

  • Knowledge about IoT Edge Devices

  • Python, Java and C++ coding expertise is a plus

  • Good understanding of scaling distributed systems

  • Good level of English, skills in German Language are a plus

  • Security related Certifications (like CISSP, CEH, etc.) are a plus

  • Willingness to travel (up to 10%)

  • A team player with the ability to work in complex cross-functional teams



We Offer:



  • Flexible office environment 

  • A diverse and friendly team with people from all over the world, speaking 20+ languages, of all ages and parental-status

  • Connecting you with a network of companies and people from around the globe

  • A learning environment where you can extend and build upon your skills and interests, as well as knowledge-sharing

  • Opportunities to attend events and conferences

  • Cool office located in Central Tower in Munich

  • Free German courses at beginner, intermediate and advanced levels (working language is English)

  • Competitive salary

  • A chance to work in a cutting-edge field with the best people in the IoT industry!



Sound interesting? Please apply using this link:


https://relayr.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=185

title: Software Engineer, Madden NFL at Pipeworks (Eugene, OR)
description:
As a software engineer, you will work within a team located on-site at our office in Eugene, Oregon and collaborate remotely with our partners at EA Tiburon. Come make your mark on one of the most popular video game franchises ever – Madden NFL!

title: C++ Software Engineer for Test Automation at Autonomous Intelligent Driving (Munich, Germany)
description:
About the role:



  • You will be empowered to design and implement a framework for automated and explorational execution of non-functional tests.

  • You will work with the Verification and Validation teams to execute non-functional tests in relevant verification environments (Simulation, HIL-Systems, In-Car).

  • You will perform the analysis of test results, creation of test reports, accompanying documentation and recommendations to increase non-functional properties of the system under test.

  • You are encouraged to act as mentors for the organization, developing and enforcing best practices defining high-performance and robust design of the software product.


About you:



  • Experience of at least 3 years in embedded software development in C or C++.

  • Strong system understanding – interaction between hardware and software.

  • Strong understanding of the middleware architectures in embedded systems.

  • Experience with the evaluation and improvement of non-functional system properties, like performance, reliability, robustness, security etc.

  • Strong programming skills in C++ and a scripting language (e.g. Python).

  • Strong analytical thinking and passion for investigation.

  • Hands on, self-motivated, driven team player, who is excited to work in a new automotive startup company.

  • Innovative thinker and a positive attitude to solve cross domain problems.

  • Fluent English skills are mandatory, German is not required.


Life at AID GmbH:  Our state-of-the-art offices are in the heart of beautiful Munich. We’re an agile, creative and dynamic start-up with people, innovation and teamwork at the core of our values. We reward our employees with excellent salary and benefits packages including, on-site language courses, mobile phone, subsidized lunches in the company bistro, subsidized gym membership, social events, BBQ’s and much more. We value diversity and as an equal opportunities employer we encourage applications from all suitably qualified individuals. AID is a multicultural organization with employees from over 40 different countries, as such we provide visa and relocation support to all new employees. As an organization our primary business language is English, so where possible please provide a copy of your resume in English. What are you waiting for? Help us to build the future.

title: ServiceNow Developer (ITSM/CMDB) at Hays (Richmond, VA)
description:
ServiceNow Developer (ITSM/CMDB) - Contract to Perm - Richmond, VA - $80.00-$90.00/hr

It specializes in hi-tech transactional services that includes unified communications, cloud, big data and cybersecurity.
