title: Software Engineer Basissoftware LIDAR / AUTOSAR (w/m/x) at BMW Group (Mnchen, Deutschland)
description:
In einem interdisziplinären Team entwickeln wir die Fahrzeug-Umfeldsensoren der nächsten Generation. Hierfür machen wir gemeinsam mit unseren Entwicklungspartnern bezüglich Signalerzeugung, -detektion und -verarbeitung in vielen Bereichen große Entwicklungssprünge und erreichen bei fast allen Sensoren den Best- und First-in-Market Status.

Was erwartet dich?

- Du übernimmst Verantwortung für Systemfunktionen, Diagnostizierbarkeit, Flashbarkeit, Diagnostic Logging, Bedatung sowie Buskommunikation.
- Die Herausforderung der EE Integration in modernen Fahrzeugumgebungen seitens des V-Modells nimmst du gerne an.
- Durch dein Wissen von Traces erkennst du Fehler und behebst sie schnell.
- Mit dem Umgang von Softwares wie Esys, Carmen, Canoe und Wireshark bist du vertraut.
- Neben der engen Absprache mit den Lieferanten gehören auch Vereinbarung und Zielführung der Meilensteine, regelmäßige Software-Reviews, Hands-on Workshops und Qualitätssicherung zu deinem Aufgabengebiet.


Qualifikationen und Erfahrung


- Studienabschluss in Informatik, Elektrotechnik oder in einem vergleichbaren Studiengang.
- Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Software Entwicklung mit Frameworks wie (adaptive) AUTOSAR, Microsar, Tresos und DaVinci.
- Gute Kenntnisse der Protokolle wie TCP, UDS, SOME/IP, DoIP sowie der geeigneten Tools zur Analyse.
- Idealerweise erste Erfahrungen mit der BMW E/E Architektur und Absicherung gesammelt und die BMW Toolumgebung (E-SYS, FAT, CAFE, ZEDIS).

Du bist mutig und motiviert, eigene Ideen einzubringen und neue technologische Wege zu gehen? Dann bewirb dich jetzt!

title: RUST Developer (m/w/d) at Gnosis Service GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
description:
• About the role: 


We are looking for an experienced systems engineer to join the Gnosis Client Development (GCD) team. 


The GCD team’s goal is to develop a fast, light and robust ethereum 1.0 client in order to support a strong multi-client ethereum ecosystem. Gnosis is convinced that having a multi-client ethereum ecosystem is mission-critical for the ethereum blockchain. The client software is leveraging the advantages of Rust in order to achieve being one of the fastest and lightest clients.


You have the opportunity to work with us in the trendy kiez of Kreuzberg - where we run our beautiful co-working space for blockchain projects, Full Node. Also, you can join us as a remote employee and work from your hometown. Currently half of our team is working remotely.



  • What you'll do: 


    • Implementing new upcoming Ethereum Improvement Proposals

    • Researching elegant designs, in order to keep the client light and fast.

    • Incorporate new user’s feedback

    • Maintain the production code

    • Deliver high-quality code for features from concept until production 

    • Contribute to our growing test suite

    • In the team of approximately 5 Rust-developers, you will have a shared responsibility for the design, development, and maintenance of the client





  • Who you are:


    • You have 3+ years of experience in system engineering, preferably in Rust, but other languages are good as well (C++, Go, ...)

    • You have 1+ years of experience in system engineering in Rust

    • Structuring processes for demanding infrastructure is your strength

    • You have good general programming and algorithm skills. 

    • You have a good understanding of the Ethereum blockchain.

    • You care deeply about the quality and readability of your code. 

    • You proactively drive technical direction such as improving performance, preventing issues, data usage, refactoring the codebase. 

    • Leadership and architecture experience is a plus.





  • What we can offer you:


    • Make your mark in a growing, disruptive technology: 
      Be a part of an innovative blockchain company as we help drive change in a number of important global markets, including finance, insurance, and information discovery. 

    • Flat hierarchies: 
      This means fewer processes and bureaucracy - see more of your ideas come to life! 

    • Be set up for success from the start: 

    • We’ll equip you with the latest hardware, and plenty of learning opportunities through our fortnightly Brown Bag Lunches, guest speakers, meetups and workshops at Full Node, team knowledge sharing sessions and generous budgets for conferences and individual learning. 

    • Flexible work and vacation times: 
      We truly believe in and stand for work-life balance. We have a great flexible work policy and a generous vacation allowance that supports you in living your best life! 

    • Work and hang out with us: 
      On top of the events at Full Node, we have weekly breakfasts, monthly team dinners, an abundance of healthy snacks and drinks (including top-notch coffee!) Did we mention a company-wide annual offsite? 

    • Conferences and Educational Budget:
      At Gnosis, we support your growth and development with a generous annual education and conference budget.

    • Grow with us: 
      We're growing rapidly, the industry is expanding fast, and we have a lot to do. If you're someone who loves taking initiative and get things done, there's a lot of opportunities for your individual growth.






  • How to apply:  


Please apply with your (English) resume and a short personal introduction.


We look forward to your application!



Variety is the spice of life and a celebrated component of our culture. At Gnosis, we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer: all qualified applicants are considered for positions regardless of race, ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, marital status, gender identification, sexual orientation, or physical ability.

title: Technical Architect | Solution Architect <> Integrations at Colaberry Data Analytics (St. Louis, MO)
description:
We are looking for a Technical Architect for our Services team, you will have the opportunity to enable and employ MuleSoft technology hands-on being on the front-lines of a digital transformation. As an integral part of this transformation you will be the orchestrator of the future integration architecture activities for digital development teams that support enterprise strategies and objectives. You’re someone who is a proactive thinker and is prepared to tackle complex problems in a dynamic environment. Your people skills are on point, working with customers and getting the best out of teams comes naturally to you.

Role & Responsibilities



  • Enable clients to understand and implement integration technology hands-on (using Integration Architecture best practices and leading standards) while coaching and mentoring elite team members within a fast-paced and growing organization.

  • Architect integration solutions based on functional and technical requirements.

  • Apply common Integration Architecture concepts and patterns to the solution in order to promote maintainability, reusability, scalability, performance, security and performance where needed.

  • Understand the impact of Integration Architecture on Digital Channels (i.e. mobile, tablet, etc.) and how to optimize integration solutions.

  • Design and develop the application integration architecture foundation to provide agile business solutions in alignment with enterprise architecture direction and design standards.

  • Assess the compatibility and integration of products and services proposed in order to ensure a robust integration architecture across the interdependent technologies.


Skills & Qualifications



  • Management solutions using the MuleSoft AnyPoint Platform.

  • AnyPoint Platform: Flow Design, API Design. Dataweave, CloudHub, Runtime Fabric, API Management, EDI Integration

  • MuleSoft ESB, Enterprise Messaging using JMS, Containerization technologies such as Docker or Kubernetes.

  • Project experience setting up and configuring on-premise/cloud-based infrastructures, SDLC pipelines, and deployments/configurations

  • Experience architecting real-time integrations that support high volume transactions

  • Solid understanding of Integration Architecture concepts and patterns, including Microservices, Service Oriented Architecture, Batch Integration, RESTful JSON services, etc.

title: Senior Data Scientist - Boston, New York City at Underline (Boston, MA)
description:
At Underline, we are driven by a singular mission: to ensure the vibrancy of our nation through building intelligent community infrastructure. We work with communities across the United States to design, finance, and construct open access fiber-optic networks. We believe these networks are the essential foundation for ultra-fast access to information, a competitive market for content and services, job formation and reskilling for workers, distributed healthcare services, new wireless solutions, and resilient modern infrastructure including responsible energy creation.  


We’re looking for a full-time data scientist/engineer to join our Boston-based Data Science team. 


Our Data Science team provides analytic excellence, thought leadership, and data-driven insights to solve complex problems and support our mission. We help stakeholders across the organization with their decision making process as they work with local governments, investors, partners, and communities to select and prioritize projects across the U.S.


Spend your time with us as we help support the vitality and resilience of communities. 


Responsibilities



  • Apply analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence to transform geospatial, demographic, and financial data into actionable business insights that will:


    • develop the computational framework to evaluate community financial health and predict future community outcomes

    • inform the deployment of fiber-optic networks across the U.S.


  • Help refine our Data Science computing environment, in collaboration with our Engineering Team

  • Build data visualization solutions to share your results with the organization, investors, and communities 


About You



  • You are hungry, humble, and curious

  • You have excellent analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills

  • You want to solve extremely hard problems in the realms of data science, data engineering, and artificial intelligence 

  • You are an intrinsic self-starter and enjoy taking on new challenges

  • You want to be part of the early stages of a company where everything you build matters

  • You want a highly collaborative environment, comprised of diverse subject matter experts in finance, government, infrastructure, and tech

  • You care about building critical intelligent infrastructure to increase community vitality and improve resilience 


About Us 



  • We offer bold solutions to drive positive, sustainable change 

  • We approach our work with humility, integrity, and intellectual rigor

  • We are agile and relentless in pursuit of our mission 

  • We have a mentality of service: to our mission, and to each other

  • We are dedicated to building and sustaining a culture of flourishing

  •  We optimize our efforts to create positive sum for community and capital


Requirements



  • Proficiency with basic data science tools and DB programming such as SQL, R or Python

  • Basic knowledge of GIS spatial data analysis and techniques to identify patterns and trends

  • Experience building digital maps with geographic data and other data sources to display various demographic characteristics and statistics

  • Experience with data collection, cleaning, wrangling, manipulation, analysis, and visualization, especially with maps, shapefiles, and geospatial data

title: Sr. DevOps Engineer at Solace (Ottawa, ON, Canada)
description:
Why Join Our Team:


Solace provides solutions to the world’s leading enterprises via our unified event-driven messaging platform in the cloud and on premise. Our platform helps our customers solve use cases such as hybrid cloud, IoT, microservices, and big data distribution intelligently, securely, reliably, and in real-time.


We’re looking for people who love working on cutting edge technology, always jump at new challenges, and want to learn from some of the best brains in the data movement business to join our team!


This position is for a Senior DevOps Engineer. You will be responsible for defining, designing, developing, and deploying cloud native applications for a multi-cloud solution in leading cloud providers and platforms such as Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform as well as Kubernetes.


The Right Person Will:



  • Contribute to new products/solutions using agile software development practices

  • Test software through automation and CI/CD integration pipelines & contribute to the pipeline

  • Communicate with the team through meetings, demos, and documentation

  • Have experience and is eager to learn about building infrastructure in leading cloud providers

  • Thinks almost anything can be infrastructure-as-code


Required Skills:



  • Hands-on experience with AWS/Google Cloud/Azure/Kubernetes (compute, storage, network, security, admin, application services, database and monitoring)

  • Experience with orchestration and configuration management tools such as Ansible/Chef/Puppet/Salt

  • Familiar with technologies such as Packer and Terraform for building and maintaining cloud infrastructure

  • A solid developer in at least one language Java/Groovy/Python/Go

  • Experience with Monitoring tools like Datadog, ELK stack, and Prometheus

  • Experience with operating Messaging Software such as Kafka

  • Experience with SQL/NoSQL databases (MySQL/ElasticSearch)

  • Experience operating production environment and handling incidents

  • Experience with a secret management tool such as Vault or Amazon Secrets Manager

  • Experience with Linux


What Makes Us Great:



  • Our team! Work with some of the smartest individuals in the business

  • We are in the heart of Kanata North

  • We believe in work life balance

  • Competitive compensation, benefits (we cover the premiums for you) & vacation

  • Flexible work environment

  • Amazing customers

  • Many Solace sponsored social events, on and off premise (from cake and pie monthly, golf tournaments, holiday parties, team outings – we like to keep things simple and fun!)

  • We are one of the top-ranked employers on Glassdoor


We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected to continue in the selection process will be contacted.


 Solace is committed to establishing a qualified workforce that reflects the diverse population it serves. Solace encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Accessible formats and communication supports are available upon request

title: Python Software Engineer at bloomon (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
bloomon is a fast-growing online-only flower delivery service with a competitive edge. Since launching in 2014, we have become an iconic European flower brand with 110k+ customers with our innovative business model. Our Amsterdam HQ is home to a diverse team of 80+ high-tech and highly-creative people and growing. 

We're looking for a Python Software Engineer. As part of bloomon’s Product and Engineering team, you’ll build the software that powers our business. From scaling up our subscription platform to meet a 10x increase in volume and complexity to forecasting the number of Paradisaeidae needed for next month’s delivery — you’ll be surprised at the amount of tech in flowers!

What you can expect



  • Shaping our technical platform and engineering culture as we grow

  • Prioritising expertly, communicating clearly, and consistently delivering excellent software engineering skills

  • Juggling multiple responsibilities simultaneously and working across a variety of projects, such as the demands of daily operations, improving the product, innovating the core subscription platform and algorithms, which include order generation, delivery management, invoicing, forecasting, customer data and analytics. 

  • Capability in strong analytics creating innovative operational solutions.

  • Brainstorming with the team to find the best trade-offs between quality, speed, and scope

  • Diligence about improving the codebase

  • Balancing creative engineering with high quality and a customer focus

  • Enhancing working habits and processes that make an effective team: writing good tests, code reviews, writing clear documentation, holding retrospectives, etc

  • Working alongside other developers, product designers, product owners and a broader team of supply chain experts, brand creatives and stylist.


About you 



  • A Bachelor Degree or higher in Computer Science or a related technical field

  • At least 5 years’ professional experience in software development

  • Fluent in 1 or more programming/scripting languages like Python, Ruby, GO, Javascript, PHP...

  • Strong experience with (relational) databases like Postgresql and MySQL

  • Experience of working in an agile environment is a must. Experience in scaling up startups is a bonus.

  • You are an expert in communicating effectively and translating requirements into well-designed technical solutions. 

  • Experience working with large and complex systems

  • Experience with DevOps

  • Experience with part of our current tech stack: Python, Node JS, PHP

  • You live in the Netherlands/EU

  • Fluent in English. Dutch is a bonus


What we offer



  • A high level of responsibility, autonomy, and level of impact from day one

  • A competitive package and regular compensation reviews — we reward great work!

  • Annual allowance for personal development

  • Modern work culture: no-meeting Wednesdays, flexibility to work from home, etc.

  • Mobile allowance, daily buffet lunch, team events, parties on the roof terrace, gym discount, free flowers and more.


This video tells you more

title: Software Engineer - Software Factory at Autonomous Intelligent Driving (Mnchen, Germany)
description:
The Software Factory team is creating a world class Engineering System in which up to a thousand engineers can collaborate safely and effectively on a single code base. This means creating a system that is scalable, intuitive and highly automated. We want the Engineering System to be self-service, to empower engineers to do the changes they need without unnecessary red-tape. We want a system that makes it easy to do the right thing, and conversely prevents people from breaking stuff. To succeed we are building a pipeline that builds, runs tests and simulations and deploys to real cars, automatically, every day, many times per day. As a Software Engineer in our Software Factory team, you will work on projects critical to our needs with opportunities across a range of teams and projects as both you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile and enthusiastic so they can take on new problems across the full product stack as we continue to push technology forward. Consequently, we're looking for people who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, real-time systems, distributed computing, cloud system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence and more.


Responsibilities:




    • Design and implement our massively scalable cloud-based build cluster

    • Maintain and monitor our hybrid cloud consisting of AWS GPU instances and on-premises specialized hardware

    • Implement monitoring system for the distributed build that allows extracting various KPI:s and identifying bottlenecks

    • Optimize and extend our bazel build system with new toolchains, new programming languages and frameworks

    • Implement tooling for code quality and conformance into our developer’s desktops and into the CI/CD pipeline

    • Provide guidance to our developer community on compilers and optimizations

    • Act as mentors for the organization, developing and enforcing best practices in code style and safe programming.

    • Incorporate containerization solutions such as Docker and Kubernetes

    • Integrate functional safety and security concepts

    • Design and build the linkage between all test infrastructure including SIL, HIL and hybrid systems and make these systems available on each developer’s desktop

    • Develop the work processes that allow the Engineers to work effectively and safely on the code base



Requirements:




    • BA/BS (preferred: M.Sc) degree in Computer Science or similar technical degree, or equivalent practical experience

    • Experience with C++ and general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, Python or Go with an interest and ability to learn other languages as needed

    • A passion for structured code and making software engineering in general a breeze at AID

    • Experience of using version control, build and test integration solutions, in particular Bitbucket and Bazel

    • Experience working with Orchestration of MicroServices with tools such as Kubernetes or Docker Swarm etc.

    • Knowledge of modern DevOps practices and tools would be beneficial

    • Experience working with two or more from the following: realtime systems, cloud application development, Unix/Linux environments, embedded development, distributed and parallel systems, machine learning, information retrieval, networking, developing large software systems, and/or security software development.

    • Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically



Life at AID GmbH:  Our state-of-the-art offices are in the heart of beautiful Munich. We’re an agile, creative and dynamic start-up with people, innovation and teamwork at the core of our values. We reward our employees with excellent salary and benefits packages including, on-site language courses, mobile phone, subsidized lunches in the company bistro, subsidized gym membership, social events, BBQ’s and much more. We value diversity and as an equal opportunities employer we encourage applications from all suitably qualified individuals. AID is a multicultural organization with employees from over 40 different countries, as such we provide visa and relocation support to all new employees. As an organization our primary business language is English, so where possible please provide a copy of your resume in English. What are you waiting for? Help us to build the future.

title: Developer CAR/HANA at Jumbo Supermarkets (Veghel, Netherlands)
description:
We are the fastest growing omnichannel supermarket in the Netherlands. We are continuously improving so if you feel that you can help drive this improvement, then we are looking for you.

Medior developer CAR/HANA in a nutshell

Data is key to be able to make a difference within Retail and Food! It drives the decision making and initiatives within Jumbo. Our reason for being is to ensure that decisions are not based on gut feeling but on high-quality data and hard facts. We are the foundation of initiatives which have a huge impact on our business (e.g. boost sales, improve margins, forecast better etc.).

You are part of a BI scrum team which usually consists of 6-7 people with different BI skills (analysis, development, test, ops), a scrum master and a product owner. CAR is the customer activity repository system used at Jumbo to collect cash-office and Point of Sales data. Reports built on CAR are used by the stores and provide them with real-time inventory visibility and POS data transfer. In close collaboration with the (internal) customer you’ll be using your extensive experience to design KPI reports, dashboards and analytics use cases. You’ll help to build the solutions and provide support as medior DevOps developer. As a confident professional with well developed personal skills you communicate the progress and results of the team effectively and timely to stakeholders and are keen to share lessons learned throughout the teams.

The energy running through our BI teams is open, pragmatic, willing to succeed, passionate for data and full of team spirit!

What you will do



  • Design and co-analyze new data epics/user stories and advise on solution architecture;

  • Fully participate in the DevOps team (i.e. can build, test and perform maintenance activities);

  • Implement, customize and test solutions on the SAP CAR (POS DTA/PIPE) environment and develop client-specific enhancements to meet business requirements;

  • Work on performance optimization and apply best practices in close cooperation with our support partner;

  • Model native HANA views & develop SQL procedures;

  • Team upwith the scrum team(s) on solutions and developments;

  • Act as a bridge to other teams, actively participate in the BW guild.


Do you have the Jumbo DNA?

You are well versed in Scrum/Agile due to many years’ experience herein. You are a strong communicator, both oral and written and can work with people from different backgrounds and disciplines. People describe you as passionate and you have a positive attitude. Your analytical acumen means that you get a kick out of solving problems and meeting challenges head-on. We are specifically looking for:



  • Bachelor or master Computer Science, Computer Engineering, a related technical field or equivalent practical experience;

  • At least 3 years of relevant experience;

  • Excellent stakeholder management skills;

  • Strong knowledge of POS data transfer and audit, demand forecasting, inventory visibility and analytics content;

  • Experience with SLT, data acquisition;

  • Knowledge of SQL - ABAP programming;

  • Familiar with system monitoring and performance optimization, HANA DB and ABAP side;

  • Understanding of SAP BW/4HANA;

  • Nice to have: SAP Retail knowledge.


The Jumbo Tech Campus: be the best of the best       

A great professional once said:If your dreams don’t scare you, they’re not big enough.

Within our JumboTech Campus, we match the ambition of Jumbo with our superior mind and best of class approach to quality. We make good professionals into better ones. Our JumboTech Campus is the backbone of Hollands 16 times winner of the best supermarket award. And we have big Jumbo-style plans to grow! Without this backbone, Jumbo’s ambitious digitalization strategy grinds to a halt. When our technical facility is completed, our JumboTech Campus will move to a brand-new, 500 capacity technical facility on our HQ campus.

What do we offer?

A competitive salary and great secondary benefits such as: 30 days holiday, collective insurance offering, excellent pension scheme, investment in your training and a working environment to bring the best out of you.

Shaping the future of online food retail is a challenging job. You’ll get plenty of space to develop your own initiatives and lots of opportunities to grow, both personally and in your area of expertise. Luckily, you’ll be surrounded by the best and brightest talents to share your ideas and knowledge with.

We at Jumbo like transparency, therefore this request: we appreciate it if companies don’t offer their services unsolicited.

title: Senior Python Engineer at Altitude Networks (San Francisco, CA)
description:
As a senior python engineer at Altitude Networks, you are in charge of delivering value to our users by developing a scalable, stable, and high-performing application. You develop new features and deploy them into production via advanced CI and CD tools. You also monitor the existing features, and continuously improve their performance by improving the code base, tech stack, or deployment model.


Responsibilities



  • Contribute to the core engineering design of our application, including backend, middle-layer, and interface with the frontend components.

  • Collaboratively design, build, and maintain Python micro-services in our AWS platform.

  • Build data APIs and data delivery services that support critical operational and analytical applications for our internal and external users.

  • Build testing, monitoring, and automation tools to improve development productivity and app stability.

  • Do peer reviews of your teammate's code, paying specific attention to performance and consistency while also adhering to the best pythonic ways of writing code.


Requirements



  • Bachelor's degree in engineering

  • 5+ years of experience with python and modern architecture (micro-services)

  • 3+ years of experience with AWS infrastructure, including EC2, ECS, Lambda, API GW, SQS, RDS.

  • Working experience designing and implementing APIs.

  • Working experience with containerized (Docker, ECS) or serverless (Lambda) deployment.

  • Working experience with designing large scale systems that move, manage and analyze large amounts of data.

  • Working experience with Agile and CI/CD tools, including GitHub, Travis, Sentry, JIRA.


About Altitude


Altitude Networks provides companies with the data security they need to safely use collaboration SaaS (GSuite, Box, Dropbox, Office365 etc) without the threat of data loss, theft or inadvertent sharing with unauthorized individuals.  Altitude Networks is founded by Michael Coates, former CISO of Twitter and 15 year veteran in the information security space, and Amir Kavousian, Stanford PhD and former data scientist from CapitalOne ML fraud team. We are a BusinessInsider Top 30 CyberSecurity Startup in 2019, backed by prominent Silicon Valley Venture Capital. At Altitude Networks, we use a modern architecture that is designed to optimize development efficiency and velocity. We use a serverless architecture and advanced CI/CD tools that enable all team members to quickly develop, deploy, and maintain code in production in AWS cloud.  Altitude Networks is proud to offer the following benefits: Health, Dental, Vision, PTO, Parental Leave Policy, 401K, Commuter/Parking Benefits, Short/Long Term Disability, Friday Team Lunch, and One Medical Membership, Unlimited Coffee & kombucha

title: SAP HCM Techno Functional Resource at American Water (Camden, NJ)
description:
Primary Role


 We are seeking a SAP HCM Techno Functional Resource for the Technology and Innovation group at American Water.  The selected candidate will ensure design, configuration and development of systems meet specifications, requirements and overall business needs. The Technologist collaborates with other functional/technical analysts and handles multiple tasks simultaneously.



Skills



  • Able to create design and specifications for custom software components, enhancements or customizations

  • Able to develop different HCM objects including Interfaces, user exits, smart forms, workflows etc.

  • Analyzes existing custom developments, objects, and modifications, and evaluate the impact of changes on them

  • Able to configure HR, Benefits, Time Management and Payroll according to the business process requirements

  • Perform unit testing for any configuration/development within HCM area including HR, Benefits, Time Management and Payroll

  • Maintains expert knowledge of SAP development tools, technologies and related delivery methods

  • Able to support the deployment of changes by updating and distributing documentation of own custom developments/configuration according to SAP Standard for Custom Code Management.

  • Identify and decommission unused custom code

  • Conduct application testing (new support packages, releases, functionality, and customizing) in close cooperation with the delivery teams



Knowledge



  • General SAP functional and technical knowledge

  • Expertise in development of different HCM objects including Interfaces, user exits, smart forms, workflows etc.

  • Expertise in configuration related to SAP HR, Benefits, Time Management, CATS, Time Evaluation schema with clock times, Payroll SAP industry templates and best practices

  • Expertise SAP test methodologies knowledge

  • Knowledge of end-to-end development process

  • Experience with SAP Solution Manager CCLM

  • Gateway O-Data performance analysis



Work Experience



  • 7+ years’ experience in SAP HCM Technical domain

  • 5+ years’ experience in SAP HCM functional domain

  • Prior experience working within a SAP CoE

  • Experience with S/4HANA is a plus



Other



  • Excellent organizational and time management skills 

  • Good verbal, written and presentation skills

  • Should be a self-starter with ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously with a keen desire to learn and expand depth of knowledge

  • Good Collaboration, prioritization and team working skills

  • Ability to work in a fast paced dynamic environment with virtual teams

  • A passion for working on projects where there is some element of unknown and ambiguity

  • Should be able to work independently and take initiative to find/develop solutions for business requirements.



Education



  • BS /MS in Computer Science, Computer Applications, Information Technology, Engineering or MBA or with strong academic background

title: SAP BASIS / Plaform at American Water (Camden, NJ)
description:
Primary Role


This position will be a key member of American Water’s SAP Center of Excellence within the Technology and Innovation business group . The Senior Technologist – SAP BASIS / Platform will be responsible for providing system engineering for the SAP solution landscape and completing system builds, upgrades and enhancements for the SAP environment and ecosystem.




Knowledge / Skills


Knowledge:



  • Strong understanding of the HANA platform

  • Sound knowledge of architecting cloud based workloads for SAP

  • Sound knowledge of Solution Manager ChaRM and OCC configuration and administration with 7.2 highly desired

  • Strong understanding of SAP ALM and Operations methodologies in an environment using SAP Solution Manager with ChaRM and Operation Control Center

  • Proficient with application administration and troubleshooting in a Red Hat Linux and Windows environment.

  • Knowledge of ITIL standards as well as SOX compliance requirements


Skills:



  • Ability to perform system build, upgrade activities, and platform migrations across the SAP eco-system

  • Ability to create and maintain documentation of administration procedures and the SAP technical architecture in accordance with SAP CoE certification requirements

  • Skilled in SAP performance troubleshooting and tuning

  • Sound understanding of ABAP and JAVA based SAP technology platforms as well as integration with cloud based products

  • Ability to drive landscape improvements and operational efficiency of the SAP environment through continuous innovation as well as the problem management process

  • Skilled in the management of monitoring infrastructure (agent versions, patches)



Experience / Education


 Experience:



  • 7 plus years of experience supporting a wide variety of SAP applications and technology components such as SAP CRM, ECC, BW, SRM, GRC, BusinessObjects, NetWeaver Portal, Process Orchestration, Gateway/Fiori, LVM, Web Dispatcher and HANA.

  • Prior experience working within a certified SAP CoE is desired

  • Experience with S/4HANA is a plus


Education:



  • BS /MS in Computer Science , Computer Applications , Information Technology , Engineering or MBA or with strong academic background.



Licenses & Certifications



  •  ITIL and SAP Certification will be a big plus




Other



  • Strong interpersonal skills including collaborating and team building

  • Strong knowledge and understanding of business needs with the ability to establish/maintain high level of customer trust and confidence

  • Excellent decision-making ability, balancing what is right with what is realistic

  • Flexibility to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity, and rapid change

  • Demonstrated ability to lead through influence and to deliver results through others

  • Possess a high energy level, sense of urgency, decisiveness, and an ability to work well under pressure

  • Possess a curiosity and a passion towards engaging the imagination of line of business leaders in grasping and enabling the fundamentals of change

  • Demonstrated ability to work and team with a multitude of different people from various lines of business as well as within Technology & Innovation

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills for a wide variety of audiences including proven ability to deliver conference presentations

  • Creative approach to problem-solving with the ability to focus on details while simultaneously maintaining the "big picture" view

title: Software Engineer II (Node.js) at The Farmer's Dog (New York, NY)
description:
WHO WE ARE


The Farmer’s Dog was created to radically improve the $90 billion global pet food industry — starting with a subscription service that sends freshly-made food directly to customers’ doors. Long term, our aim is to simplify every part of pet care, bettering the lives of the animals who make our lives better. We recently raised our Series B and are backed by early investors of Warby Parker, Dollar Shave Club, Sweetgreen, and Glossier.


Join The Farmer’s Dog team as we continue to figure out ways of bringing peace of mind to customers, health to their companions, and much-needed change to the way people feed and care for their pets.


THE ROLE


The Farmer’s Dog is looking for a software engineer to help build out our subscription, e-commerce platform from the ground up to support our numerous personalized orders shipping out each week. As our monolith Node.js application matures, we’re breaking away services one-by-one. There are currently about half a Dockerized services in addition to our main application.


Some of the things you could be working on:



  • Re-architecting an automated billing and shipping label acquisition services to support hundreds of thousands of orders

  • Migrating to TypeScript and GraphQL

  • Scaling third-party services for taxes, payment, and shipping (think MQs, dedicated workers, etc.)

  • Launching new products, markets, and verticals


Technologies we currently use are Node.js, JavaScript (we like newer ECMAScript a lot), TypeScript, AWS, Docker, TerraForm, Postgres. We’re looking for product-minded engineers that get involved early and don’t shy away from first principles thinking.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • Minimum 3 years of professional experience working as a software engineer with a demonstrated ability to build & ship production services

  • Strong JavaScript experience with a proven understanding of the fundamentals of the language 

  • We take pride in writing software the right way. That means peer reviews, ample time to refactor code, and write tests

  • Play nicely with others (humans and dogs)


PERKS & BENEFITS



  • Brand new dog-friendly office in Greenwich Village (complete with free-roaming friendly dogs)

  • Comprehensive Healthcare, Dental, and Vision

  • Flexible PTO and WFH policy

  • Discounted fresh food for your pup

  • Fresh breakfast, snacks, and coffee for the humans

  • Strict daily belly rub quota


KEYWORDS


Node.js, JavaScript, AWS, Docker, TerraForm, TypeScript

title: Intermediate Software QA Analyst at Aveva (Calgary, AB, Canada)
description:
Intermediate Software QA Analyst


Calgary, Canada 


As a team member of a software product team, you will be responsible for the following:


Responsibilities:



  • Leverage Lean and Agile software practices and methodologies and apply a tester mindset during advanced design, refining, planning, development, daily standups, retros.

  • Develop and execute test strategies like automation, manual, and exploratory testing.

  • Investigate cause of system issues and failures, determine root cause and establish a test strategy for defect prevention.

  • Collaborate with peers across teams and stretch creative bounds while working on complex problems.

  • Work with a development team, Product Management, DevOps and Architecture teams.

  • Use design, programming and analytical skills to solve problems.

  • Be an advocate for the end user.

  • Grow professionally by leveraging available resources, training, peers and various learning activities.


 Requirements



  • 2+ years of software testing experience.

  • Experience in developing and executing test plans using different test levels (such as integration, function or system tests) and techniques (such as manual, automated or exploratory testing) to accomplish quality goals.

  • Proficient understanding of automated API testing as well as automated deployment and execution of test suites. 

  • Practical experience with lean/agile.

  • Experience with test automation tools/frameworks such as Xunit, MSTest, and Pester.

  • Experience in programming languages such as C# or PowerShell (C++ is an advantage).

  • ISTQB Agile Tester Certification is an advantage.

  • Experience in the Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) industry is an advantage.

  • Individual must be self-motivated, detail oriented and have a continuous improvement mindset.


 Education Requirements:


 Bachelor's Degree or Diploma in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or similar industry or experience

title: Senior MySQL Database Engineer at DraftKings (Boston, MA)
description:
WE’RE REIMAGINING SPORTS AND TECHNOLOGY. 
DraftKings is bringing sports fans closer to the games they love and becoming an essential part of their experience in the process. An industry pioneer since our founding in 2012, we believe we can continue to define what it means to be a technology company in sports entertainment. We love what we do and we think you will too.   

Do you MySQL?

We look to MySQL as the base of our high performing and ever growing application.  As a Database Engineer, you will develop, optimize and support that geographically distributed database infrastructure, both in the cloud and on prem.   If you're interested in taking on the kind of engineering challenges necessary to provide for these complex and highly available systems, we hope you join our team.


WHAT YOU'LL DO:



  • Responsible for the deployment, maintenance, and monitoring of our large scale database environments in the cloud and on-prem

  • Automate monitoring, maintenance and support related tasks

  • Recommend, follow, advocate and train on database performance best practices

  • You will be able to rapidly diagnose and fix problems and provide periodic on-call support

  • Lead the planning and implementation of all aspects of database disaster recovery


WHAT YOU'LL NEED:



  • Proficiency in MySQL database administration, with 3-5 years experience

  • Expertise in SQL (complex queries and stored procedures)

  • Expertise in data modelling and schema design

  • Amazon Web Services experience, 2-5 years

  • Strong Linux skills

  • Proficiency in the scripting language of your choice (shell, perl, python, etc) for monitoring and custom automation

  • Strong written, verbal and organizational skills

  • Extensive experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment




WHO ARE WE A GOOD FIT FOR?  
We love working with talented people but more than that, we seek out compassionate co-workers with a collaborative spirit. Our work moves quickly and we’re great at coming together to find creative solutions to some of tech’s most interesting problems. If that sounds good to you, join us.  

APPLY NOW
We’re proud to believe that your gender, race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran, or status as an individual with a disability should have nothing to do with our hiring practices. We’ll never discriminate against anyone’s background or creed. If you’re good at what you do, we want you to do it at DraftKings.

title: Senior iOS Developer at Blinkist (Berlin, Germany)
description:
––––––––––––


Team: iOS


Location: Berlin or Remotely


Working Hours: Full-time with flexible hours and home office opportunities


Duration: Permanent


––––––––––––


Your Role



  • With a focus on feature development, you help us deliver a top-notch product affecting millions of users and revenue.

  • You energise a senior role in one of our mission teams where engineers, designers, QA, and product owners collaborate around different missions with the help of an agile coach.

  • You follow best practices in engineering to achieve a robust code base, e.g. through code reviews and unit tests.

  • You mentor less experienced colleagues and actively promote learning across the team while continuing to develop your skills.



Your Profile


To be successful in this role, we believe you need at least five years of experience in professional iOS development for a consumer-facing app and solid expertise in Swift. Beyond that, we want to hear from you: Why is this role a great fit for you?



What’s in it for you


At Blinkist, we’ve flipped the script and moved beyond rigid classic management hierarchies. Instead, our Blinkist Operating System fosters a unique company culture valuing self-empowerment, personal development, direct communication, transparency, and mutual support.



We offer a permanent role based in Berlin-Neukölln or remotely with perks like a yearly €1,600 personal development budget, free plant-based lunch, a gym membership, public transportation pass, and 30 days of vacation. To find out more about life at Blinkist, visit our careers site.



Please send your application by March 31st, 2020. We can't wait to hear from you!




At Blinkist, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate and support it. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

title: Android Engineer at Spinrilla (Atlanta, GA)
description:
Spinrilla is seeking a Senior Android Developer to be employee number six & become an integral part of our growing team. You will be responsible for leading the development of our native Android application from its current form through the product roadmap. You will be directly involved in engineering and development decisions to help improve the app and help achieve our company goals. title: Technical Product Owner - eCommerce Platform at Yum! Brands, Inc. (Plano, TX)
description:
Who we are:


Our story might surprise you. We’re the world’s largest restaurant company—encompassing KFC, Pizza Hut, and Taco Bell—but there’s a lot more going on behind the scenes than just frying chicken, baking pizzas, and serving up tacos. We put this delicious food in the hands of customers through apps, websites, kiosks, POS, and other digital dining experiences – and we are only getting started. In our Chicago and Dallas offices, we’re building out a bold team of hackers to help Yum! Brands deliver the next generation of software to 49,000 restaurants in more than 145 countries. That’s a huge responsibility, which is why we’re on a mission to find the most fearless engineers to join our software startup within Yum!.


Yum!'s vision for the future is simple: a world with more Yum!: with our iconic brands in more places, and more ways for consumers to access them. The key and not-so-secret ingredient in our recipe for growth is our unrivaled talent and culture, which fuels our results. And like all companies who win consistently, our brands, employees, and franchisees will need to continually adjust to stay relevant now and in the future. The software we’re building does just that: it serves people in new ways to make team members more productive and customers happier.


What we need:


Our dynamic eCommerce Platform team is rapidly growing as we optimize our digital ordering channels and technology innovations to create competitive advantages for our restaurants around the globe. We are seeking a Product Owner who can provide direction to technical teams. In this role, your customers will be product and engineering teams building front-ends (web, mobile, etc.) on top of our eCommerce platform. You will work with these internal customers to understand their needs, document requirements, and extend the platform.


You will:



  • Work collaboratively with engineers and testers on your agile delivery team

  • Work directly with front-end teams building applications for domestic and international markets

  • Partner with product management to define and prioritize roadmaps

  • Elicit requirements, synthesize and document them into stories for the product backlog

  • Break requirements into iterative sprint-sized stories that optimize speed-to-value

  • Manage and refine the product backlog, assemble sprints, and perform release planning

  • Articulate business and customer value to development team and use it to guide prioritization

  • Participate in the release process as the product expert to surface any issues prior to release

  • Ensure that roadmaps and the product backlog are visible, transparent, and clear


You have:



  • A BS/BA degree or equivalent experience

  • Outstanding written, verbal, and presentation skills

  • Agile product owner experience in a SaaS or PaaS environment

  • Working knowledge of REST API design and usage

  • Hands on experience producing and/or consuming REST API’s

  • The ability to run meetings and drive agenda

  • Effective influencing skills

  • Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) – preferred, not required

  • Certified ScrumMaster (CSM) – preferred, not required


A few of our perks:



  • 4 weeks of vacation PLUS holidays

  • 5 sick days

  • 2 paid volunteer days

  • 401k matching

  • Medical, dental, vision

  • Life insurance

  • Half day Fridays

  • Generous parental leave

  • A world-famous recognition culture

title: Software Engineering Manager (.NET) at United Network for Organ Sharing (Richmond, VA)
description:
About the Position:


Software Engineering Managers are responsible for the continual improvement of themselves, the teams they manage, and the organization as a whole. They drive software quality, design, development, deployment, and customer service excellence for the organ transplantation community. This role emphasizes four critical areas necessary for the success of the organization. These are employees, customers, quality, and processes.


About the position:
Must be authorized to work in the US. Sponsorship is not available for this position.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Ensures team is adequately staffed, resourced, and trained to successfully fulfill that responsibility.                        

  • Define clear vision and goals of team that continually challenge them to stretch and grow as a team.                       

  • Responsible for forming teams through recruiting and staffing efforts to balance experience, skills, personalities, etc. to create the ideal team dynamic.

  • Hold regular staff meetings to inform employees and manage expectations.                       

  • Continually evaluate individual contributions to teams and actively manage for team health: coaching, encouraging, providing training opportunities, administering disciplinary action, relocating, hiring, retaining, and firing.                           

  • Hold regular one-on-ones to understand career development goals of team members, provide feedback, and update professional development plan to grow the individual.   

  • Complete and administer annual performance reviews.                  

  • Survey teams for examples of UNOS core values; recognize, reward, and encourage continued displays of values.

  • Participate in code reviews.

  • Participate in the review of business epics and stories.

  • Prioritize the team’s work; execute tasks associated with the work assigned to the team.

  • Communicate information in both technical and layman’s terms.                               

  • Must embrace agile values, believe them, live them, and encourage others in adopting and utilizing them on a daily basis.                         

  • Continually monitor impediments raised by the Scrum / Kanban teams and look for ways to make incremental changes in policies and structure to remove them.                            

  • Monitor flow of work both upstream and downstream of the application development process and continually work to align it with external workflows.                       

  • Ensure we maintain the code base to support Internal & External users.                 

  • Participate in portfolio planning to align upcoming projects with the correct teams.  Help create the long term roadmap.                 

  • Work with Service Owners and teams to provide estimations for the committees, the BOD, customer innovations and other non-OPTN efforts.             

  • Work with the PMO to ensure successful project delivery.             

  • Manage post production support of releases to the user community.                       

  • Support & enforce software engineering best practices and standards and Industry standards.

  • Leverage software engineering metrics to continuously improve.              

  • Support the Software Engineering Architectural Roadmap.          

  • Explore new technologies which will benefit software engineering to help our code base to be more modular, easily maintained, faster, more reliable, scalable, and better aligned with the industry.

  • Lead horizontal efforts across software engineering.      

  • Foster an environment of creativity, innovation, and continuous improvement.  Encourage “out of the box” thinking.              


Minimum Requirements



  • Entry level experience managing or leading a team of software engineers required.  1+ years of overall people management experience preferred.

  •  3 years of software development or other related professional IT experience required.  5+ years of IT experience strongly preferred.


Critical Skills



  • Experience with Agile development and methodologies preferred.

  • Active participation in the technical community.

  • Possesses strong verbal and written communication skills.                          

  • Strong problem/issue analysis and resolution skills.        

  • Demonstrated ability to lead projects and/or teams in a software development environment.


Additional Skills and Qualifications



  • Active participation in the technical community.

  • Experience with Agile development and methodologies preferred.


Education


4-year degree in computer science or other related field of study, or equivalent professional IT leadership experience


Physical Requirements


General office demands



For information on UNOS, including more information on employee benefits and our company culture, visit our website at https://unos.org/careers/ .


UNOS provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. It will not unlawfully discriminate or permit harassment against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, disability, familial or marital status, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, genetic information, or any other characteristics or classification protected under applicable law (“protected categories”). This policy applies not only to hiring, but also to working conditions, benefits and privileges of employment, training, appointments for advancement, transfers, layoffs, recalls, terminations of employment and all other terms and conditions of employment.  UNOS maintains a drug-free workplace.


UNOS is also an affirmative action employer. It takes affirmative action to recruit and provide opportunities for advancement to qualified females and minorities, individuals with disabilities, special disabled veterans and other protected veterans. It hires and promotes based on job-related requirements and individual qualifications. Action is taken to ensure the fulfillment of this policy as to all phases of the employment process including hiring, placement, training, upgrading, transfers and/or demotions, recruiting, layoffs and termination of employment.


UNOS invites individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to identify themselves, if they wish to do so.  Such communication will be kept as confidential as possible and will be used only in accordance with the law. Candidates may contact the EEO/AA Officer at employment@unos.org to self-identify or request an accommodation.

title: Senior Software Engineer - HLS/EDA (f/m/d) at Silexica (Kln, Deutschland)
description:
At Silexica’s Cologne headquarters we are currently looking for a passionate and experienced Senior Software Engineer (f/m/d) focussing on High-Level Synthesis (HLS)/ EDA to join our Engineering team and to help develop the next generation of heterogeneous software computing tools.


The role:



  • You will drive the design of internal heuristics and strategies used in Silexica tools to model High-Level Synthesis tools

  • You create use cases and test suites to support the integration of the Silexica Tool Suite with FPGA synthesis tools from other vendors

  • You will help with the design and development of the Silexica tools, writing efficient, modern and portable C++ and python code

  • You define specifications, internal architectures, communication interfaces and functional partitions for target customer designs

  • You program C/C++ for hard- and soft processing subsystems in FPGA-based SoCs

  • You engage in research and development projects with our FPGA-based customers





Requirements



Your profile:



  • You have a solid background on High-Level Synthesis (HLS) or related EDA topics

  • You previously designed or developed high level synthesis or similar tools

  • You have experience with VHDL- or Verilog- based design, implementation, and verification

  • You have a university degree in electrical engineering, computer science or a related field and have gained several years work experience after graduation

  • You have a strong technical understanding of embedded systems/software and embedded architectures.

  • You have excellent knowledge of hardware description languages and FPGAs, ideally Altera and Xilinx FPGAs

  • You have experience in C/C++ development

  • You ideally have gained experience in the consumer electronics, telecommunications or automotive market segments

  • You have excellent communication skills (fluent in English) and great problem solving capabilities

  • You show ownership and responsibility for your work and make things happen





Benefits



We offer:



  • An opportunity to work with a breakthrough product that is shaping a new era of computing

  • A driven, passionate and international team that values commitment, results and openness

  • A competitive salary and a modern workplace that celebrates the diversity and well-being of our team

  • Great benefits such as regular team events, free massages and fitness subsidies, additionally we will support you with visa and relocation if needed


Are you ready for the next challenge? Grow with us and shape the future of Silexica! To apply please upload your CV, your motivation for this position and outline your availability via our recruiting system.
