To shape the future of online food retail, we challenge you every day to evaluate, adapt and overcome the challenges that we face in our highly demanding environment. You do not wait for things to happen, you make things happen. You have a passion for software development and love sharing it with your colleagues. You speak and write English fluently, and can tick all of the following boxes:



  • At least 4 years of experience as an Android developer, preferably in an ecommerce environment.

  • Experience with multiple Android API’s and with development tools like Android Studio, Eclipse and Git.

  • Recent work experience with automated testing (Unit testing and UI Testing) and CI Pipelines (Maven, Bitrise, Gitlab CI).

  • Know all about new Android layouts, activity lifecycle events, what’s new in Java 1.8 and Android http frameworks like Retrofit

title: Senior BI Engineer at Rakuten (Setagaya City, Japan)
description:
Responsibilities:



  • Manage End to End BI Developments tasks and Operations in all our internal BI environments(Can be on any BI tools which we support like Power BI, Domo, tableau, Microstrategy based on projects)

  • Complete BI and Admin management (including scripting development (If required)/maintenance, troubleshooting fix/support/ handle job failures/environment set up/User and job managements etc)

  • Report the status on issues/daily tasks on regular basis

  • Do users hearing and commination with all relevant teams including IT team (internal/external), Coordinate and address requests and concerns from Business team.

  • Coordinate and manage request form Internal BI development team
    Plan and execute various Development, Migration and version upgrade projects in all BI environments (end to end tasks)

  • Work with internal BI team closely to address all BI team reporting and data requirements.



Minimum Qualifications:


  • 4 to 6 years of Advance level Power BI Report Development /Admins experience in Power BI Pro/premium environments


  • Engineering or MCA in Computer Science Background or other related degree.


  • Programming skills i.e. Shell, Java, Python, etc.
    Advance level experience & good understanding of relational, MPP databases and writing SQL queries


  • Mindset of taking responsibility and ownership in day to day activities (Should understand business requirements, issues, goals and take actions actively without detailed instructions)


  • Ability to balance and prioritize multiple projects


  • Good team player and Strong communication skills




Preferred Qualifications:


  • Good speaking skills in English

  • Good knowledge of BI Administration and server/Infra related

  • Knowledge of other BI tools like Domo, Tableau, Microstrategy etc would be highly regarded.

  • Development in a Data warehouse environment would be a plus.

  • Certifications with Linux, Databases, Business Intelligence, Data warehousing tools would be highly regarded.

title: Senior Game Development Engineer at Stardock Systems, Inc (Plymouth, MI)
description:
Job Summary:


Stardock is currently seeking a senior or lead game developer for its Plymouth Michigan studio to work on an unannounced, next-generation PC/Console title.  


The position involves being very strong in C++ development and comfortable with multithreaded development.  Our new titles make heavy use of DirectX 12 and Vulkan and require a reasonable understanding of graphics and systems engineering.


Primary Responsibilities Include:



  • Design, code, test, document, and debug new and existing applications and systems according to industry best practices.

  • Develop C++ code.

  • Assist in defining scope and specifications for game projects.

  • Work with Engineers to assist in optimizing code and improving products.

  • Track and communicate through bug tracking system.


  Education and/or Experience Desired:



  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or relevant field required.  

  • 5+ years experience desired in C++  required.

  • Self-motivated, likes to identify and solve problems.

  • Networking/HTTP knowledge and experience preferred. 

  • Familiarity with HLSL is helpful.

  • Familiarity with Lua is helpful.

title: Python Software Engineer at Revolut (London, UK)
description:
ABOUT THE TEAM
Data sits at the heart of Revolut and plays a uniquely crucial role in what we do. With data we build intelligent real-time systems to personalise our product, tackle financial crime, automate reporting, track team performances and enhance customer experiences.
Fundamentally, data underpins all operations at Revolut and being part of the team gives you the chance to have a major impact across the company – apply today to join our world class data department.


ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for Python Engineers for our Core Data Infrastructure to push our teams to new heights and has combination of laziness, unwillingness to write overcomplicated code and pathological desire to automate everything.


What you'll be doing:
-Enforcing consistent quality by incorporating tests and performing code reviews with data scientists and data engineers
-Explore and experiment new tools, libraries and technologies to improve our solutions
-Support and train new and existing users of the platform
-Taking ownership of certain parts of the automation and abstraction framework dealing recurring etl tasks, ensuring monitoring, reliability and scaling up of data both in volumes and variety
-Creating and maintaining company-wide repository of metadata and related artefacts
-Collaborating with product owners, engineers and data scientists to implement a seamless data platform
-Coming up with and enforcing best practises regarding everything - coding, testing, deployment, etc.


WHAT SKILLS YOU’LL NEED
-Fluency in SQL, Python, Unix/bash scripting.
-Ability to write easily understandable and maintainable code in multiple programming languages


Databases:
- SQL {Redshift, Vertica, Exasol, PostgreSQL, MySQL, BigQuery}
- NoSQL {DataStore, CouchDB, Redis}
- Understanding their strengths and weaknesses


Big data:
- Experience using, configuring, and tweaking one of Kafka, Spark, Flink, etc
Productionizing:
- Docker, K8s, Ansible/Puppet, Teamcity/Jenkins, monitoring and alerting
Versioning:
- GIT, Jira, or similar


Desired:
- Interest in data analysis/data visualisation (D3 is a plus)
- Experience with prototyping and sketching
- Side projects or open source contributions
- Cloud: GCP
- Java, Javascript, GO, etc.


DOMAIN KNOWLEDGE
If you have expertise in one of the following, awesome!
- Fraud Detection
- AML/CTF Risk
- Monetization
- Engagement and User Activation
- Credit and Operational Risk Modelling
- Productionizing models
- Code generation



A LITTLE ABOUT US
We believe that there are better ways for people to control their money. Easier, fairer ways.
Revolut started in 2015 with fee-free card transactions abroad. We’ve since added current accounts, business accounts, savings, insurance, and even cryptocurrency trading.
We reached 4 million customers in February 2019 and we’re adding another million every quarter.
And we’re only just getting started.
Come and help Revolut build the world’s first truly global bank.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
From employee 1 to employee 1000, you will be slotting into a global team that shares a number of traits.
You can work autonomously and take ownership. We thrive with the space and responsibility to solve problems.
You operate best without lots of bureaucracy. We don’t hide behind fancy job titles or clunky processes ‘because that’s how things are done’.
You approach work in a logical way. We are not afraid to make mistakes but we use data and logic to backup decisions and improve understanding.
And you share our mission to improve people’s relationship with their money.


THE BENEFITS
• Competitive salary
• Biannual equity bonuses
• All the latest tech you need
• Skip the commute and work from home once a week
• Roll with a free Revolut Metal subscription
• Pension plan
• Private health insurance
• Don’t panic about cooking: get free dinners with Deliveroo
• Start the day properly with fresh fruit and cereals
• Stay refreshed: get juice, tea, coffee and soft drinks on tap
• Rest up with 29 days’ holiday per year

title: Senior Business Systems Analyst at vaso (Miami, FL)
description:
The Senior Business Systems Analyst in Miami spearheads the capture and translation of evolving product functionality.  This team member will engineer and maintain a seamless interface between product management, specialists, and user testing teams, and our multi-location, global development team. This is a mission critical role that will directly impact the ultimate shape and function of our product. 


The successful candidate is an experienced professional,advanced in the systems and process design and implementation space, and passionate about creating strong relationships across functional teams to create spectacular products and services.


Responsibilities



  • Solicit, understand and document product-related business requirements, use cases, processes, and workflows.

  • Develop both written and visual depictions of requirements and process flows.

  • Deliver precise functional specifications to include functional hierarchy, workflow, business rules.

  • Serve as a subject matter expert to the developers, and work with the testing team on developed functionality.

  • Work with development, testing and production support teams to communicate, verify, and test desired functionality changes.

  • Manage multiple competing priorities through effective organization and communication;

  • Recommend and institute BSA best practice and methodology and tools;

  • Perform QA of BSA team deliverables;

  • Responsible for leading the Miami BSA contribution, including practice development, and performance goal-setting.


Qualifications 



  • Bachelor's Degree or higher in technology-related field, or relevant experience in implementing software in a B2B service industry;

  • Agile, Scrum, UML, storyboard, workflow, etc.;

  • 5+ years of BSA experience;

  • Demonstrated team leadership (staff development & management) and performance actions;

  • Understanding of business analysis principles, processes, and techniques;

  • Demonstrated ability to develop and prepare use cases, functional specifications, and technical requirements;

  • Ability to understand and represent the needs of the end user in a software development environment.


Skills 



  • Strong MS Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), MS Visio skills.

  • Strong consultative and advisory skills.


Other Conditions



  • Reporting to: CTO-CIO

  • Location: Miami

  • Travel: As per business needs

  • Probationary Period: 6 months

title: Security Engineer - Lead at Tessian (London, UK)
description:
Tessian


We believe technology should secure the digital interactions of employees without compromising user experience or productivity. That’s why we’re building the world’s first Human Layer Security platform.


We’re a team of mathematicians, data scientists & engineers building breakthrough machine learning and natural language technologies to analyse, understand & protect enterprise email networks.


Tessian is backed by leading technology investors Sequoia Capital and Accel who have helped build many industry defining companies including Stripe, Slack, Crowdstrike and Dropbox.


We'd love to hear from you.


Security at Tessian


At Tessian, our mission is to keep the world’s most sensitive data and systems private and secure. This means that it’s critical we go above and beyond in regards to securing our platform. We are looking for an experienced Security Engineer to come in and help take our security processes to the next level.  You'll have great coding skills & a breadth of experience, as well as wanting to get your hands dirty and dig in to the workings of our systems. 


Please note that we're also hiring a Head of Information Security who will own internal non-engineering Security processes & our ISMS. That role sits adjacent to this role's responsibilities, but if that role is also of interest, you can read about it here. We're also open to a hybrid role blending the two - if that's of interest, please apply via this Security Lead Engineer job spec, & flag in 'Additional Information', or your covering note, that you'd consider a hybrid role.


Read more about Engineering at Tessian: https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/1670277/Life%20as%20a%20Tessianeer.pdf https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/tessian                                  https://www.tessian.com/blog/safely-migrating-millions-of-api-requests/


Tessian's Tech Stack Snapshot




    • Python

    • Node.JS

    • .NET

    • AWS

    • Spark

    • Postgres

    • Docker

    • Terraform

    • Concourse



Your role will include




    • Working in and with development teams to ensure security is designed in to new features being built

    • Building and maintaining our security road map

    • Sharing your experience and best practices with the development teams but also product and ops teams

    • Helping to instil a security culture at Tessian (e.g. last year we ran a CTF)

    • Helping Tessian shift security left

    • Working together with external Red Teams and Pen Testers to externally validate the security health of our platform



We'd love to meet someone who




    • Has demonstrable software security experience

    • Has software development and DevOps experience, and still wants to get stuck in!

    • Is passionate about security & is up to date on the latest threats and techniques

    • Knows their OWASP from their NIST

    • Has some experience with AWS



Why we think you'll love it here





      • It’s important to us that all Tessians are part of the journey we’re on, so we offer equity options with every role and benchmark to provide above market rate salaries - there’s plenty more too….




Be at your best, both inside and outside of work





      • A full week of work-remote a year, in addition to 25 days of paid holiday

      • Flexible working hours and working from home

      • Curate your career with development experiences uniquely suited to you

      • We’re family friendly, with policies built to support you in all stages of life

      • High-quality tech kit provided for you to work on including Tessian ANC headphones

      • If you're relocating to join the team, we'll provide a contribution to help with your costs




Because everyone loves food...





      • A plethora of breakfast options, delicious snacks, drinks and a top-of-the-range coffee machine

      • Team lunch provided on Fridays - normally with more hummus than you can shake a stick at

      • Dinner budget for those times you just can’t tear yourself away




Beyond work




    • Elite membership of the Tessian House System...

    • On Fridays we stop at 5 and share team updates and drinks

    • Monthly team socials & a big, whole team extravaganza every quarter

    • Never-ending ping-pong tournaments



Equality & diversity


Tessian is an equal opportunity employer, committed to equality and diversity amongst both our employees and prospective applicants. The Human Layer we're securing is diverse, and we know we need to be diverse and inclusive to successfully create HLS that reflects this. You can read our equality and diversity statement here.


As part of our commitment to equality and diversity, we're also a corporate member of the WISE Campaign for gender equality in STEM & we're a founding member of the WEDS network driving diversity & inclusion in startups.


Important notices


Please note that we do not accept applications or résumés from recruiters. Any unsolicited CVs, profiles, or names, submitted in any format, by any channel, to any of our team, will be deemed to fall outside any terms and/or conditions with either the person submitting the information or their company of employment/representation.


By submitting your application to Tessian, you consent to Tessian retaining your information and contacting you about future job opportunities, that may be of interest, for up to 2 years in accordance with our Privacy Policy


Please note, that any job offers will be subject to the candidate passing background screening checks.

title: Data Engineer at trivago N.V. (Dsseldorf, Germany)
description:
Are you passionate about creatively using technology, and both learning new things, as well as going deep in the technologies you use? Do you want the chance to work with big data systems, operating at a very large scale

Our data engineering team is looking for a skilled developer and expert on systems level who can help build and maintain our big data architecture. We want someone who can not only use but also maintain and further develop our big data infrastructure, with Hadoop at its core.

Interested? Apply today!

Get an inside look at tech at trivago: https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=9&v=aQYEsuGOs-s&feature=emb_title


What you'll do:



  • As an expert in your field, you will design, implement and maintain data infrastructure, including the Hadoop ecosystem, Kafka, import / export tools, and related systems.

  • Continuously improve our algorithms and approaches. On this note we encourage thinking outside the box and want our developers to challenge the status quo.

  • Ensure the solutions being defined are reusable and follow good design patterns and architecture principles.

  • Collaborate with and provide technical consultation to other software development teams, operations, product and business intelligence teams to define deliverables and plans.



What you'll definitely need:



  • Has a good foundation in programming languages and systems architecture, ideally experience in OOP using Java and other languages.

  • Has some experience working with Hadoop.

  • Has an understanding concurrent programming and complex algorithms.

  • Has some experience with engineering and administrating distributed systems.

  • Ability to model complex data structures.

  • Has an understanding of configuration management systems and their concepts for automated configuration. Knowledge of Linux / Unix helps in our environments.

  • Holds a university degree (bachelor or master) in Computer Science.

  • Is comfortable communicating in English (our company language).



What you can expect from life at trivago:



  • Growth: We help you grow as trivago grows through support for personal and professional development, constant new challenges, regular peer-feedback, mentorship and world-class training.

  • Autonomy: Every talent has the ability to make an impact independently by driving topics thanks to our strong entrepreneurial mindset, our horizontal workflow and self-determined working hours.

  • International environment: Our agile, international culture and environment with talents from 50+ nations encourages mutual trust and creates a safe space to discuss openly and act freely.

  • Collaborative spaces: Our state-of-the-art campus in Düsseldorf offers interactive spaces where we can easily collaborate, exchange ideas, take a break and workout together.

  • Relocation: We offer our international talents support with relocation costs, work permit and visa questions, free language classes, flat search and insurance.



Additional information:



  • trivago N.V. is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users.

  • To find out more about life at trivago follow us on social media @lifeattrivago.

  • To learn more about tech at trivago, check out our blog: https://tech.trivago.com/

  • Want to learn more about trivago's business model to prepare for your interview? Visit https://company.trivago.com/our-product/


A note regarding COVID-19:


As a global company of over 90 nationalities, our trivago team has family members and friends in some of the most heavily affected areas. For us, the well-being and safety of our global community is our first priority.  


Due to the current situation regarding COVID-19, we’ve shifted our operations to a completely remote setup for the next few weeks in an attempt to help prevent the further spread of the coronavirus. This also means that all our interviews and onboarding activities will take place remotely using video conferencing.


Our recruiting team will be on hand every step of the way to guide you through our process, but if you have any questions or concerns before applying, feel free to reach out to us at joinus@trivago.com.


We look forward to your application!

title: DevOps Engineer at audibene (Denver, CO)
description:
audibene / hear.com is a global MedTech with origins in Europe. We are the fastest-growing audiology company ever. We are driven by our belief that every person should hear well to live well.


In the past 8 years we have grown our team from 2 to 1000+ people, crossed the barrier of profitability and opened offices in over 11 locations from Denver to Seoul. In all this time we never lost the core belief that made all this possible in the first place: We work hard and we play hard, as a team we can achieve almost anything.


In our MedTech platform we utilize a wide range of technologies, from Node, Java and Go services deployed via Docker on Kubernetes over Pulsar and Spark to Electron clients and mobile apps. We’re huge fans of open source and continuously implement the latest technologies to improve the performance and drive innovation across our platform. As a team we are constantly curious, driven by collaboration and the common drive to learn and grow together.


Join us now, as we are shaping this fascinating consumer healthcare space! 


We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to further strengthen our Tech team in Denver, U.S.


The role…



  • Build, scale and monitor a globally distributed microservice infrastructure in AWS.

  • Implement continuous integration mechanisms using Jenkins pipelines, enabling stable and efficient delivery of code

  • Set up and improve monitoring infrastructure to enable the best possible uptime and fast disaster response

  • Live, breathe and drive DevOps culture, working closely with our engineering teams to enable the best combination of stability and velocity in delivering value to our users.

  • Research, learn and distribute knowledge on new technologies and new ways of doing things, constantly improving upon the status quo.


You bring…



  • Deep knowledge of AWS cloud-based architecture and infrastructure (EKS, ASG, EC2, Lambdas)

  • Background in working as an Infrastructure, DevOps or Site Reliability Engineer

  • Experience hosting, scaling and deploying Kubernetes based applications

  • Experience in implementing CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins

  • Familiar with database technologies (PostgreSQL, MongoDB)

  • Demonstrated keen technical ability and willingness to pick up new tech and techniques

  • BSc in Computer Science (or similar) OR equivalent work experience


What we offer:



  • With your task at hear.com you help people to improve their living situation. We all enjoy to go to work for a good purpose.

  • Fun company cultural and incredible growth opportunities.

  • Health benefits for all full-time employees – we cover up to 50% for your medical, dental and eye care costs.

  • We support you with your 401(K) contribution plan.

  • We are looking for people that want to grow and make an impact in technology @ hear.com.

  • We love to spend time together on regular company sponsored team events, parties and annual trips!


This is a full-time position based in Denver, US. We are seeking enthusiastic and motivated team members who are looking to fast-track their career. If you want to be part of a young, dynamic and fast growing company, a new challenge awaits you!

title: Director, Engineering Effectiveness at Oscar Health (New York, NY)
description:
Hi, we’re Oscar. We’re hiring a Director of Engineering Effectiveness to join our Engineering team in our New York City office.



About the role:


Oscar engineers work on some of the most challenging problems in tech - helping users navigate the complex health industry through beautiful user applications, elegant distributed system design making sense of noisy data, statistical learning, and language theory. We invest our people, our tools, and our processes so we can focus on solving big problems while learning from one another.


Engineering Effectiveness is one of three infrastructure groups at Oscar. If Site Reliability Engineering is infrastructure-as-a-service, then think of the Engineering Effectiveness group as platform-as-a-service. We build and operate platform services such as schedulers, consensus services, monitoring and common/shared engineering services for Oscar’s software engineers to use. In addition, we educate and train the engineering organization on best practices, we build codelab tutorials, implement frameworks and provide common libraries.


As the Director of Engineering Effectiveness, you will begin with managing two teams - Engineering Effectiveness and Data Infrastructure - and report into our Senior Director of Infrastructure Engineering.


What you will actually be doing:



  • As a leader you will conduct the strategy and planning for your teams’ operations

  • You will mentor your teams’ members and nurture their career growth

  • You will be a key person in adaptation and tailoring processes to help your teams’ be productive and happy

  • You will contribute strong engineering skills and partake in design and implementation alongside your teams’ members


You at Oscar:



  • You are passionate about mentoring people and team leadership

  • You put people first and care about the development of your teams and the effectiveness of your teams

  • You care about platforms and automations

  • You can work well under pressure and within tight deadlines

  • You have at least 10 years of Platform or SRE development and at least 5 years managing people

  • You enjoy working and deploying technologies such as schedulers, data streaming, containerization and observability in Python and Go or other similar technologies

title: Senior Android Engineer at UniKey Technologies (Orlando, FL)
description:
In this senior Android engineering role, you will set an example of following best practices, keep an eye to user experience, and hold your team members accountable to the same standards. By performing at the top of your craft and demonstrating grit in problem solving, you will be influential in shaping the future products and processes of UniKey.


Responsibilities



  • Work closely with the product team and partners — possibly by directly calling or emailing them — to ensure the team is taking the best approach to solving partner and product problems

  • Closely monitor technical debt and know how to balance paying back debt vs. hitting deadlines and meeting product goals.

  • Set the technical direction for how problems will be tackled, including architectures, libraries, and tools.

  • Work closely with mobile engineers to design, implement, test, and fix bugs for new product features. 

  • Stay up to date with the latest Android updates and tools, making ongoing education and engineering best practices a priority. Advocate for ongoing improvements to UniKey products by leveraging new Android tools and updates.

  • Facilitate inter- and intra-team communication and share knowledge to better your team and the entire company.

  • Track all work appropriately in JIRA and/or Azure DevOps; suggest new opportunities for driving organization


Requirements 



  • 3+ year(s) experience in Android development and demonstrated commitment to ongoing learning of Android and related libraries.

  • A “big picture” attitude that facilitates contributing outside of the Android codebase when necessary (whether through sharing knowledge or through coding).

  • Understands and upholds company values and demonstrates a winning attitude.

  • Familiarity with Retrofit, Dagger 2, RxJava 2, and React Native a plus.

  • Track record of delivering quality solutions to partners by collaborating across specialties and demonstrating creative problem solving.

  • Experience with cryptography is a plus.

  • Experience with the android bluetooth stack is a plus.

  • Experience with interfacing with embedded devices from a mobile app is a plus.

title: Senior .NET Developer at eThor (Calgary, AB, Canada) (allows remote)
description:
eThor is searching for a motivated and talented Senior/Lead .NET Developer.  This job is located in Calgary, AB however we do allow remote workers within Canada. Our software is deployed on modern credit card payment terminals at restaurants and is used by our customers to process hundreds of millions of dollars worth of credit card transactions per year. We are a small company that is growing quickly and can offer an exciting opportunity as a senior member of our team for the successful applicant. 

The successful applicant will work with our existing team to further develop our core product that integrates payment terminals with merchant POS systems. The desired skill-set for the successful applicant are as follows:


Must have:



  • At least intermediate knowledge of Windows service and desktop applications (WPF)

  • Experience with large scale / distributed applications

  • Experience with microservices and/or service oriented apps

  • Moderate experience with some sort of RPC, like WCF or gRPC

  • Familiarity with X509 / PKI basics


Nice to have:



  • Familiarity with COM+/DCOM

  • POS knowledge

  • Blazor (for internal tooling)

title: DevOps Specialist at Octave Group (Montreal, QC, Canada)
description:
DevOps Specialist 


Montreal, Canada 


(French Version follows) 


Octave Group is on the lookout for a DevOps specialist whose main focus will be the maintenance, monitoring and administration of a 3rd party supported e-commerce platform. This position will necessitate interactions with internal and external stakeholders to pro-actively identify and resolve issues on the platform, which is built using the LAMP stack. This role will also give you exposure to large-scale and complex projects within our infrastructure team, supporting the entirety of our open-source, innovative and modern music solutions for business. 


What your day-to-day looks like: 



  • Administer, monitor and troubleshoot a Magento 3rd party-based e-commerce platform running on the LAMP stack.

  • Display a pro-active and support oriented mindset day-in, day-out.

  • Configuring clusters, automating deployments and debug cloud related issues.

  • Design and develop tooling to enhance the team’s ability to efficiently develop, monitor, and operate 

  • Ensuring the availability of development and test environments; and subsequently automating & deploying solutions into these environments.

  • Act as a critical support cast on all applications, infrastructures and post-prod activities 

  • Research solutions to complex problems and drive proof-of-concepts

  • Participate in code reviews 

  • Develop and apply continuous development, integration, deployment paradigms 

  • Work with passionate architects, technical leaders, technical operations to refine and improve specs


What you bring to the table: 



  • Essential – Tech savvy & passionate 

  • Essential – Linux: High proficiency, incl. operating/deploying software 

  • Experience in developing and/or maintaining 3rd party payment portals

  • Concrete working experience troubleshooting and developing features in a LAMP stack environment.

  • Ideal – Experience with Magento E-commerce Platform

  • Proficiency in one or more of the following languages: Python, Bash, PHP

  • Proficiency working with source control and build systems tooling (Jenkins, Git, Gerrit, GitHub)

  • Experience with Amazon AWS services (e.g. EC2, ELB, AutoScaling, Cloudformation) 

  • Experience building/deploying/debugging applications with Docker 

  • Preferred – D.E.C. or college degree in computer science or engineering, or equivalent 

  • Preferred – 3+ years of experience in software development and/or IT operations working with a high-load, Internet-facing service ecosystem 


The Hiring Process:



  • Phone interview with Talent Acquisition Specialist 

  • Technical Test

  • Phone interview with the Sr. Director of Infrastructure

  • In-person meeting with the IS team


What’s in it for you: 



  • Working alongside a bunch of super talented and friendly people 

  • A fun, diverse, open and fast-paced environment focused on family atmosphere and creating an off-the-hook user experience 

  • Freedom to use the IDE of your choice 

  • Challenging and stimulating projects 

  • Working with modern techs, in a culture that likes to drive constant innovation 

  • 50% off your monthly OPUS subscription 

  • Free Access to a virtual health care application. Long gone are the days of waiting 8 hours at the clinic. 

  • Conferences, training on the latest and greatest techs, weekly presentations and more.. 

  • Very competitive insurance package which is mostly covered by Octave Group 

  • Beautiful offices right next to Jarry Park 

  • Flexible hours and working environment 


Spécialiste DevOps


Montréal, Canada 


L’usage du masculin dans ce document a pour unique but d’alléger le texte.


Le Groupe Octave est à la recherche d'un spécialiste DevOps dont les responsabilités principales seront la maintenance, le suivi et l'administration d'une plateforme de commerce électronique supportée par une tierce partie. Ce poste nécessitera des interactions avec des intervenants internes et externes afin d'identifier et de résoudre de façon proactive les problèmes de la plateforme développée à l'aide des technologies LAMP. Ce rôle vous permettra également d'être exposé à des projets complexes de grande envergure au sein de notre équipe d'infrastructure, en soutien à l'ensemble de nos solutions open-source innovatrices de musique moderne pour entreprises.


Ton quotidien ressemblera à ceci:



  • Administrer, surveiller et dépanner une plateforme de commerce électronique Magento basée sur les technologies LAMP.

  • Afficher au quotidien une attitude proactive et orientée vers le support.

  • Configurer les clusters, automatiser les déploiements et déboguer les problèmes liés au nuage.

  • Concevoir et développer des outils pour améliorer la capacité de l'équipe à développer, surveiller et exploiter efficacement.

  • Assurer la disponibilité des environnements de développement et de tests, pour y automatiser et déployer les solutions.

  • Avoir une vision critique de toutes les applications, infrastructures et activités de post-production.

  • Rechercher des solutions aux problèmes complexes et conduire la validation des preuves de concept.

  • Participer à la révision des codes.

  • Développer et appliquer des paradigmes de développement, d'intégration et de déploiement continus.

  • Travailler avec des architectes passionnés, des responsables techniques des opérations pour affiner et améliorer les spécifications.


Ce que l’on recherche:



  • Essentiel - passionné  et féru de technologie

  • Essentiel - Linux : haut niveau de compétence y compris avec l'utilisation et le déploiement de logiciels

  • Expérience dans le développement et/ou la maintenance de portails de paiement de tierces parties

  • Expérience concrète de dépannage et de développement de fonctionnalités dans un environnement de pile LAMP

  • Idéal - Expérience avec la plateforme de commerce électronique Magento

  • Maîtrise d’un ou plusieurs des langages suivants : Python, Bash, PHP

  • Maîtrise des outils de contrôle de la source et des systèmes (Jenkins, Git, Gerrit, GitHub)

  • Expérience avec les services Amazon AWS (par ex. EC2, ELB, AutoScaling, Cloudformation)

  • Expérience de création/déploiement/débogage d'applications avec Docker

  • Préférence - D.E.C. ou diplôme collégial en informatique ou en génie, ou l'équivalent

  • Préférable - 3+ ans d'expérience de travail en développement de logiciels et/ou opérations informatiques dans un écosystème de services web à forte capacité.


Le processus d'embauche:



  • Entrevue téléphonique avec le Spécialiste en Acquisition de Talents

  • Test Technique

  • Entrevue téléphonique avec le Directeur Sénior en Infrastructure

  • Rencontre en personne avec l'équipe IS


Ce que l’on te propose:



  • Évoluer aux côtés de personnes super talentueuses et amicales.

  • Un environnement amusant, diversifié, ouvert et dynamique, axé sur une atmosphère familiale et la création d’une expérience utilisateur optimale.

  • Des projets stimulants et amusants.

  • Travailler avec des technologies de pointe dans une culture d'innovation constante.

  • PC ou Mac, ton choix.

  • 50% de réduction sur l’abonnement mensuel à OPUS.

  • Accès gratuit à une application offrant un support de santé virtuel. Fini les attentes interminables en clinique!

  • Conférences, budget de formation sur les technologies les plus récentes et les plus performantes, présentations hebdomadaires et plus…

  • Avantages sociaux compétitifs principalement couverts par Octave Group.

  • Superbes bureaux à deux pas du parc Jarry.

  • Horaires et environnement de travail flexibles

title: Site Reliability Engineer II at BigCommerce (Austin, TX)
description:
BigCommerce is disrupting the e-commerce industry as the SaaS leader for fast- growing, mid-market businesses. We enable our customers to build intuitive and engaging stores at a fraction of the cost to support every stage of their growth.


Our SRE team is made up of talented and enthusiastic individuals who have a huge amount of experience in the running, managing and scaling of large scale web operations and systems administration. The team works closely with the rest of our Engineering organization to ensure that the platform powering BigCommerce remains reliable, performant and secure, 24x7.


We’re looking for an experienced candidate who brings solid systems administration skills that are backed up by an innate understanding of software engineering, with a mindset skewed towards performance analysis, scalability and high availability.


Day to day you’ll find us with our nose in the terminal, using Terraform and Puppet to manage our Debian hosts in a heterogeneous environment of Docker containers, VMs and Bare metal servers. We rely heavily on Logstash and Grafana to provide the data we need to direct our focus and attention to diagnosing and resolving performance issues across a variety of software built in PHP, Ruby, Scala (JVM) and on occasion.


We are always working to empower the BigCommerce Engineering teams and to deliver a faster and more robust platform.


What makes you tick



  • A software engineer with a curiosity for operations, or an operations engineer that wants to work closely with software engineers to help improve response times, scalability and availability.

  • Someone who loves to code and enjoys working with multiple programming languages. We primarily work with PHP, Ruby and Python. Puppet manages all of our configuration.

  • A good communicator who works well with geographically distributed teams such as ours. We are split between Sydney, Austin, and San Francisco.

  • You're obsessive compulsive, in a good way. Your systems and scripts are clean, well-documented and comprehensible.

  • Hates doing the same thing twice, you’d rather spend the time to automate a problem away rather than having to spend time on it again.

  • You have a passion for learning when it comes to working with new technologies or languages

  • You live and breathe scalable web architectures.

  • You’re cool in a crisis and can align with others to ensure complex problems meet a timely and effective resolution.

  • While work is a big part of your life, you strive to maintain a good balance between the office and home. The pager is an important part of your day, but you don’t let it rule your life.


Who you are


Our ideal candidate possesses some or all of the following skills



  • 3-5 years experience operating, building software for or supporting large Linux based web application environments

  • Experience with Linux systems administration, including solid scripting skills (PHP, Python, Ruby, Perl) and Bash

  • Knowledge of configuration management systems such as Puppet, or Chef (we use Puppet)

  • Experience with popular tools for monitoring web applications (we use New Relic, Nagios, Graphite, and StatsD to name a few)

  • A wealth of knowledge in physical server and cloud environments

  • Minimum Bachelor's degree in CS, EE or MIS; or equivalent experience


Diversity & Inclusion at BigCommerce


We have the opportunity to build not only a great business, but a great company, with soul.  Our beliefs and commitment to diversity and inclusion are a central part of achieving that.


Our dedication to diversity and inclusion is grounded in two things: a moral belief in the dignity, value, and potential of every individual, and a practical belief that diverse, inclusive teams will create the best outcomes for our customers, partners, employees, and company. We welcome everyone to be a part of our journey.

title: Oracle Financials Functional Consultant (d/f/m) at AUTO1 (Berlin, Germany)
description:
What you will do:



  • Work with the Finance and IT divisions as well as other business users to scope and support Oracle Fusion application system

  • Support the requirements definition and implement new and existing business processes and reports

  • Be an owner: Take technical responsibility for existing and newly kicked-off projects.

  • Liaise with and maintain close contact with business users, Oracle for production support and bug/issue analysis.

  • Maintain overview of Oracle’s enhancements and new functionalities and pro-actively evaluate these with the business

  • Monitor the application/system security in line with the IT security policies, including user, access, usage management


What you should bring:



  • You are a self-starter, proactive, independent with can-do attitude and a passion to grow personally while driving the company forward.

  • 5+ years of experience in Oracle e-business suite or Oracle Fusion Cloud in development and support of Finance module (AP, AR, GL, FA and CM).

  • Technical experience with Oracle SQL, PL/SQL, SmartView, FRS, OTBI and BI reports.

  • Experience in SOAP and REST API integration with Oracle Fusion Financials.

  • Good knowledge of overall Oracle Fusion architecture and Approval management process

  • Experience in Finance business cycle, Month-end process and aware of best practices to implement business solutions.

  • Functional Knowledge in Oracle Fusion Financials along with customization skills.

  • Good knowledge in analysing, gathering requirements and configuration

  • Comprehensive experience in production support and comply with Oracle support process and technical discipline.

  • Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken


What you will get:



  • Technical excellence - You will join a high profile and fun engineering team surrounded by technology

  • Innovative culture - You will work on previously unsolved challenges and experiment with new technologies

  • Real impact - Your work will enable our business success and disrupt the car industry

  • Benefits package - You will take advantage of our employee pension scheme, tandem partner program, discounts on different services (gym, public transport, leisure activities...), regular team-events (international nights, bowling, karaoke...)

  • Smooth start in Berlin - You will receive relocation support that includes assistance with visa, apartment search, moving costs and help with German bureaucracy


Qualifications:



  • A bachelor’s degree in Finance, Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent.


Are you ready to take your career to the next level?


Then please send us your application, stating your salary expectations and your
earliest possible start date!


Anna Ruiz is looking forward to your application!


Contact:
Anna Ruiz
+49 30 201 638 - 2063

title: C++ Software Engineer at IMC Trading (Chicago, IL)
description:
WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO


IMC is a leading global market maker, using algorithmic trading and advanced technology to buy and sell securities on multiple trading venues worldwide. We provide liquidity to the financial markets, driving efficiencies for buyers and sellers.


Founded in 1989, we are an ambitious, innovative company and identified early on the importance technology would play in the fast-paced evolution of trading. This entrepreneurial spirit still drives us today and can be found in all of our offices around the world.


OUR TEAM


We now operate globally from offices in Europe, the US and Asia Pacific. Our employees work closely together in multidisciplinary teams, making our success possible.


Technology - At IMC, technology is not a department, it is at the heart of everything we do. Our technologists push the limits of possibility, and then look beyond. In our fast-paced environment, short feedback loops mean projects worked on in the morning can enter production the next day.


Trading – Although our traders come from many backgrounds they all have one thing in common: they are at their best solving complex problems. Their insight into global events, market shifts and pricing ensure we are trading in the right place, at the right time.


Business Support - Around the world, IMC’s business support teams are essential for sustaining our success. In our dynamic environment, we have many exciting challenges and multidisciplinary opportunities to shape our operations and make a real impact.



OUR CULTURE


Our employees are our greatest asset so we give them lots of responsibility and the support they need to make a difference. Our flat structure fosters a culture of openness and collaboration, encouraging the sharing of ideas and knowledge. It makes no difference if you have been with us for three days or three years, the best idea wins.


While we work hard, we also have a lot of fun; whether solving complex challenges or in team building, leisure and sporting activities. IMC also enables its employees to contribute towards a better society through our foundation.



SOFTWARE ENGINEERING AT IMC:



  • We trade in the most competitive markets across the globe.  Our software makes millions of trading decisions daily.  We win by making better and faster decisions than our competition. As a software developer you’ll be working alongside traders to implement strategies which will challenge you to be creative with your implementation. You’ll need to produce solutions which compete in the extremely latency sensitive environment, whilst managing complexity.

  • You’ll be working in a highly motivated team, controlling end-to-end product development.  We work in an environment where slight oversights can be extremely costly, while new features can be extremely profitable.  As a team we aim to balance the race to production with software quality and testability.  You’ll be placed in an environment consisting primarily of C++ and Java.  We have a build chain which has been designed around the concept of daily production releases.  A variety of systems and technologies keeps life interesting.

  • Upon joining you will be expected to manage your own time and tasks.  We rely on our developers to drive change by taking feedback from traders, and shaping that into an implementation. Your ownership of the task continues until a working production release.  Our most successful developers comfortably work in any part of our stack.



WHAT MAKES IT FUN?



  • One of the most fun aspects of the job is that we have a very quick feedback loop.  We release early and often to get incremental benefits as they are developed

  • We operate at the bleeding edge of technology.  If something new can potentially bring an advantage we will actively invest in developing and utilizing the solution

  • We really believe in sharing knowledge and technology between the different offices. Much of our technology stack is shared between all 3 regions, and we provide opportunities to travel between the regions both for personal growth and to assist where it has the biggest impact.

  • To get the best results we encourage everybody to gain understanding of both the trading strategy and how exchanges work on a technological level.

  • Working at IMC is also an opportunity to learn about financial markets. We know from experience that a lot of people really enjoy learning about a field beyond their immediate area of expertise, it’s one of the things that makes this job more interesting than others.

  • We employ a broad range of people with varying backgrounds.  What they have in common is their superior technical expertise, their extraordinary smarts and their collaborative approach. We will not accept less.


OUR HIRING PROCESS


To set you up for success, you can find our hiring process including tips on applying and interviewing with us on our website. Now it’s up to you! Apply today to start an amazing journey with IMC.

title: Senior Software Engineer, iOS at GoodNotes (Kowloon, Hong Kong)
description:
Description


GoodNotes was created from our founder's frustration of taking readable and reusable notes on his first iPad. We have since grown to millions of happy users and have become one of the top paid iOS apps worldwide. Our engineering team members are all full stack, Pi shaped, and most importantly product minded.


Our Core Values:



  • Users come first

  • Build better product, not just different

  • Do less but get more done

  • Always be learning


We are looking for multiple iOS mobile application engineers to join our core mobile team. Our iOS app has been featured by Apple and loved by millions. You will build and own the entire lifecycle of new user-facing features, often leveraging technologies unique to the latest frameworks. This is a not-to-be-missed opportunity to work with some of the best iOS engineers in the region.


Requirements



  • Excellent problem solving and storytelling skills

  • A love of software craftsmanship

  • A strong desire for self-improvement through side projects and sharing

  • Good taste as a maker

  • Built projects you are proud of, a big plus if they are side projects outside of work

  • Strong sense on the best tools for any task

  • Shipped one or more non-trivial apps on iOS/Android/Windows app stores

  • Big plus if you have experience cross compiling codebase on different mobile platforms


Benefits


We offer competitive compensation and meaningful equity along with a chance to make a significant contribution to a product people already love. We take care of you and your loved ones with medical insurance and flexible working hours including two optional work-from-home days! Check out our pictures from team outings and more on https://www.goodnotes.com/careers/

title: Cloud Native Engineer at Container Solutions (Montreal, QC, Canada)
description:
About the role


As a Cloud Native Engineer, you’ll be in charge of shaping solutions for companies in the midst of both an organisational as well as a technological transformation. Working in small, self-managed teams, you’ll guide our clients towards creating and automating their cloud infrastructure. We are a vendor-agnostic company, meaning that you will get to apply a diverse mix of tools and services. You mostly perform work from our offices. However, sometimes cooperation with our customers requires us to travel as part of the job.


What's in it for you? Our biggest benefits are our people and our culture. We offer a diverse work environment where people are respected for who they are and a culture based on learning, trust, and collaboration. Our Montreal office is conveniently located in the city, specifically in Spaces building. You can also count on:


Budget and time for learning, personal development, certifications, and contributing to open-source projects


A competitive salary (aligned with your experience)


Unlimited books budget


Permanent work contracts immediately


What does it take?


We often build tailored, innovative solutions within complex and ambiguous environments. Therefore, having an inquisitive mind and the eagerness to explore is vital. On top of that, consulting with clients, which depends on asking the right questions and crafting solutions as a team, requires strong collaboration and communication skills. 


Must-have technical skills


Background in development and/or operations


An understanding of best practices and patterns in software development 


Experience with CI/CD (knowledge of the principles and ability to set up a pipeline from scratch) 


Infrastructure provisioning (such as Terraform, Ansible, Cloud Formation, etc)


Experience in either public or private cloud


Understanding and exposure to Kubernetes


Nice-to-have


We offer engineering roles at different levels of seniority. These are some attributes that could make you a candidate for more senior positions:


A deep and demonstrated understanding of distributed systems, including containerised microservices and highly scalable web applications


Advanced (admin-level) knowledge of Kubernetes in production


A passion for the community (attending events, advocating cloud technology via meet-ups and conferences, or writing blog posts and other pieces of content)


How to apply


Drop us your CV and tell us, briefly, why you are applying. If we think you have what it takes, here’s how we will proceed:


We will first contact you to check some of the basics through a video chat (Amsterdam time). If you feel like you’d like to get to know us better, before entering the rest of the evaluation process, you are welcome to have lunch with us and chat with one of our engineers in our Montreal office.


Next step is a technical challenge and an online personality assessment. The latter will be discussed with you by one of our psychologists, to zoom in on the essential soft skills, as described above. 


A final stage is a meeting with the engineering team to evaluate your technical skills.

title: BAT/Rewards Chromium Engineer at Brave Software (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
description:
Brave is looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to work on advancing the Brave Rewards platform on our Chromium­ based desktop browser.  This position is on the forefront of advancing how BAT can be used to reward both content creators and users.


Requirements



  • 5+ years experience with desktop application development

  • Strong C++ development skills

  • Working experience with writing JavaScript

  • Experience with software development via distributed development teams

  • Experience with C++ unit and integration testing

  • Comfortable working in an open source setting

  • A passion for helping protect users’ privacy and security

  • Written and verbal communication skills in English

  • Proven record of getting things done


Bonus Points



  • Experience with the Chromium code base or other similar browser code base

  • Experience with Google C++ test framework

  • Familiarity with the world of cryptocurrency, especially Ethereum

title: Senior Data Engineer - Zalando Marketing Services at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
description:
As a Senior Data Engineer within the ZMS Data team, you will take end to end ownership of our Data Management Platform. You are responsible to ingest new Data Sources, often in collaboration with our Data Science team. You will increase the processing speed and optimize the costs of our EMR clusters.
You will choose emerging technologies and approaches to create high-performance data processing solutions that scale. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work by designing data-intensive applications. Our data teams aim to solve the specific problems of a very data-driven company that has already begun the journey to become a platform.


WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED



  • Designing, developing, and operating data integration pipelines to provide high-quality datasets for analytical and machine learning use-cases. You and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well as operate large-scale applications on a PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS)

  • Involved in building new ETL processes that might include combining data from multiple sources and maintaining the existing ones.
    Responsible for doing ad hoc analysis and building impactful data visualizations

  • Consulting with Analysts, Data Scientists, and Product Managers to build and continuously improve a variety of data products that create value for our business.

  • Heavily contribute to making integrated data and machine learning models available in real-time to our application landscape. Be a sparring partner to other team members, and provide support and guidance to other engineers to help develop their technical capabilities.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR



  • Excellent knowledge in working with Apache Spark, plus a very good knowledge of relational database systems (e.g PostgreSQL), knowledge of additional Big Data technologies like Hive, Flink or Kafka is a plus.

  • Experience doing data analysis with SQL

  • Solid programming skills in Scala / Java and Python

  • Knowledge of workflow management tools such as Airflow and hands-on experience in cloud technologies (AWS ideally), container/orchestration tools (Kubernetes, Docker).


PERKS AT WORK



  • A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere

  • Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings

  • Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts

  • Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)


We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.


ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES


Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe ’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world’s largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.


At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.


For more information check out this link:https://zms.zalando.com/

title: Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f/d) at e-bot7 GmbH (Mnchen, Germany)
description:
This is e-bot7 – Artificial Intelligence for Customer Service


We revolutionize Customer Service with Artificial Intelligence. Speed, passion and drive are the basis of our DNA. We put our customers at the center of everything we do, and we never stop until the job is done. We’re creating our own path, with a global and diverse team driving long-term growth and innovation. We don’t like “not possible”. We like new ideas, open-mindness, honesty and we always bring an element of fun into our work. Join our team and be ready to change the world with us.


We are one of the leading companies in Artificial Intelligence, providing our services to the world's most innovative companies. With our expert team of application developers and data scientists we work closely together with our customers to always be ahead of the game and to create state-of-the-art technology. Become part of our fast-paced environment and join our team building the most innovative and revolutionary technology in the market.


Some of our awards include: Insurance Disruptor of the Year, Impact Growth EU Tech of the Year, CCW Most Innovative CS Solution, Impact Diamond - Best InsurTech and many more.


Responsibilities



  • Manage our cloud (AWS, OpenStack) and on-premise server infrastructure using IaC

  • Design and implement a Kubernetes based solution to unify different environments

  • Manage and evolve our continuous deployment pipeline

  • Application monitoring, log collection, and analysis

  • Maintain and improve our backup and disaster recovery processes

  • Assess our application infrastructure w.r.t. security and performance

  • Identify and implement cost optimization strategies in our cloud infrastructure

  • Grow into a lead role in our DevOps team


Requirements



  • Fluent in Business English

  • Docker and docker-compose

  • Kubernetes

  • AWS: ECS, S3, ELB, VPC, CloudFormation, CodeBuild, CloudWatch

  • MongoDB

  • Networking, VPNs

  • Linux: CentOS, Ubuntu, Arch, SLES

  • Continuous integration/deployment


Who we are


e-bot7 brings artificial intelligence to customer service and helps companies achieve greater customer service efficiency. The system analyzes inbound messages and provides agents with accurate response suggestions. This reduces the average handling time by up to 80% and automates repetitive questions and processes right after integration.


What We Offer



  • Short decision-making process, low hierarchy and open communication

  • Typical start-up atmosphere: table tennis and computer games to clear your mind

  • We are a multicultural and multilingual team with over 20 nationalities

  • Shared office space to socialize with other smart brains located in the central city center

  • Health-promoting activities: fruit basket and yoga sessions in the office

  • Be part of a leading AI start-up in Europe, a great place to develop your skills, while trying out new things

  • Do you have a good idea? Share it, pitch it and realize it!

  • Team events: Oktoberfest, Christmas tree decoration and birthday celebrations with live piano music

  • We have an office gong – because the whole team wants to cheer for your success


If you are interested and meet the requirements, please send us your CV. We will get in touch with you as soon as possible.


We are looking forward to hearing from you in person.


Your e-bot7 Team


Perusastraße 7
80333 Munich, Germany
www.e-bot7.com


careers@e-bot7.com / +49 89 33984 110

title: DevOps Engineer/Linux systemadministratr till agilt webbteam at Pensionsmyndigheten (Stockholm, Sweden)
description:
Vill du arbeta med moderna och komplexa system i en organisation som utvecklas inom DevOps? Vill du arbeta med trevliga och kompetenta kollegor på en ambitiös och framåtsträvande arbetsplats? Trivs du att få arbeta med en hög nivå av frihet, eget ansvar samt bra teamsamarbete? I så fall kan rollen som DevOps Engineer / Linux systemadministratör i ett av våra agila webbteam vara rätt nästa steg för dig.


Pensionsmyndigheten är en myndighet som ligger i framkant när det handlar om teknik och utveckling. IT-avdelningen består idag av ca 300 medarbetare och växer kraftigt för att möjliggöra genomförandet av den nya Pensionsöverenskommelsen 2020-2026. För oss inom IT innebär det bl.a. nyutveckling av ett flertal nya system med den senaste tekniken och arbetssätt. Vår vision är att leverera Bäst IT för Sverige. Som en del av vår IT-avdelning kommer du att verka i en miljö präglad av stort driv och hög ambitionsnivå samtidigt som vi värnar om en sund balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Vi sitter i ljusa och moderna lokaler i nära anslutning till Hornstulls tunnelbana.


Arbetsbeskrivning


På Pensionsmyndigheten arbetar vi med Continuous Delivery, automatiserad testning och automatiserad konfigurationshantering. Vi har som ambition att automatisera vårt arbete redan från början för att undvika att behöva göra samma sak mer än en gång. Allt i linje med DevOps. I din roll som DevOps Engineer / Linux systemadministratör kommer du att ingå i ett agilt och tvärfunktionellt webbteam tillsammans med utvecklare, testare, m.fl. I teamet kommer du att vara en central person och underlätta dina kollegors dagliga arbete genom att diskutera idéer, angreppsätt och lösningar. Du får många kunniga kollegor som gärna delar med sig av sin kunskap och erfarenheter och vi jobbar aktivt med kompetensspridning. Vår webb bygger på Linux, java, mikrotjänster och containers. Vi utvecklar ständigt våra arbetssätt och försöker ta till oss av den senaste tekniken. I närtid kommer vi att bl.a. arbeta med att flytta över våra containers till våra nya Openshift-plattform. I dina dagliga arbetsuppgifter ingår att delta proaktivt i utvecklingsarbetet för att säkerställa en stabil driftsmiljö och effektiv Continuous Delivery pipeline. Vidare kommer du att övervaka, felsöka och utföra installationer, samt ansvara för konfiguration och integration mot bakomliggande system.


Det här är några av de tekniker vi arbetar med:
* Red Hat Linux
* Java
* Springboot
* Docker / Openshift / Kubernetes
* Puppet / Ansible
* Bash / Python / Groovy
* Maven / GoCD / Jenkins / Nexus
* Git / Bitbucket /Jira
* Elastic Stack
* Nagios/Check_mk
* Big-IP
* AEM


Utbildning och erfarenhet
För att lyckas i rollen ska du ha:
* Arbetslivserfarenhet som gett dig en god kompetens inom Linux
* Arbetslivserfarenhet som gett dig en god kompetens inom programmering
* Goda kunskaper i tal och skrift i såväl svenska som engelska * Särskilt meriterande med arbetslivserfarenhet av ovan nämnda tekniker/system
* Särskilt meriterande med arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling eller automatiserad testning (gärna Java)
* Särskilt meriterande med arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta agilt, lean eller DevOps
* Särskilt meriterande med eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT


Egenskaper
För att trivas i rollen som DevOps Engineer / Linux systemadministratör hos oss är det viktigt att du som person har en god analytisk och problemlösande förmåga. Vidare ser vi att du är nyfiken, ansvarstagande och resultatorienterad. Självklart tycker du om att arbeta i team, har en god samarbetsförmåga och trivs med vårt klimat där kompetensspridning är en naturlig del i arbetet. Vi har stort fokus på vår kultur och hur vi tillsammans påverkar vår arbetsplats, du bör därför ha ett intresse och vilja att vara med på denna kulturresa. Vår kultur kan sammanfattas med tre ord: effektiva, kunniga och hjälpsamma. I urvalet kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.

title: Senior Embedded C++ Developer at Segula Technologies Sweden (Gteborg, Sweden)
description:
Do you want to be part of the automotive evolution?


If so, we are offering a dynamic workplace to you as a member of our Segula family.   


We are looking for a skilled Senior Embedded Software Developer to join the team at our prestigious automotive manufacturer in Gothenburg, Sweden. If you are experienced with embedded software development, automatic test development, embedded Linux, C++; please read on!


As an experienced Embedded Software Developer, your mission will be to contribute to the development of the next generation of vehicle telematics. The main product is an information system in the embedded environment that communicates with the rest of the vehicle systems, and with a back-office system. Product features are Fleet Management, Uptime services, and other connected applications.


Within the team an agile approach (Scrum) is applied and the team is working with continuous improvement. As a Senior Embedded Software Developer it is expected that you are proactive, creative, have excellent team work abilities and possess skills in in C ++ development, software architecture, subsystems verification (Robot Framework) as well as work with requirements. A team member is expected to take on all kinds of tasks from the backlog but each the team use to have deeper knowledge and interest in one of the competence domains.


Qualifications



  • 7-10 years’ experience in embedded software development

  • C ++, preferably C ++17

  • Embedded Linux

  • Automatic test development

  • Master’s degree in electronics / computer engineering or equivalent education

  • ISO 26262, CANalyzer and in vehicle network knowledge

  • Well spoken and written English

title: Python/Lambda Developer at PriceSenz (Los Angeles, CA)
description:
Design, implement and deliver code that meets specifications for complex software programs and systems
Lead architectural discussions and present technical recommendations.
Mentor and provide guidance to junior engineers Create technical documentation
Add/Modify new functionality to existing code
Assess and fix problematic code


Qualifications:
BS or equivalent in Computer Sciences or related degree
10+ years of experience with software engineering projects
5+ years of experience with designing service oriented and micro-services based application architecture and development practices such as Continuous integration, Continuous deployment 3+ years of hands-on experience with setting up and running AWS Production environments across multiple AZ's, multiple geographies, IAM roles, Route53, ELB's, VPC peering etc.
2+ years of experience with container platforms such as Docker, Kubernetes
2+ years of experience building end to end products using Serverless Architectures (AWS Lambda, API Gateway, GraphQL, Kinesis, etc.)
Experience in full life-cycle of software development or methodology using Agile Scrum/Kanban etc; requirements analysis, design, development, testing and implementation
AWS Certification is a plus.
Excellent communication and presentation skills

title: NLP Developer at Yaraku, Inc. (Shibuya City, Japan)
description:
Description


As a NLP Developer in Yaraku, you'll be working with a small but experienced team of developers. An Agile-Scrum methodology gives us flexibility and adaptability, which gives our devs more freedom in design and implementation. Our devs work independently and are responsible for all stages of development; from design to implementation to testing to deployment.


With your NLP experience, you would be expected to maintain and develop language-sensitive functions and micro-services used with our application. This can involve anything from researching and building models to integrating with the main application.


Skills


1. Professional experience in Web Development or Back-end Development
2. Working knowledge of Natural Language Processing (NLP), preferably with Python
3. Understanding of OOP design patterns.
4. Bachelor's degree in relevant field or 10-years Work Experience (for Visa purposes)


Pluses


5. Experience with NLP-driven applications is a plus
6. Experience with Laravel, Backbone.js and/or ReactJS is a plus.
7. Experience in distributed full-text search engines such as Elasticsearch or Solr is a plus.
8. Experience in server management and infrastructure is a plus.
9. Experience or knowledge of DevOps (Docker, Ansible etc) a strong plus.

title: Senior Voice Over IP Developer at Nexmo (London, UK)
description:
We are Nexmo. An emerging leader in the $100b+ cloud communication and telecom markets. Customers like Airbnb, Viber, Whatsapp, Snapchat, and many others depend on our communications platform to connect with their customers. As businesses continue to shift to a real-time, customer-centric communications model, we are experiencing a time of impressive growth.


We are now looking for a talented VOIP developer to join our team, in this position, you will work on major real-time communications applications that are using some of the latest technologies


Some of the opportunities and challenges are listed below, we invite you to apply if you have an interest in the following;



  • Challenging scaling and infrastructural requirements

  • Opportunities to develop applications from an idea to Production

  • Opportunities to engage and collaborate with Open Source communities

  • Learn, and teach, inside a dynamic and motivated Engineering team


Responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain the components of the SIP infrastructure

  • Ensure the SIP infrastructure meets the operational requirements

  • Develop tools to monitor and analyse audio quality in the SIP infrastructure

  • Assist in automation tasks (deployment, configuration, QA)

  • Assess requirements and discuss and estimate design solutions

  • Communicate clearly and in a timely fashion with all the relevant areas

  • Ensure the relevant source code repos are handled according to known good practices


Desired requirements for the ideal candidate:



  • 5+ years of relevant experience

  • Wide knowledge of Real Time Communication protocols and technologies (SIP, SDP, RTP, SRTP)

  • Deep knowledge of Linux systems, networking and tools

  • Experience developing and maintaining applications with real-time requirements (C, C++, Java, Python, Go are all desirable programming languages)

  • Understanding of security and authentication standard methodologies

  • Understanding of standard audio and video codecs, and common issues in media sessions

  • Experience with large VoIP production environments

  • Familiarity with Configuration Management and automation

  • Familiarity with WebRTC technologies

  • Familiarity with cloud-based infrastructures


Most weeks there is a new technical presentation by members of engineering on technology topics of the speaker’s choice, this is a great way to learn and also optionally contribute your own presentation.


Why Nexmo...our values!


Being disruptive, getting things done, and working with passion and integrity are the values that matter at Nexmo. We are on a mission to enable simplified communications between enterprises and their customers by empowering our employees. We strive for passion and integrity, both personally and professionally.


We have achieved significant growth by hiring exceptional people. We have big goals, and we want the people who join us to be self-confident, focused on customers and delivery, and who are structured and committed in their approach. We value those who will help us continue this spirit.


If this appeals to you then we encourage you to apply!


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Product Manager at SquadLocker (Warwick, RI)
description:
SquadLocker’s Product Management team is at the center of SquadLocker’s daily software operations and is tasked with guiding the success of our technical solutions. In this role, you will join the Engineering team to lead one or more pods that consists of Engineers, Product Designers and Testers. Additionally, you will work cross-functionally to collectively collaborate on goals, OKRs and our company-wide roadmap. Our team has a strong emphasis on aligned autonomy and culture of collaboration and thus we expect every member of the group to have a strong sense of ownership, not just for the assigned products and missions but for the overall company's success and the satisfaction of SquadLocker’s users and partners.


Qualified candidates must possess a unique blend of technical savvy and business know-how, strong agile and process skills and the commitment to make your product vision come to life. Additionally, you’ll have a deep knowledge of product and project management tools and techniques along with proven experience in people management and strategic planning. We’re looking for a strong critical thinker and problem solver who can articulate their ideas effectively and authoritatively.



Key Responsibilities:
As a Product Manager, you will:



  • Translate the company's vision into a thoughtfully prioritized, executable plan to get your products from MVP to 100x

  • Oversee product development and monitor trends that indicate the need for new products and services

  • Define and document product requirements and roadmaps for execution and sales

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with developers, designers, stakeholders, QA and other product teams to take ideas from concept to launch

  • Use an effective combination of research, data, and product intuition to make timely decisions

  • Understand deeply the "why" behind everything we do and instill that understanding across all levels of the organization

  • Serve as a communication hub and facilitate collaboration across teams and departments related to your products


Qualifications


We are looking for ambitious individuals with a history of high achievement and the desire to work in a fast-paced environment with peers who challenge them to be better. These are the qualifications:



  • At least 6 years of experience building and shipping technology products at scale; experience in start-up environment and with internal systems preferred

  • Expert communication skills, including the ability to persuade and inspire, a knack for breaking down complex technical concepts, and a proactive attitude towards knowledge sharing

  • A reputation of being the smartest person in the room, with the humility to realize you won't always be

  • A natural, deep curiosity that drives you to learn, investigate, and constantly ask why

  • Strong sense of ownership and a "whatever it takes" attitude towards getting stuff done

  • Boundless creativity when it comes to generating ideas, but an understanding that execution is what ultimately matters

  • Comfort with ambiguity, and an instinct for moving quickly

  • The inclination to get your hands dirty, from building mockups to help communicate your ideas to writing your own SQL to understand our data

  • A strong growth mindset, unwavering grit, and an appetite for being constantly pushed beyond your comfort zone

title: IOS Developer (Swift / GIT) at Hays (Orlando, FL)
description:
IOS Developer (Swift / GIT) - Contract - Orlando, FL - $60.00-$73.00/hr

Hays Specialist Recruitment is working in partnership with The Walt Disney Company to manage the recruitment of this position

The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.

When's the last time you walked by Chewbacca on your way in to the office? If the answer was "never," then this is the role for you! The Disney Guest Experience team is looking to add top level talent on highly-visible, highly confidential projects to help bolster upcoming enhancements to several of their Orlando theme parks.
