Working in a lean production environment with an extremely exciting development stack, you'll help contribute to experiences customers touch in the theme parks every single day - and you'll be able to see them using it out of your very desk window. If you're a progressive engineer looking to make the next step in your career, please apply!


Role Description
As a Sr. iOS Developer, you will work with a small team to develop new applications in Swift as well as some migration from Objective-C.
* Working on at least one large iOS software project.
* Delivered products across multiple releases.
* Apple Pay experience is a plus

Skills & Requirements
* Minimum of 5 years iOS application development experience.
* Strong experience with Swift.
* Experienced with multi-threaded apps.
* Experienced with all phases of the development life cycle.
* Experienced with GIT source control management.
* Ability to work independently.

title: Senior Blockchain Developer at BOTLabs GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
Senior Software Developer for a blockchain project


The development of KILT Protocol by BOTLabs is an essential component of the Web 3.0. We are looking for support with the further development of our blockchain-based protocol. As a senior in our team you’re working with proven specialists on a solution for data sovereignty on the internet. You work mainly on the backend of the system. You are responsible for the defnition and development of the system architecture together with our team. You take responsiblity for the further development of the system and work closely with the Tech Product Owner and the Project Lead. For this purpose we need your expertise, enthusiasm and passion for the new technologies in the world of blockchain. In cooperation with our software architects and scientists you’re contributing to make the internet a fairer and more democratic place.


Your tasks:



  • definition and implementation of system architecture

  • further development of the Blockchain runtime 

  • Integration of partner Frameworks / Blockchains / Parachains

  • Implementing brand-new research results (like Zero Knowledge Proofs, Token Curated Attersters)

  • implementation of frameworks and interfaces based on open standards and norms


Your profile:



  • strong computer science and development fundamentals: (MSc or PhD in Computer Science required)             


               - object-oriented design


              - functional programming


              - algorithm design


              - complexity analysis



  • min 5 years of experience


  • high expertise in at least two modern programming language




  • experience in designing software (scoping, planning, conception, design, implementation, testing, documentation, delivery, maintenance)



  • should produce reliable and maintainable code

  • should be able to find creative solutions to difficult problems

  • knowledge of best practices around the full software development life cycle, like coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing and devops

  • ability to mentor junior software developers

  • very good communication skills and experience in managing stakeholders


Nice to have:



  • interest in Polkadot

  • experience in the administration of Linux

  • knowledge in cryptographic processes and PKI


Furthermore, dominant components of your personality are: responsibility, autonomy, reliability as well as team spirit and commitment.


We offer:



  • a dynamic working environment with flexible working hours

  • work in an Open Source environment, where every work result will be released under an Open Source license

  • the opportunity to help shape the Web 3.0

  • the opportunity to become a highly sought-after blockchain expert

  • a young and enthusiastic team

  • a positive working atmosphere in the centre of Berlin (Wittenbergplatz)


We are an inclusive and diverse company and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of gender, race, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

title: Talent Pool at On The Beach (Manchester, UK)
description:
Interested in working at On the Beach?


We have careers across a range of Software Development roles across Frontend, Backend, Full-stack and Mobile.


Register your CV to join our Talent Pool and we'll be able to consider you for roles as and when they come up. 


We’ll keep your CV on file for a maximum of 12 months, after which point they’ll be deleted.

title: Engineering Manager, Infrastructure at Qualia Labs, Inc (San Francisco, CA)
description:
At Qualia, we are fundamentally transforming the way real estate professionals, lenders, and homebuyers manage real estate transactions, one of the nation’s largest industries. We are bringing together everyone involved in the closing process onto one shared, secure platform -- basically, we’re making buying a home in America easier, safer, cheaper, and less painful by moving the process online! Qualia was founded in 2015 by Forbes 30 Under 30 Award recipients Nate Baker, Joel Gottsegen and Lucas Hansen. The company is backed by top investors including 8VC, Bienville Capital, Menlo Ventures and Tiger Global and currently processes 15% of all US real estate transactions. Qualia is headquartered in San Francisco, CA and has offices in Austin, TX.


We are looking for a dynamic, entrepreneurial technical leader to build and grow our infrastructure team responsible for production and QA infrastructure, application security, CI/CD platform and tools, desktop and application support for our rapidly growing teams in San Francisco and Austin.


As a senior technical leader and an experienced people manager, you've been in the industry for a while and have a proven track record of success in building and scaling SRE and DevOps teams and cloud infrastructure for a rapidly growing business. You are comfortable balancing multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a high bar for yourself and your team. You've thrived in many different environments and realize that each team is unique.


YOUR DAY TO DAY



  • You will grow and manage our infrastructure team by attracting and mentoring high caliber engineers

  • You will own stability, scalability and performance of our production/QA and CI/CD infrastructure 

  • You will provide technical leadership to the infrastructure team as well as to the entire engineering organization in architecting and building a highly-scalable SaaS platform 

  • You will be responsible for the security of our entire portfolio of products and services 

  • You will build and manage application and desktop support team in San Francisco and Austin. 


YOUR BACKGROUND THAT LIKELY MAKES YOU A MATCH



  • BS/MS in Computer Science or in a relevant field of study

  • 7+ years of experience designing, troubleshooting and tuning large scale cloud systems 

  • 5+ years of technical leadership experience architecting and managing cloud infrastructure on AWS

  • 3+ years of experience building and managing SRE and DevOps teams in a high growth environment

  • Hands-on working experience with 


    • Container technology and container orchestration

    • NoSQL databases  

    • Monitoring tools 

    • CI/CD tools 

    • Application security 


  • Proficiency in a variety of programming languages 

  • A strong leader and a team player with excellent execution and  communication skills

  • Experience in fintech and with large scale enterprise SaaS deployments is a strong plus. 


WHY QUALIA



  • Our flat company structure empowers engineers to make product decisions.

  • We have a collaborative culture where engineers mentor each other.

  • Our team members take time to eat together and share conversations at our daily catered lunches.

  • We have a fantastic location in a sunny office in downtown San Francisco, easily commutable from anywhere in the Bay Area by BART and MUNI.

  • We offer generous compensation and benefits packages including medical, vision, and dental insurance and a flexible PTO policy.


ABOUT OUR ENGINEERING TEAM



  • Our engineering team demonstrates and values technical thought leadership. 

  • Qualia hosts the official Meteor Developer’s Night in our San Francisco HQ, which is the largest gathering of Meteor developers in the world. The event features talks on Meteor and Javascript development generally, often including talks from Qualia team members.

  • Qualia’s Head of Design, Jack Lukic, is the creator of Semantic UI, one of the most popular open-source design frameworks. Qualia engineers learn this framework, and design patterns more generally, directly from the creator of the framework our front end is built on! Very few companies can say that. 

  • As part of our focus on continual learning and development, a Qualia team member gives an educational talk on something they’re interested in every Thursday to the entire engineering and product team. Topics range from Kolmogorov complexity theory to the definition of art, to models of existential risk.

title: Software Engineer - Clearance Required - Multidisciplinary at BrainGu (Chantilly, VA)
description:
This software engineering position is embedded in a multidisciplinary team which creates solutions under tight time frames to support federal law enforcement operations. Composed of DevOps, Network Engineers, Systems Admin, Security Engineers, and Software Engineers, everyone works together without silos to get the job done. The ideal candidate will lean toward generalist and be willing to learn a little bit of all the roles to better participate. Prototype capabilities put together for specific operations will often be "enterprised" for use by a wider audience for future operations or common use cases. Because of this dynamic, the team experiences a mix of fast-paced prototyping and routine enterprise development work tempo depending on the week.


Required Competencies and Certifications



  • Active Secret or Top Secret Clearance, SCI eligible

  • Ability and willingness to travel to Chantilly, VA on a daily basis


    • Depending on operational needs, telecommute options may be authorized
      at the discretion of the Technical Lead and client approval.


  • Work well under pressure, can meet tight deadlines, and is committed to work as needed to complete time-sensitive tasks


    • During low ops tempo times, considerable flexibility in working hours
      is granted to balance the need for dedication to mission.


  • Ability to communicate complex topics to customers and peers verbally and in writing

  • Ability to understand and execute functional and technical specifications


Four Years of Experience in the Following:



  • Programming applications and systems in Python

  • Working with staged environments (ie. development, integration/testing and production)

  • Using agile methodologies (such as Scrum, Kanban, XP, or others)

  • Prototyping in a fast-paced environment with little input

  • Researching and tracking flaws with proven ability to use debuggers, log output, and other sources to troubleshoot, diagnose, and remediate bugs.

  • Usage of at least one NoSQL database engine (such as MongoDB, Couch, Cassandra, HBase, Neo4J, Redis, Memcached, or others)

  • Usage of at least one relational database technology (such as MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle. Postgres, IBM DB2, or others)

  • Building web applications using common technologies (such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AngularJS, or others)

  • Working with multiple operating systems (such as Windows, Linux, MacOS, or others)

  • Using at least one cloud computing platform (such as Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Compute Engine, or others)

  • Shell scripting to handle repetitive tasks (such as sh, ksh, bash: can be any of one (1) of these, but preferably all three (3))


Desired Competencies and Certifications



  • Familiarity with various serialization formats and/or data exchange methodologies (such as XML, JSON, AJAX, WebSockets, YAML, Protocol Buffers, Comet, or others)

  • Familiarity with other object-oriented languages (such as C#, C++, Objective-C, Ruby, or others)

  • Ability to write complex queries in SQL and/or NoSQL databases

  • Rudimentary understanding of networking for programming over HTTP and/or TCP calls

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science (or related) recommended, however not required

title: Senior Software Developer - Mobile - Hotels at Hopper (Montreal, QC, Canada)
description:
THE ROLE

A stellar opportunity to have massive impact: join the rapidly growing team at a company continually redefining how people travel.  As Senior Software Developer, you will be directly responsible for many of the innovative features we’ll be working on, whether collaborating with our outstanding design and product team or helping our data science group work on the bleeding-edge technology to personalize travel for our ever expanding population of members.


IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:


  • Build innovative consumer experiences, setting standards for code and performance

  • Create delightful user experiences in our app (iOS or Android)

  • Work in a complex dynamic environment with a rich API tier

  • Collaborate with a diverse group of people, giving and receiving feedback for growth

  • Execute on big opportunities, helping Hopper rise to the top of the travel industry


A PERFECT CANDIDATE HAS:


  • Thrived in mobile technologies and delivered delightful user experience at scale

  • The ability to bring leading industry techniques and technologies to the table

  • Experience mentoring and leading people at different stages in their career

  • Excelled in cross-functional teams, working fluidly with Product Managers, Data Scientists, Mobile Developers, and other highly skilled specialists

  • A passionate focus on quality, writing testable code that performs well for our consumers

title: Small Talk Developer at CCK Financial Solutions Pty Ltd (Perth, Australia)
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW


CCK has over 35 years of specialization in treasury and capital markets, with extensive expertise in treasury system design, development, implementation, consultancy and support services. Under our assistance, the clients have significantly grown their treasury operations and profits, winning many honors in the industry. Our clients cover central banks, state-owned banks, multinational banks, commercial banks, investment banks, government institutions, trusts and corporations.


The Head Office of CCK is located in Perth Australia.  The registered address is Level 1, 133 St. George’s Terrace, Perth, WA, 6000 AUSTRALIA.  The development team is located in this office.  This office also provides implementation, consultancy and support services to our clients.


CCK has branch and subsidiary offices in Sydney Australia, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, Manila, Philippines, and Shanghai, China.  These offices provide implementation, consultancy and support services to our clients. 


PRODUCT OVERVIEW


Guava is an integrated treasury management system which covers the front office, middle office and back office of a treasury or capital markets operation. For the front office, Guava Dealer is a tool for the dealer to price generic and non-generic products and capture transactions. Guava Dealer provides the dealer with decision support tools to better understand the portfolio performance. 


For the middle office, Guava Risk is a complete financial risk management solution covering market risk, credit risk and operations risk.


For the back office, Guava Ops effectively manages all treasury processes from deal capture to settlements, accounting and interfacing


 The system is modular, and can be separated into a front and middle office application and a back office application running independently, interfacing with other systems.


SOFTWARE DEVELOPER POSITION


 We are seeking a software developer to join our Guava Ops team.


 The position is located in CCK’s Head Office in Perth Australia


 Essential Skills


Minimum of 4 years’ experience with Visual Works Smalltalk


Gemstone OO database


OO development skills


Experience in business analysis, software design, development and maintenance


The candidate will require relevant tertiary qualifications and the following personal traits



  • Enjoys challenges

  • Motivated

  • Quick learner

  • Enjoys problem solving

title: Digital Technology Engineer - Devices at IKEA (Vintrie, Sweden)
description:
WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU


As a person you are passionate about technology and innovation and about delivery of high quality software. You are motivated to work agile and being open to the change and come up with innovative ways of working. Working both independently and interdependently with engineering network and cross functions get you energized and you share and live the IKEA culture and values.

You will work in product teams focusing on providing world class products through a modern workplace experience enabling co-workers productivity.



You will have experience within several of the competences listed below:



  • Modern Device management with technologies as Intune, Airwatch, JAMF, Google

  • Identity Management (Multi Factor Authentication, Authorisation, Single Sign On) within Azure, Google

  • Working with Personas

  • Device technologies as Apple, Samsung, Dell and other enterprise vendors

  • Support through self service, self Healing

  • Corporate Enterprise App store as well as public app stores in corporate context (App Store, Google play)

  • Beyond normal user of M365 suite



You have knowledge in following areas:



  • operations engineering practices, with knowledge and experience of using industry standard toolsets

  • working in agile/iterative teams, with an emphasis on self-organisation and delivery to agreed commitments

  • dependent services (in workplace context-onboard/support/offboard) connected to co-worker through the lifecycle

  • agile development practices, in which requirements and solutions evolve through the collaborative effort of self-organizing cross-functional teams

  • IKEAs corporate identity, core values and vision of creating a better everyday life for the many people



Besides being able to collaborate with others (incl. virtual) to achieve goals you have the ability to acquire new knowledge and skills and leverages new methods, digital systems and processes to improve performance and to develop high quality code using and applying good practices. Agile working and continuous improvement within the software engineering function is another one of your talents as well as to change direction as appropriate based on new ideas, approaches, and strategies, with senior guidance.


A DAY IN YOUR LIFE WITH US


In this role you will work in a high skilled engineering team with best practices combining enterprise design with local enablement with high quality digital enablement throughout the lifecycle of the products across the Group Digital.



  • You are expected to stay up-to-date with current industry standards in order to help developing the product offers in this area towards future needs.

  • In Devices & Touchpoint product area, we enable a User Centric Experience on devices with easy access to apps/files/knowledge to selfserve. We are securing corporate compliance for our endpoints where device flora contains mobiles, tablets, laptops, industrial handhelds, forklift terminals, digital signage.

  • Cloud managed devices is where we are heading and putting user experience in focus for everything we do.



You will:



  • be in close collaboration with other areas and functions in INGKA, focusing on how to ensure the best experience for our colleagues

  • support maintaining, upgrading, optimising and ensuring maximum uptime of digital products

  • own the responsibility of securing value and run of the digital products you help build

  • participate in the implementation of new system and infrastructure projects

  • help ensure that systems monitoring setup is robust and properly structured

  • assist the various Platform Teams with tasks that require optimisation/modifications to the current infrastructure

  • help integrating, developing and maintaining the right toolsets required for running a specific system

  • apply and adhere to good practice digital operations engineering practices within an agile/iterative development approach

  • provide support and guidance as needed to other engineers within the development team encouraging good practices

  • work across initiatives within INGKA Group, helping to steer towards data-driven solutions


We set the digital agenda to keep IKEA leading in an uncertain and fast moving environment. We drive the development, provision and operation of our digital products and services through the use of new and existing technology and agile delivery methods to deliver at pace.

At the same time, we provide a home for digital skills to both develop and extend the technical, people and business skills needed to ensure continuous development and growth of our digital capability.


We are looking forward to receiving your application, but no later than the 15th of January. As we will have interviews on a continuous basis the position might be closed sooner.

title: PRODUCT ENGINEERING MANAGER (HEAD OF ENGINEERING)  INVENTORY & LOGISTICS OPERAT at IKEA (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Why should you join IKEA?


Hej! My name is Ben and I am privileged to lead the Fulfilment, Logistics & Inventory management engineering teams at IKEA. I thought I would share why I joined IKEA and why I hope you want to join as well:



  • Our culture and values - Humbleness and willpower / Lead by example / Different with a meaning / Constant desire to renew and improve / Togetherness and enthusiasm / Give and take responsibility / Simplicity / Cost-consciousness /

  • Our vision to help more of the many people to have an affordable and better everyday life at home and be more convenient to where they are? At the same time, become truly people and planet positive?

  • We are inspired by our past and are confident about who we are and why we do what we do. For sure, some of our assets are forever strengths – our vision, business idea, culture and values, our unique offer and our unique ways of meeting customers.

  • At the same time we need to undertake the challenge of transforming such a global iconic brand is breath taking – You can read about INGKA’s ‘10 jobs in 3 years’ https://www.ingka.com/what-we-do/ikea-retail/ , 5 of them are underpinned by the amazing work we will do in Fulfilment, Logistics & Inventory Management. To manage this our CEO Jesper Brodin underlines we need to “Change everything (almost!). Going forward, retail will be a mix of digital and physical with excellence in logistics.

  • Our DNA is ‘Testing & Learning’, marries with my belief of the power of agile product focus.

  • Our strong belief that diversity in teams delivers better thought through outcomes. We have a high focus on diversity. One example of this is that we have 50% male/female managers within IKEA and the commitment is to have this in every part of the organisation.

  • The flexible work life balance. My manager Susan (CTO) has consistently ensured that my role doesn’t interfere with having a great quality of life out of work – she knows when people are happy, they do their best work.

  • The incredible people I have met very humble, supportive and absolutely committed to lead home-furnishing retail into the future and create a better life for more of the many people, by putting the customer at the heart of all we do.


What is the amazing opportunity?


As ‘Head of engineering for ‘Fulfilment locations’ reporting to me, you will have the exciting challenge to:



  • Build and run the technology that underpins our global 40 Billion Euro business:

    • in 377 stores. The technology has accountability for all processes other than point of sale! Inbound, outbound, put away, picking, packing, dispatch, Click & Collect, automation control, building inventory and location mgt.

    • in 40+ fulfilment centers that currently fulfil circa 10 % (and growing) of all customer sales



  • Create a new IKEA, by building the capability to use all locations as part of the fulfilment network

  • Unlocking our plans to:

    • Build new engaging city store formats providing convenience to our customers.

    • Contribute to our sustainability goals by offering customers the ability to recycle and rent/subscribe IKEA products.

    • Simplify and automate flows to meet our cost-conscious objectives thus providing IKEA products to the many at a sustainable cost.



  • Transform the current landscape into a modern technology stack which will:

    • enable us to test and learn quickly to meet our customers’ demands &

    • provide a highly available, resilient & secure service.



  • Collaborate on implementing a right balance of automation/robotics and co-worker resource to meet our customer’s needs.

  • Manage teams and collaborate with stakeholders in our global development hubs.


We are big believers in enabling our leaders to act with autonomy and as such you would lead on the technical decisions of how you want to build and implement your products.


The home office for this role will be Amsterdam, there will be travel globally to meet you’re your stakeholders, teams and partners We believe a healthy and flexible life balance is important, so together we will strive to create an work environment where you feel in control of your life balance, can be yourself, grow and excel in both your personal and professional life.


What would we ask from you?



  • To have a relentless passion for meeting the customer promise and motivating engineering teams to be outcome focused and innovate/learn to solve challenges.

  • To be able to build leadership and engineering teams at pace.

  • That you are passionate about our vison values - Values like togetherness, simplicity and lead by example are all a natural part of your everyday working life at IKEA. As a person you have great willpower and the ability to create enthusiasm around you, to dare challenge conventions and make mistakes.

  • To have strong interdependent leadership skills, and that you are inclusive and humble.

  • To Inspire your engineering leaders and teams to build the highest standard of software that builds confidence with our stakeholders, operations and customers due to its excellence in agility and resilience.

  • To create a one team atmosphere between all co-workers in engineering, product, data science, business development, operations etc.

  • To be resilient and empathetic in the face of the challenge of doing heart surgery on the IKEA business – transforming our current landscape into something for the next evolution of IKEA.

  • To enjoy collaborating with fulfilment operations and operations development teams and be up for finding the right agile product approach for a specific challenge.

  • To enjoy building your teams with a DevOps mentality to develop new, scalable, enterprise technology, able to run our global operations 24/7.

  • To bring your whole self to work and have fun building a better everyday life for the many.

title: Senior Developer, Cloud Compliance at SAP (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
description:
Requisition ID: 242996
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time

#CloudJobsYVR

COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

The Global Technology Legal Compliance (GTLC) team is looking for a talented senior web developer to join CCI project and help design, implement, maintain and evolve our automation solution for SAP Corporate Intellectual Property (IP) Compliance governance. Our ideal candidate is a collaborative, pragmatic self-starter who excels at critical thinking, learning, coaching, and executing in a fast-paced environment. You thrive on positive interactions with team members and believe that growing as a team is the sustainable model.

You will contribute to all aspects of the software development lifecycle including component design, development, documentation, testing and operational support in our CCI project. You have strong verbal and written communication skills, are self-driven, and can deliver high quality results in a fast-paced environment. As a member of GTLC Development team, you will help build the future of our IP compliance automation landscape. You will deliver elegant designs, robust feature implementation, maintainable code and intuitive user experience that make it easy for SAP teams worldwide to fulfill our Corporate IP Compliance requirements.

You are either an expert in full stack development, or primarily focusing on web frontend development or backend development but have a strong interest to grow into a full stack developer. You have Can-Do attitude and top-notch cloud native solution building skills. You are obsessed with customer satisfaction and have demonstrated strong passion in leveraging cutting-edge technologies to build beautiful cloud native products. You dive into complex requirements then succinctly and accurately translate them into technical requirements and come up with robust solution and implementation. Most importantly, you have a passion for learning, sharing, and are driven to be the best at what you do.

Qualifications

  • Skill set for web frontend development applicants
  • Strong experience in sleek and responsive UI design and development.
  • Expert knowledge in at least one JavaScript/TypeScript frameworks preferably React and Angular 6+.
  • Skill set for backend development applicants
  • Strong experience in OOP, REST architecture and development, microservices design, implementation and troubleshooting.
  • Good knowledge in at least one of Python frameworks preferably Flask, Django.
  • Expert experience in at least one of Java web frameworks preferably Grails, Spring, JPA/Hibernate.
  • Strong knowledge in at least one relationship database and one NoSQL database, preferably HANA, MSSQL, Postgres, MongoDB, Redis, and Neo4j.

Qualifications for all applicants

  • Bachelor’s Degree or above in Computer Science or related field.
  • 7+ years professional work experience in enterprise cloud native application development.
  • Working experience with agile development methodology, especially scrum.
  • Proficiency with Linux systems.
  • Working experience in Docker, Kubernetes, DevOps.
  • Working knowledge in applying Machine Learning algorithms into production system is highly desirable.
  • Experience in BI reporting in SAP BI platform, data modeling, dashboard solutions is a plus.
  • Experience in compliance products of Synopsys Blackduck HUB, Blackduck Protex/CodeCenter, Whitesource, Flexera BDNA, nextB, ClearlyDefined, Software360 is a plus.
  • Ability to think critically and arrive at elegant solutions to challenging problems.
  • Excellent communication skills and able to actively participate in team discussions, knowing when to contribute, when to listen, and when to ask questions.
  • Experience working with business teams to transform business requirements into functioning software.
  • Experience in designing, building and maintaining real-time median to large scale distributed solutions.
  • Proven track record delivering high-quality, on-time, in-budget, elegant and scalable solutions.
  • #SOF2020

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If youre searching for a company thats dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.comorCareers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ:Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA:Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations:

title: Software Engineer, iOS at Mercari (Tokyo, Japan)
description:
Job Description


As an iOS engineer, you will work to promote Mercari’s business and maximize project output.


Mercari has been downloaded about 75 million times in Japan and has about 10.75 million monthly users. Mercari’s mobile team is currently working on a major re-architecture of the iOS/Android apps in order to create a structure where they can conduct further large-scale development while maintaining speed and security. The team is also working on various other projects, such as developing new features and improving the UX.


Mobile engineers at Mercari come from many different countries; we hope to unlock the potential of this diverse team in order to make even greater achievements.


Details



  • Improving Mercari’s UI/UX

  • Improving quality with a focus on stability and performance

  • Continuous improvement of the codebase, including the major re-architecture

  • Handling updates for the iOS app

  • Developing new services and linking them with other services


REQUIREMENTS


Minimum Requirements



  • Experience developing native iOS apps

  • Extensive knowledge in object-oriented software development, MVVM / MVP architecture, multithreading, networking and memory management.

  • Experience with continuous improvement of codebases and large-scale team development

  • Knowledge of UIKit, standard iOS libraries, and frameworks

  • Understanding of UI development

  • Experience with/understanding of reactive programming

  • Software development experience with Swift at work


Preferred



  • Experience background in any of the following is a plus: Product Design, UI/UX design, Backend/Fullstack engineering.

  • Experience managing a team of 3 or more members

  • Experience developing and operating native apps with large user bases

  • Experience independently planning, developing, and operating apps

  • Knowledge of performance optimization

  • Experience training junior members

  • Ability to gather the team’s consensus and make decisions when selecting technology for large-scale development

  • Experience communicating with the business side to decide technical approaches to implement ideas


Languages and technologies we use



  • Software development: Swift and Objective C

  • Network transport: Protocol Buffers and JSON

  • Dependency manager: Cocoapods, Carthage

  • CI/CD: CircleCI, fastlane


Interview Process



  • Resume Screening

  • Take-home skill test on GitHub (deadline: one week)

  • Technical Interviews

  • Interviews ( 2-3 rounds)

  • Offer

title: Database Administrator at SHIELD (Singapore)
description:
What to Expect
As a Database Administrator, you will be responsible for designing and maintaining
database systems. You will be the gatekeeper of all data traffic in the organization.
Working individually and as a team, you should be expected to work with an Agile
mindset to participate in project deliverables. We are looking for reliable, trustable
and talented Database Administrators who are proactive in their line of work and
have the drive to step out of their comfort zones and find new ways to manage data
systems more efficiently.



What a Database Administrator Does in SHIELD
Design and maintain relational and non-relational database system to meet
project demand
Research to optimize database query and performance
Work with developers to reduce resource consumption and shorten
request latency
Ensure the highest level of database systems and infrastructure availability
Design backup and recovery process for data and servers
Test and evaluate the system regularly to ensure the highest level of data
security, privacy and integrity
Monitor database performance and perform regular server maintenance
through applying patches and versioning when required
Analyse and identify capacity related issues in systems and applications
Troubleshoot any database related issue



What You Need
Minimum Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Minimum 3 years of experience as a Database Administrator or Database
related roles
Minimum 2 years of AWS experience in administration and performance
tuning of Linux based application stacks
Experience in PHP, MySQL and NoSQL
Experience in working with other Cloud Service Providers; Azure or GCP is
a plus
AWS certification will be an added advantage
Knowledge of all-things networking such as SSH, DNS, SSL/TLS, TCP/IP
Ability to dive into system logs, identify and resolve faults and issues
Experience of data backup, recovery and security


Prior experience in e-payments or e-commerce industry is a plus


What We Offer
Competitive remuneration package
Gym, Shower and VR/chillax room
Fully stocked pantry with coconut water, coffee and ice cream
Medical insurance and Food & Transport claims
The SHIELD Culture
Open and collaborative working environment with a diverse and
international team
Flexible work hours
Casual dress code
Weekly Get-Together to unwind and bond



Be part of the powerful team behind SHIELD’s powerful technology. Send your
resume to techhr@shield.com now!

title: Senior Rust WebGL Developer at Luna (Krakw, Poland) (allows remote)
description:
Senior Graphics Developer


Luna is looking for a senior graphics developer to take charge of the design, development, and evolution of a new WebGL-based GUI for Luna, a project said by Singularity University to have the potential to change the lives of one-billion people. If you bring strong technical skills and a passion for performance, this could be the role for you.


As a senior graphics developer you'll be a key part of bringing the vision for Luna 2.0 into reality, with your work being integral to the realisation of the next iteration of Luna. You'll be able to collaborate with world-class team of skilled engineers, community managers, and business developers (from Bloomberg, PayPal, and GitHub to name a few), and make your indelible mark on the future of Luna.


What You'll Do


As a senior graphics developer, you'll be responsible for designing and building a high-performance renderer based on web technologies for use in the Luna IDE: Luna Studio. This will involve:



  • Working closely with stakeholders and customers to design the new GUI for Luna Studio.

  • Developing a design for the new renderer that will be used to implement this GUI.

  • Implementing the new renderer in a high-performance manner on top of WebGL and Rust (via Web Assembly).

  • Building a next-generation UI framework using this renderer for use in Luna Studio.

  • Using this UI framework to build the new GUI for Luna Studio itself.

  • Debug performance issues to ensure that the renderer is capable of achieving high performance even on low-powered hardware.

  • Creating visualisations for data science libraries using the renderer and D3.js.


The Skills We're Looking For


We have a few particular skills that we're looking for in this role:



  • A strong focus on both user experience and aesthetics.

  • 3+ years experience with WebGL (or OpenGL).

  • A deep understanding of graphics abstractions including: VAOs, FBOs, PBOs, buffer types, and asynchronous computation modes.

  • A deep understanding of GPU techniques including: efficient buffer management, efficient GLSL construction, high-performance vector and font rendering, post-processing, 3D scene description (with nested objects), lights, cameras, and animation.

  • 2+ years experience with Rust, including experience writing unsafe code for FFI and performance, and using the macro system for metaprogramming. You should be able to write idiomatic rust code.

  • Practical experience building high-performance graphical interfaces for end-user-facing applications.


As part of the hiring process for this job posting we're very interested in your previous work in these areas. Please link us to your Rust projects, blog posts and shadertoy shaders if you have them! It's important for us to understand your experience at the start of the hiring process.


It would be a big bonus if you had:



  • Experience with Rust's WASM toolchain, with wasm-bindgen, and experience with WASM itself.

  • Experience with visual programming systems such as Houdini, Max/MSP, Lab VIEW, or Touch Designer.

  • Knowledge of the runtime and memory models used by various JavaScript virtual machines.

  • Knowledge of D3.js, and experience using it to visualise data.


Avoid the confidence gap. You don't have to match all of the skills above to apply!


Who You'll Work With


You'll be joining a distributed, multi-disciplinary team that includes people with skills spanning from compiler development to data-science. Though you'll have your area to work on, our internal culture is one of collaboration and communication, and input is always welcomed.


We firmly believe that only by working together, rather than putting our team members in their own boxes, can we create the best version of Luna that can be.


The Details


As part of the Luna team you'd be able to work from anywhere, whether that be at home, or on the go! We have team members distributed across the world, from San Francisco, to London, to Kraków. We welcome remote work and flexible schedules, or you can work from the Kraków office (or our planned SF office) if you'd like. We can provide competitive compensation and holiday, as well as the possibility of equity as time goes on.


How To Apply?


Send us an email at jobs@luna-lang.org, and tell us a little bit about yourself and why you think you'd be a good fit for the role! You can also tell us about:



  • Some of your past work or projects.

  • Why you'd like to work on Luna, and where you imagine Luna being in 5 years.

  • The most important features of a team that you'd like to work in.

  • Whether you take pride in your ability to communicate clearly and efficiently with your team.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f/d)   in Munich at DataGuard (Mnchen, Germany)
description:
You like to explore production systems, looking for bottlenecks and weaknesses? You also have a deep understanding of the services that run on these systems and enjoy coming up with professional solutions that improve performance, security, stability? Talk to us and become part of our team!


DataGuard: Young and dynamic company in the heart of Munich.


We are a rapidly growing legal tech company. Our declared goal is to become the number 1 in legal technology. We also see DataGuard as a future category leader in data protection. We are one of the leading providers of external data protection officers and already serve a four-digit number of small and medium-sized companies in over 400 cities throughout Germany. We offer our customers a unique mix of personal consulting and an intelligent web platform that automates many processes.



  • Team: Almost 100 employees - we continue to recruit and grow rapidly. Fully qualified lawyers, IT security experts, business economists and engineers. Founders and Managing Directors with years of experience in companies such as Freshfields, IBM, PwC and Goldman Sachs.

  • Benefits: Steep learning curve and almost unlimited development potential. Flat hierarchies and a lot of responsibility. Beyond that: Fresh fruits, snacks and team events.

  • Culture: Positive, respectful, casual - and highly professional. Excellent team cohesion, diversity and personal esteem come first. Commitment, ownership and the unrestrained will to push the company forward with us are crucial.


Your duties?


As a Senior DevOps Engineer you will be responsible for the availability, security, scalability and health of our systems. When incidents occur, you know how to handle them. You will also work closely with the Dev Team to coordinate releases, improve the CI Pipeline and squash performance issues. You have considerable experience operating complex systems. Besides our onboarding, which you will going through, you are going to be all full member of the team from your first day on.


Your profile: convinces us - and our customers.



  • You have already led a DevOps team by yourself or you’ve been accountable for specific topics within a team of DevOps engineers.

  • You’re having a pragmatic way of solving problems and you are always outcome oriented.

  • You are proficient in the following technologies Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, Nginx, Redis, Continuous Integration, High Availability and Ansible.

  • It would be also a benefit if you’re having a certain knowledge in Ruby On Rails, Ceph, Grafana, EFK, Elastic Search and Gitlab.

  • On top you are proficient in speaking English. German is not a must but a nice-to-have.

  • Last but not least you are full of enthusiam for automation and scaling systems.

title: Senior Cloud Architect / Engineer (Dockerizing) at Hays (Reston, VA)
description:
Senior Cloud Architect / Engineer (Dockerizing) - Perm - Reston, VA - $130,000-$150,000

Hays Specialist Recruitment is working in partnership with Jellyfish to manage the recruitment of this position.

The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.

Jellyfish delivers digital marketing solutions across the world for a host of impressive brands from their offices in the US, Europe, and South Africa. The agency's award-winning combination of technology and talent help it to deliver paid media, UX, SEO, social media, analytics, optimization, creative and development solutions. They partner with Google as their only technology reseller and official training partner across the US and EMEA.

10% annual bonus, paid for training/certifications (such as the GCP certification), flexible working hours

Role Description

Skills & Requirements
* Develop solutions architecture and evaluate multiple alternatives for different cloud models and services
* Understand microservice architecture
* Understand performance enhancement technologies ( CDN, Caching, etc )

title: C++ Software Engineer at Wolverine Trading (Chicago, IL)
description:
Wolverine is seeking passionate C++ programmers who are not satisfied with solutions that are good enough and who have a drive to push the envelope of what is technically possible. Our ideal candidate excels at both collaborating with technical and business subject matter experts to identify and implement new trading strategies, while also debugging and fixing mission critical problems.  This is a hands-on position spanning the entire development stack of our bleeding edge ultra-low latency trading systems from idea generation all the way to support. If you are excited about finance, have a passion for technology, and a drive to learn, then we want to talk to you!


 What You’ll Do



  • Perform full life cycle development and deployment of C++ applications and libraries for exchange gateways, trading strategy execution, risk management and trade reporting

  • Develop systems to maintain, analyze and improve performance, integrity and reliability of existing applications

  • Investigate and fix problems with production systems in real-time

  • Construct experiments and analyze data to identify ways to improve technical performance and new trading opportunities, ensuring that results are valid and reproducible

  • Collaborate with technical and business peers to develop new trading strategies and systems

  • Communicate technical knowledge to both technical and non-technical audiences


 Skills You’ll Need



  • Top-notch C/C++ coding skills, with a solid foundation in data structures

  • Excitement for developing and dedication to testing

  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills

  • Passion for writing clean high quality code and the ability to provide, and take, code review feedback

  • Willingness to collaborate and learn from other team members

  • Ability to take ownership over projects and be self-directed on what needs to happen next

  • Strong communication skills with both engineers and people without a technical background

  • Experience with SQL database, mutli-thread programming, STL & Boost

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or equivalent.

title: Technical Project Manager at Sharp Notions LLC (Fairport, NY)
description:
Who We Are Seeking


As a Technical Project Manager, you will facilitate the product delivery process across one or more teams. Ultimately your work helps us figure out when we can deliver software projects. Do you love collaborating with product managers, engineering managers, engineers, and designers to help them work more effectively by using your technical background? We'd love to hear from you. 


Challenges on which you can expect to work:


Delivery Process


Working closely with Engineering, Product, and Design to define an efficient software delivery process to improve delivery speed without sacrificing communication and team effectiveness. Things change over time. You are able to put in place just the right amount of process for each situation. You will measure the health of each project as it progresses. This measurement will be used to predict delivery estimates and uncover opportunities or risks; Collaborate with engineers to define, measure, and improve software quality metrics; Craft and maintain JIRA boards to track project progress and provide status to team members; Monitor projects and estimate the probability that it will complete successfully on or before the target; Identify anything that reduces or increases the probability of successful completion; Facilitate process meetings such as stand-ups, planning, and retrospectives; Facilitate technical discussions to foster teamwork and gain insights into project risk/scope.


Communication


You will be called upon to regularly communicate with all members of the delivery team. You will work with the Engineering Manager and Product Manager to plan what the team will deliver and the timeline for that delivery. As projects proceed you will communicate status and raise a flag if things are going off-track. You are responsible for communicating status throughout the product development process. You will find the most effective channels and frequency of communication. Send regular progress updates to team leads; Actively communicate roadblocks or significant delays in estimated delivery


Team Effectiveness


You are a central component of your delivery teams. You should present a level-headed, objective perspective to balance the often opposing needs of Product and Engineering. In addition, your voice will be the most influential in suggesting improvements to the way we work. You act as a coach to the team looking for ways members can be more effective. Identify and quickly resolve blockers and assess technical risks; Help the team prioritize work; Coach, mentor, and foster a positive/collaborative team environment.


A Little About You:



  • 3+ years of technical project management experience.

  • Training as an Agile coach or Certified Scrum Master preferred.

  • 3+ years of professional software development experience.

  • Clear, concise written and verbal communication.

  • You thrive in a highly independent work culture and are capable of working autonomously.

  • You have the initiative and motivation to make things happen.

  • You always want to sit next to the person who is smarter than you because you value a culture of mentorship and learning.

  • You are egoless, hold yourself accountable and you have a thoughtful approach to adopting new technology.

  • You are looking to bring your voice and talent to a mission-driven company in ways that help it to grow and expand its reach.


What We Can Offer You



  • Competitive salary

  • Generous PTO

  • Flexible schedule and work/life balance

  • Company-paid health, dental, and vision insurance

  • Office snacks 

  • Team building events and activities

  • Retirement Match


Personal



  • Independent, self-motivated

  • Fluent in English, written and spoken

  • Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal skills

  • Proven track record of always learning and growing

  • Authorized to work in the U.S. - No sponsorship opportunities at this time.

  • Proactive attitude

  • Desire to be remarkable

title: Principal Software Developer - Genome Assembly and Analysis at Wellcome Sanger Institute (Hinxton, UK)
description:
About the Programme:


The Sanger Institute, along with other partners, has launched the Darwin Tree of Life project to provide high-quality genome assemblies for all eukaryotic species in the Atlantic Archipelago of Britain and Ireland. This project will significantly contribute to the goals of the global Earth Biogenome Project, fundamentally changing scientific knowledge of evolution and interactions among millions of the planet’s organisms.


About the Team:


We are building a software development team who will design, build, install and maintain a series of high throughput pipelines for genome assembly and analysis. These pipelines will sit at the heart of the Tree of Life programme and be used extensively by the Sanger Institute and other scientists.


 About the Role:


We are seeking both a Principal Software Developer to contribute to building and optimising the computational infrastructure required to scale genome assembly within this project, streamlining the processing of terabytes of raw data. This will build on Sanger's world-class computational resources, including an OpenStack private cloud environment, a 15,000+ core computational cluster and many petabytes of high-speed distributed file systems and object stores.


 About You:


Team members will be expected to work independently at a technical level, while collaborating closely with colleagues on systems development, and to be comfortable communicating directly with scientific researchers regarding analysis requirements. Recent graduates are also encouraged to apply, although it is strongly desirable that any candidate has substantial development experience outside of coursework (e.g. work experience, participation in open source projects). Bioinformatic/biological knowledge is not essential for this role, but an interest in the science on campus and desire to learn bioinformatic concepts is important.


Essential Skills



  • Degree in computer science, software engineering or comparable experience

  • Demonstrable experience in software development, preferably in a scientific environment

  • Knowledge of core computer science concepts and practices

  • Experience with git and GitHub

  • Expert knowledge of unix based operating systems, libraries and tools

  • Familiarity with cloud environments and technologies ( for example, OpenStack, GCP, AWS, Terraform, Kubernetes, Ansible)

  • Experience of working in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders


Ideal Skills



  • Experience in bioinformatics analysis and tools

  • Experience with relational and non-relational databases

  • Experience with high performance computing environments (e.g. LSF/Slurm)

  • Expertise in Management and Analysis of large data sets.

  • Line Management experience


Other information


Closing Date: 2nd April 2020


This is a 3 year Fixed Term position.


Please apply with your CV and Cover Letter.

title: Software Development Engineer in Test at Pie Insurance Holdings, Inc. (Denver, CO)
description:
Software Development Engineer in Test - (SDET)



DENVER, CO
ENGINEERING
FULL-TIME 







Your Mission

Establish Pie as the preeminent commercial insurance among small business owners by establishing a best in class quality automation process. You’ll be joining Pie at an exciting time as we were recently named to DC Inno’s 50 on Fire.

How You’ll Do It

As our second software engineer in quality, you’ll be an instrumental member of Pie’s growing Engineering team. You will own and build quality solutions to support our large-scale backend systems and microservices. You will use automation to consistently test code and get it ready for production. Cross-functional partnership will also be an instrumental in this position. You will work with various teams to understand testing requirements and then execute these tests using automation.

Pie is moving very fast, and we need someone who is willing to move with us.  You will create/enhance a test automation framework and on a daily basis will utilize your critical thinking. 

The Day to Day
·      Create and enhance our current test automation framework in Selenium
·      Test automation in RESTful API’s and a React.js frontend
·      Work with various teams to provide a quality-on-demand solution.
·      Manage various priorities and not be afraid when priorities change.
·      Work fast, but have an attention to detail so key pieces are not missed

Whether It’s Right For You
You will be joining our team in downtown Denver, specifically LoDo within walking distance from Union Station. Everything we do is connected, but we each have different roles. That means we need you to love what you do and have a passion for quality. We are a start-up. All hands and minds are needed. 

Our team is looking for an experienced software engineer in quality.  We expect you’ll have spent at least 5 years as a quality engineer, with a very strong OOD background. Of course, you’ll also need certain skills and abilities to do the work



The Right Stuff




    • Adaptable: No other phrase describes a startup like chaotic change. You have to thrive in it, love it, and adapt as needed.

    • Required Experience: Heavy experience in software engineering / development in an object oriented environment.

    • Tech Experience: 5+years’ experience as an engineer with a focus in quality/testing. You will need to have strong engineering experience and be able to produce production ready code.

    • Preferred Tech Skills: Selenium or similar, .NET, Java, Python, RESTful API, React, JavaScript and/or ECMAScript, Puppeteer, Docker

    • Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field preferred. Equivalent year of experience is accepted.

    • Raise Our Game: Execute on your ideas and recommendations to position the team, and yourself, for exponential growth.

    • Learning Mentality: Desire to quickly understand Pie’s platform, architecture, and integrations with 3rd party vendors. 







Working at Pie




    • You expect to challenge others and to be challenged.

    • Your communication style is candid and compassionate.

    • You share your knowledge.  We aren’t here to compete with one another; we are in it to win it, together.

    • You share our passion for the small business community. 






Why Pie
We're building Pie for the next generation of small businesses. Our team is on a mission to make workers’ compensation less expensive, simpler, and more transparent. Easy as pie, in fact.

Founded in 2017, Pie is a fast-growing insurtech startup with home offices in Washington, DC, and Denver, CO. Pie offers an incredible career opportunity where you can use your expertise to disrupt an industry and serve the SMB community. Invest your time doing meaningful work in a fast-paced environment where your contribution will have an immediate impact.

Pie, backed by trusted global insurer Sirius Group, continues to expand nationwide in 2019 as we scale our team and operations. Want a slice? In return for your commitment to us, you’ll get a piece of Pie in the form of stock options. At Pie, we’re invested in you, and you in us.
