- Working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential.

Responsibility
• Design and develop applications for the Android platform
• Contribute to all aspects of the software development life-cycle
• Participate in Agile/Scrum software development process
• Collaborate with teams to analyse, design, and ship new features
• Fix software defects and improve applications performance
• Implement unit and automating test, security best practice, and API integrations in the
applications
• Continuously learn and implement new technologies to maximize application performance

Skills
• Proficient with Kotlin, Java, and Android SDK
• Experience with RxJava2, Retrofit2, OkHttp3, Concurrency concept
• Experience with Reactive programming
• Proficient understanding of design pattern such as MVP ,MVVM pattern
• Familiar with CICD process, Jenkins, and Fastlane
• Experience with unit and espresso automate test
• Knowledge of analytics tools such as Firebase, Google Analytic, Crashlytics.
• Experience with code versioning tools such as Git, SourceTree
• Understanding of security algorithm such as SHA1, SHA256, encryption, and decryption.
• Experience with developing SDK and OAuth concept a big plus

title: Infrastructure Engineer at Cumulus Digital Systems, Inc. (Cambridge, MA)
description:
Cumulus Digital Systems is building the Internet of Tools to transform the industrial workforce to be fully connected and data-driven, significantly improving safety and productivity in maintenance and construction. Our goal is to eliminate accidents caused by poor work quality.


The Cumulus platform connects workers, tools, and data to a common software platform for real-time quality assurance and progress tracking. Our award-winning products have wide application in the $900 Billion industrial maintenance and construction markets and have been deployed at facilities around the world. We are backed by leading institutional and strategic investors in energy and construction.


An infrastructure engineer at Cumulus will be responsible for the operations of our secure and highly available cloud computing platforms, servers and networks. This individual will build, maintain, upgrade, and continuously improve the operating environment, employing industry best practices; This includes monitoring the operating environments, responding to incidents, problems and planning for growth.


Responsibilities



  • Maintain, monitor, and support the infrastructure environment:

    • Develop enhanced production monitoring and health check

    • Ensure backup and maintenance availability requirements are met

    • Communicates events to all stakeholders



  • Design and develop new solutions for the infrastructure environment:

    • Develop new alerts and monitoring techniques based on engineering requirements

    • Develop scripted solutions and automation



  • Monitor and communicate system performance:

    • Monitor system-operating capacity in terms of (e.g., load, capacity and CPU utilization)

    • Monitor database performance and recommends changes

    • Perform capacity workload modeling and availability analysis for a variety of platforms and environments

    • Recommend changes/enhancements for improved systems availability, reliability, and performance

    • Determine the required course of action to improve performance and escalates when appropriate



  • Supports continuous improvement initiatives by identifying ways tasks can be automated

  • Provides production support

    • Seeks technical assistance or escalates problem, when necessary

    • Documents, monitors, reports, and manages the resolution of systemic issues

    • Works with Engineers, Vendors, and Architects when issues appear systemic or cannot be resolved

    • Recommends procedures and controls for problem resolution or creates temporary solutions until permanent solutions can be implemented



  • Ensures security requirements are met:

    • Reports security issues when appropriate and gathers required information

    • Analyzes audit trails to detect systematic security violations

    • Makes recommendations to improve security and participates in investigations as needed

    • Ensures adherence to security requirements



  • Ensure compliance with policies, procedures and standards:

    • Monitor production, outputs, and services to ensure that SLAs, and other quality metrics, are being met




Professional Qualifications



  • S. Degree in relevant field, like Computer Science, Information Systems, etc.

  • 5+ years of relevant professional experience in Infrastructure Engineering, Systems Administration, DevOps, IT, etc.

  • Experience with AWS environment and or similar cloud platforms (IAAS)

  • Proficiency in scripting languages such as Power Shell, Go, Bash, Python, etc.

  • Strong knowledge of networking, protocols and debugging

  • Experience in software product build, versioning, release and deployment management

  • Expertise in automation and continuous integration tools (Jenkins, Chef, Ansible, Puppet, etc.)

  • Knowledge of best practices and operations to support an always-up, always-available service

  • Experience remotely supporting “off-line first” devices strongly preferred


The following personal traits or abilities are critical for success



  • Ability and drive to deliver on time, while working in a semi-autonomous, fast-paced environment

  • Takes initiative to identify and address existing and potential obstacles, issues, and opportunities

  • Able to adapt to changing project needs, demonstrating flexibility while working with various individuals

  • Demonstrate attention to detail and accuracy. Able to define and organizes tasks, responsibilities and priorities

  • Willingness to learn to work with the tools and solutions selected by the team 

  • Insatiable curiosity to understand and improve the state of art 

  • Ability to work effectively and build relationships with all levels of personnel, customers, suppliers, consultants - both internally and externally 


Benefits


Cumulus is a small, dynamic team that is quickly growing and evolving. Our company culture is built on mutual respect and trust, something you need when your business takes you to locations all over the world.


We’re working together to transform an industry.


Cumulus offers a generous benefit package, including:



  • Competitive salaries

  • Participation in our equity incentive plan

  • Unlimited paid time off

  • Commuter benefits for public transportation

  • Health and dental insurance

  • Flexible Spending Account

  • Retirement benefits account

  • Workplace perks such as snacks/coffee and flexible work schedules

title: Engineering Manager, Wikimedia Cloud Services at Wikimedia Foundation, Inc. (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
description:
Location: San Francisco, CA or Remote


Summary:


Come work within the Technology department as part of the Technical Engagement group at the Wikimedia Foundation! We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to support our engineers on the Cloud Services team.


The Cloud Services team is maintaining and extending a public cloud computing environment for the Wikimedia movement which provides tools, services, and support for technical collaborators contributing to Wikimedia projects. Our team maintains Infrastructure as a Service (OpenStack), Platform as a Service (Kubernetes, Son of Grid Engine), and numerous Data as a Service (MySQL/MariaDB, etc) products. 


The team works in partnership with the larger Wikimedia volunteer community to manage the physical and virtual resources that power the environment and provide technical support to volunteer developers and other Wikimedia Cloud Services users. Our globally distributed team works remotely and so can you!


As a Cloud Services Engineering Manager, we’d like you to do these things:



  • Coach engineers in being effective at meeting their goals

  • Promote and support a culture of continuous improvement

  • Collaboratively draft and execute the team’s annual and quarterly plans including defining metrics to measure impact

  • Communicate timeline and resource expectations with community and other partners

  • Project manage new and existing initiatives

  • Recruit and hire new team members

  • Support team members to develop their career paths

  • Coordinate with other teams and individuals and contribute to the Wikimedia Foundation's organizational strategy

  • Share our values, respect our code of conduct, adhere to our team norms, and work in accordance with all three


Experience we’d like you to bring to the table:



  • Demonstrable experience managing engineering teams

  • Senior level engineering mindset and experience in Linux ecosystems

  • Ability to work independently, as an effective part of a globally distributed team

  • Willing and able to travel several times a year for occasional in-person meetings

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or the equivalent in related work experience


And it would be even more awesome if you have any experience with any of these:



  • Experience working on a geographically distributed engineering team

  • Experience working as a Site Reliability Engineer or Operations Engineer supporting a web or cloud environment

  • Experience applying one or more project management methodologies in a team balancing planned work and interrupt driven requests

  • Experience participating in open source software projects and communities


The Wikimedia Foundation is... 


...the nonprofit organization that hosts and operates Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.


The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.


U.S. Benefits & Perks*



  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)

  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more

  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary

  • Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays - including the last week of the year.

  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.

  • For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program

  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses

  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available

  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax

  • Great colleagues - diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people


*Eligible international workers' benefits are specific to their location and dependent on their employer of record

title: Senior iOS Engineer at quip (Brooklyn, NY)
description:
DESCRIPTION


At quip, we design and deliver delightful products and services that keep your mouth healthy. From products to services (consumer store/subscription experience, dental practice wholesale, fulfillment, dental insurance), you will have the chance to work at the forefront of providing an elevated user experience in a fast-changing industry. This is a full-time in-office opportunity in our Brooklyn HQ. We are looking for a Senior iOS Engineer to join our growing team, with an opportunity to contribute to significant parts of a rapidly expanding online digital platform.


quip’s product team works as an integrated unit with contributions from teams across the company and there is particularly close work within design, product, and engineering. Communication and collaboration are a critical part of the job. Quip’s mobile products are in their beginning phases of development - this is a truly unique opportunity to come in and own new products which will operate at scale on day 1, building with industry best practices and working with the backend team to create the APIs which will power the applications we deliver. From smart devices to novel services, our roadmap is filled with awesome stuff to work on. Come join us!



RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design and develop Quip’s iOS applications

  • Collaboratively designing great APIs

  • Inform architecture of Quip’s mobile strategy

  • Help improve code quality through solid architecture, coding style, testing, and workflow


REQUIREMENTS



  • 4+ years of experience building iOS applications

  • Familiarity with CI/CD, HTTP

  • Expert in UIKit, Cocoa

  • Swift language experience in production

  • Desire to leverage past experience to make a business impact

  • An opinion about what code to test and how to test it


NICE-TO-HAVES



  • Ruby/Rails experience

  • Worked in a HIPAA or other regulated compliance environment

  • Bluetooth smart-device experience

title: Optimization Engineer at Mindvalley (Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia)
description:
This is a role to learn and grow. 


We don't care about how many years of experience you have. What we care about is:



  1. what you've done.

  2. what you're capable of doing.


We also appreciate a good sense of humour!


The right candidate for this position has a deep, holistic knowledge of search engine algorithms, experience putting together detailed site audits, and the ability to make a wide variety of on-site implementations and optimizations using HTML, CSS, Javascript, PHP and/or other programming languages.



Responsibilities



  • Work cross-functionally with highly technical software engineering and network engineering teams.

  • Work with product engineering teams to instrument metrics and build scalable systems that identify key relationships across network and user quality of experience measures.

  • Build systems and tools, develop capacity planning frameworks, and discover the root-cause of some of the hardest problems among the largest and most complex systems in the world.

  • Build and maintain complex optimization models.

  • Leverage data you produce to improve platform architecture and design.

  • Oversee system performance lifecycle and identify key metrics for performance improvements.


Requirements:



  • 2+ years experience coding in at least one programming language, and experience in learning development languages (e.g., PHP, NUXT JS).

  • Experience with analysis of network and performance metrics.[familiar with lighthouse and Gtmetrix tools]

  • Knowledge of network infrastructure and/or routing.

  • Experience with data logging and processing at scale.

  • Hands-on experience with large-scale datasets.

  • Experience in partnering with technical engineering teams to solve issues.

  • Degree in an analytical field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Management Science) or equivalent experience.


Nice to Have Skills (But not Required):



  • Wordpress Development 

  • Hands on experience with Google AMP 

  • Prior experience with optimizing Nuxt JS Project 

  • Technical SEO skills 

  • Leverage machine learning and related techniques to deliver solutions for large network infrastructure problems.


Your application must include:



  • Your resume in PDF format. Include links to work samples such as software, designs, or writing you have created so we can see proof of your talents.

title: Senior Cloud & DevOps Consultant (AWS, Python, DevOps) at Sourced Group Inc. (Singapore)
description:
Sourced Values 


Integrity, Innovation, Service, Quality, Humility, Sustainability 


What you’ll be responsible for 



  • Working closely with technical leads and client teams to fully demonstrate the benefits of cloud technology 

  • Helping to build & introduce clients to automated delivery pipelines (CI/CD) 

  • Defining and implementing cloud-based solutions in line with industry best practices and enterprise architecture guidelines 

  • Supporting customers in troubleshooting issues in their test and/or production environments and identifying root cause and solutions  

  • Presenting case studies and cloud solutions at meetups, conferences and technology events 


What you will bring to the role 



  • Experience in large-scale, secure, and high availability solutions in the AWS Cloud environment

  • A deep understanding of public cloud security principals

  • Programming/scripting experience with Python, Bash, Powershell, Terraform, or other

  • Experience with CI/CD methodologies, processes, and tools, such as Jenkins, CodePipeline, CodeDeploy, Atlassian stack or other

  • Experience working in Agile project delivery teams


Desirable Skills 



  • Experience working in highly regulated environments such as Healthcare and Financial Services

  • Experience working with relational databases such as SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL or other  

  • Professional and/or Specialty level AWS certifications 

  • Experience in working with microservices or serverless architecture 

  • Experience working with containers and container scheduling solutions (ECS, Kubernetes, Swarm)


About Sourced


Sourced was founded in Sydney, Australia and has worked with complex cloud computing environments in regulated industries for almost a decade, longer than most of our peers. With offices on three continents, the team at Sourced is a rare breed; deeply technical, while still being consultative. We are as comfortable with a whiteboard marker explaining complex solutions as we are sitting at a keyboard implementing them. We utilise our proven deployment frameworks and trusted design patterns and work with the largest and most security conscious enterprises to unlock innovation through cloud computing.


 Why Sourced?  


Sourced offers huge growth opportunities inan innovative, collaborative and inclusiveenvironment. We have regular team social events, personalised career development plans, supportive management and team members, training budget to utilise every year, monthly educational workshops, global relocation packages, as well as a generous employee share option plan! We provide opportunities to work on challenging technology solutions, whilst encouraging and aiding the ongoing professional development of our team.


https://www.sourcedgroup.com/careers/#corevalues


https://www.sourcedgroup.com/careers/#whysourced


 Sourced Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a safe, diverse and inclusive environment. We encourage qualified applicants of all backgrounds including ethnicity, religion, disability status, gender identity, sexual orientation, family status, age, nationality, and education levels to apply. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.

title: Firmware Engineer at SpaceX (Hawthorne, CA)
description:
SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.


FIRMWARE ENGINEER


The embedded software team is responsible for architecting, developing and verifying firmware for SpaceX vehicles. The team works closely with electrical engineers, software engineers and customers across the company to deliver high quality products on a rapid development schedule. Successful applicants will take responsibility for the development, testing and deployment of mission-critical avionics systems as part of a close-knit team of exceptional software engineers.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Deliver highly reliable embedded software for SpaceX designed hardware

  • Work with engineers across the department to develop new products, from prototype through production and flight

  • Take ownership of your firmware products, including verification testing and writing documentation

  • Follow the SpaceX flight software development process and write great software for manned spaceflight


BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:



  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, math or science discipline

  • 2+ years of experience writing embedded software in C, C++ or a similar language


PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:



  • 2+ years developing software for the ARM Cortex family or a similar microarchitecture

  • Working knowledge of hardware level software development, including use of timers, interrupts, hardware peripherals such as SPI controllers and ADCs, bootloaders and debug tools

  • Experience programming and testing high reliability, safety critical, and fault tolerant systems

  • Hardware debug experience, including familiarity with tools such as the oscilloscope, logic analyzer, protocol analyzer (SPI, CAN, Ethernet or similar)

  • Familiar with common electronic components and comfortable reading circuit design schematics and contributing to hardware design discussions

  • Strong understanding of operating system fundamentals, including schedulers, network stack, file system, memory management

  • Experience with defensive programming, continuous testing and similar high-reliability software development strategies

  • Excellent leadership, communication and teamwork skills


ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:



  • Must be available to work extended hours and weekends as needed


ITAR REQUIREMENTS:



  • To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here.

title: Salesforce Tech Lead - Service Cloud (f/m/d) at Delivery Hero SE (Berlin, Germany)
description:
We are looking for a Salesforce Tech Lead - Service Cloud(f/m/d) to join our Global Salesforce Team. Join us to build an inhouse Salesforce ecosystem within Delivery Hero and our global entities. Our task is to understand the strategic business needs and to translate these into our Salesforce platform. So, we can create a dynamic but stable global architecture that is adaptable to local needs. If you're a creative problem solver who is eager to deliver solutions and hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!


Your mission:




  • Mentor and coach developers to build solutions that deliver desired outcomes




  • Create and maintain architectural best practices, addressing Salesforce application, data and integration in the context of e-commerce and Online Delivery business processes




  • Ensure solutions are secure, scalable, reusable, resilient, and performant




  • Provide estimates for cost and effort and assist in validation of business cases




  • Define priorities to refactor solutions and reduce technical debt




  • Monitor progress and provide regular, transparent communication to stakeholders




  • Manage interdependencies between internal and external teams and service providers




Your heroic skills:




  • Expert knowledge level on Salesforce Sales, Marketing, Service, Community, Collaboration and Lightning components




  • Demonstrated ability to stay current with best practices, existing and emerging salesforce product features, architectural and systems engineering industry trends




  • Experience in leading technical teams




  • Technical knowledge of Force.com, Apex, Javascript and related technologies is a must




  • Define coding standards and implement code reviews to ensure quality




  • Experience with distributed source control systems (GitHub), continuous integration (CI) and deployment (CD) tools




  • Experience with software quality assurance processes and automated testing




  • Experience with short release cycles and the full software lifecycle




  • Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and product management to understand requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs




We offer:



  • Develop your skills with your educational budget for conferences and external trainings.

  • Relocation benefits for Hires from Abroad

  • Exchange ideas and meet fellow developers at regular meetups and in our active guilds.

  • Get to know your colleagues during company parties, hackathons, cultural and sports events.

  • English is our working language, and our colleagues at Delivery Hero come from every corner of the globe, working in diverse, cross-cultural teams.

  • Flexible working hours, with the option of home office.

  • Save responsibly with our corporate pension scheme.

  • Enjoy fresh fruits, cereals, beverages, tea and coffee in our lounges. 

  • Take a break with Kicker or table tennis.

  • Take a timeout in our nap room.

  • Learn German with free classes, access our e-learning platform and participate in our inhouse trainings.

  • Enjoy massages or get your hair cut in the office.

title: Senior Developer Advocate at BrainGu (San Antonio, TX)
description:
About The Job:


The Senior Developer Advocate is embedded in a multidisciplinary implementation team tasked with creating and deploying solutions under tight time frames to support United States Department of Defense Cyber operations. Each Implementation team is composed of high performance multidisciplinary Engineers who work together without silos to get the job done.  


The Senior Developer Advocate  is responsible for delivering high-quality shareable documentation that enables external teams to leverage technology frameworks, platforms, and systems developed by the implementation team. These tools will be operationalized and used enterprise wide, therefore this person will serve the critical role of principal communication touchpoint and advocate for external developers seeking to harness the power of our technology. 


The ideal candidate is someone with extraordinary communication and organizational skills, an excellent writer, and is able to fit in well with a team and understand its capabilities and priorities. The Senior Developer Advocate will interface regularly with internal and external technical staff and may also manage one or more Technical Documentation Curators.


About You:


Do you have 



  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience

  • 3-5 years of professional experience working in technical teams

  • 3-5 years of proficiency in digital communications for presenting technical topics to non-technical users, building technical documentation, interacting with developers and IT professionals on a routine basis

  • 1-3 years working with APIs and other technical documentation, participating in technical discussions, building compelling and accessible training materials

  • Familiarity with automated document generation from code, documentation community best practices, technical jargon/lingo in the DevOps and Agile fields

title: Machine Learning Lead at GoodNotes (Kowloon, Hong Kong)
description:
GoodNotes was created from our founder's frustration of taking readable and reusable notes on his first iPad. We have since grown to millions of happy users and have been featured on Apple's marketing materials. Our engineering team members are all full stack, Pi-shaped, and most importantly product minded.

Our Core Values:
* Users come first
* Build better product, not just different
* Do less but get more done
* Always be learning

We are looking for a senior software engineer to work with our research team to create a magical note-taking experience for our users. You love making things fast algorithmically and by utilising the latest vector instructions. Short term challenges include implementing handwriting recognition papers.



  • Strong hardware and software architecture fundamental

  • Solid mathematical foundation of deep learning techniques

  • Excellent programming and debugging skills on scalar and vector processors

  • Love for writing efficient and maintainable code

  • Proven track record of researching, inventing and shipping complex machine learning algorithms, big plus for computational geometry and machine learning algorithms 

  • Led product development from inception to million of users

  • Ability to design and execute on research agenda 

  • Good taste as a maker


Less experienced candidate will be considered as Senior Machine Learning Engineer.

title: Design Strategist (m/f/d) at BCG Platinion (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
For our office in Berlin, we are searching for a Design Strategist!

Do you see yourself as the creative driver in the innovation process? Welcome to the team!

Are you highly motivated to use the power of design to drive business? Do you like to discover and solve complex problems together with global clients? Do you naturally balance user, business, and technical input in clever ways? Great, we should talk.

As a Design Strategist at our Design & Engineering hub in Berlin, you will create effective business models and strategies and bridge the gap between strategic visions and their implementation for business clients. You’ll gain exposure to the latest digital and design trends and develop your own skills and abilities while working together with colleagues from The Boston Consulting Group. 

Creative opportunities available to you 


  • Define and develop strategic designs and visions for key challenges at top global firms

  • Be part of a diverse and highly collaborative team of colleagues

  • Discover, shape and validate design concepts as well as experiences

  • Work with state-of-the-art digital technologies in an innovative environment




Your skills


  • Over 3 years of proven industry experience in strategic and digital product/service design

  • Experience in quantitative and qualitative UX research methodologies such as A/B Testing, Ethnographic Research, Focus Groups, Expert Interviews, etc

  • Experience in human-centered design of thoughtful and innovative concepts, experiences and solutions

  • Proven experience delivering concepts, personas, user journeys, storyboards, user flows, wireframes and prototypes

  • Experience synthesizing research into concrete recommendations and communicating them to business audiences through design workshops

  • Appropriate training or studies in Design, Business, Human-Centered Interaction field and/or equivalent practical experience

  • Fluent in both German and English




Do you impress others with your collaborative spirit and communicate confidently in English and German? Are you open-minded with a strong desire for innovation? Are you prepared to travel from time to time? If so, we offer excellent opportunities!

title: DevOps Entwickler at Bitsea GmbH (Sankt Augustin, Deutschland)
description:
Stellenbeschreibung


Nahezu alle Branchen sind heute von IT-Systemen abhängig. Die rasanten Fortschritte in Software-Entwicklung und -Technologie erfordern immer anspruchsvollere und komplexere Entwicklungsprozesse, um im Markt Schritt zu halten.


Bitsea ist spezialisiert auf die Prüfung von Software. Wir helfen Unternehmen Open Source Software handzuhaben. Wir analysieren, bewerten und optimieren Software- Entwicklungsprozesse, Software-Architektur und das Software-Design, und stellen damit langfristig die Zukunftssicherheit und Rechtssicherheit von Software-Produkten her. Für viele der Dax-Konzerne der Branchen Kommunikation, Automobil, Logistik, Handel und Luft- und Raumfahrt führen wir die technische Due-Diligence als Vorbereitung für Firmenübernahmen und im Rahmen von Einkaufsprozessen durch.


Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Düsseldorf suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt erfahrene


DevOps Entwickler (Fachrichtung Informatik)


Wir bieten spannende Aufgaben:



  • Design und Implementierung eines "Global Integration Gateway" für den Bereich Telco.

  • Sie setzen System für weltweit verteilte Kunden auf und leisten die Vorarbeiten für den Betrieb.


Sie bieten die passende Kompetenz:



  • Sie verfügen über einen Hochschulabschluss in Informatik/Wirtschaftsinformatik oder haben eine vergleichbare Qualifikation

  • Sie haben langjährige Erfahrung mit dem Aufsetzen und Betreiben von Kubernetes, terraform, helm und kennen AWS-Lösungen wie Codecommit, ECR, EC2, etc.

  • Sie haben Erfahrung in python und Golang und kennen die Frameworks mock, unittest, nose, Flask

  • Wir nutzen weiterhin git, github, bitbucket, Linux, Docker, Nexus, maven, Jenkins, Sonarqube

  • Sie coachen Mitarbeiter in obigen Technologien und kommunizieren mit weltweit verteilten Teams


Was Sie von uns erwarten können:


Wir bieten Ihnen spannende Herausforderungen und ein internationales Arbeitsumfeld. Für uns heißt Verantwortung übernehmen nicht nur attraktive Gehälter zu zahlen. Wir geben mehr, damit Sie mehr geben können. Umfassende Leistungen sind für uns selbstverständlich:



  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten

  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge

  • Unfallversicherung

  • Mitarbeiter-Events

  • Lebenslanges Lernen ist ein wesentlicher Bestandteil unserer Unternehmenskultur. Dafür investieren wir in die Weiter­entwicklung unserer Mitarbeiter.


Haben Sie Interesse? Dann senden Sie uns bitte Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen mit Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung sowie des frühesten Eintrittstermins an:


Bitsea GmbH
Personalabteilung
Schlossstraße 7
53757 Sankt Augustin


Tel.: 02241-8942615


E-Mail: jobs@bitsea.de


Weitere Informationen über uns erhalten Sie auch im Internet unter www.bitsea.de

title: DevOps Engineer - Coopersburg or Philadelphia at Lutron Electronics (Philadelphia, PA)
description:
Visa sponsorship provided



Lutron Electronics Co., Inc. has an immediate opening for a DevOps Engineer. In this position, you will have the opportunity to engage with experienced cross-disciplinary engineers to maintain and evolve our modern CI/CD pipeline, fully automate deployment processes, identify and implement creative ways to reduce build time, and continuously improve and accelerate adoption of CI/CD best practices. Lutron solutions are built with end-to-end experiences across a variety of platforms, all of which must be streamlined to ensure smooth and trouble-free delivery of working software packages.



In this role, you will create and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations; you will also research, recommend and implement off-the-shelf solutions and plug-ins, as well as assist in defining road maps for cloud deployments. In addition, you will play a critical role in building systems to manage and automate servers.
You will have the opportunity to join a dynamic group—learning from experiences and from one another; we are always seeking to discover new technologies, computing techniques, innovative designs, and process improvement methods. Products and systems you develop are destined for use in exciting residential and commercial environments, providing concrete goals and a high degree of satisfaction when these goals are met.


Job Responsibilities:



  • Manage and improve the existing CI infrastructure for multiple teams and projects

  • Implement and accelerate adaptation of CI/CD best practices

  • Help the development team with deployment strategy and capacity planning across development, QA, staging, and production environments

  • Write and maintain custom scripts to increase system efficiency and remove human intervention

  • Collaborate with architects and software delivery leadership to uncover pain points and opportunities to accelerate the delivery of new business value through software

  • Participate in evaluating new tools and technology in the fast-moving cloud space

  • Work closely with the Infrastructure Team to create and maintain efficiencies for both development and operations



Stay aligned to Lutron’s culture and values



  • Be passionate

  • Be flexible and adaptable to changing markets

  • Be an innovative thinker

  • Be customer focused

  • Be ethical


Experience Required:



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or similar

  • 3-8 years experience working in a DevOps and/or software/systems build engineering role

  • Strong understanding of DevOps concepts and architectures

  • Strong background in Agile software engineering practices

  • Solid knowledge of build systems and processes

  • Strong hands-on experience with tools such as Git, Bitbucket, Jenkins, SonarQube, Docker, etc.

  • Strong hands-on experience with scripting platforms such as Python, Shell, Groovy, etc.

  • Strong Linux experience

  • IP Networking fundamentals

  • Container-based service architecture

  • Background in systems administration

  • Embedded development

  • Knowledge in software testing best practices

  • Familiarity with AWS and Azure

  • C++ knowledge is a plus

  • IoT knowledge is a plus


Lutron Electronics position as the leading manufacturer of lighting controls worldwide, our unsurpassed quality, the breadth and depth of our product offerings, and our commitment to servicing our worldwide customers have resulted in strong sales and profitability growth year over year. This growth has in turn allowed the company to continue to invest in recruiting and retaining the best people we can find to service our customers. Continuous growth has also fueled our ability to constantly develop new technologies and new manufacturing processes that in turn drive the creation of new or better products and services.  EOE/AA

title: C/C++ Windows Kernel Security Expert (f/m/x) at Avira (Tettnang, Germany)
description:
The challenge:


The Windows Protection Platform Team at Avira is responsible for protecting our users' devices from malware and other threats.
Your task will be to work on Avira's core protection components for the Microsoft Windows platform using modern software engineering methods within an agile team. You will mainly work on the real time protection component.
Some other for projects in our department are e.g. net filtering, AMSI, firewall, on-demand scans (like e.g. active process scan etc.), system repair, updater and licensing.
The protection components and SDKs you will be working on are protecting millions of our customers and are also used by our OEM partners all around the world. They are the core of Avira's success.

The Team:


You will work in a team with 3 other software developers. You will report directly to the “Manager Windows Protection Platform”. Some of the developers have additional roles like “Tech Lead”, Scrum Master or Software Development Engineer In Test (SDET).

What you will do:


As an experienced C/C++ developer, you will work together with your team on the realtime protection that will protect our users on Windows. You will be responsible for the architecture, interface design, the implementation and the high quality of these components. You will mainly work with modern C++ (11 and newer) in user mode and C in driver development. We use C# mainly in test automation, where you will also help your colleagues. Deep knowledge of the OS internal architecture is required to understand all the attack vectors and counter measures.

Keys to Hiring:


The best developers find easy solutions for complex problems. They never guess, but gain deep understanding of their task first before implementing the solution. Good developers are well-organized, fast-implementing and always keep their promises. Good developers know cutting-edge technology in their field and are aware of modern tools. Good developers find solutions for tough challenges rather than saying that there is no solution. If good developers make mistakes, they learn out of it. Good developers do whatever it takes to deliver, e.g. helping doing test automation if this is top priority at the moment. The best developers are keen on learning new technologies and motivated to achieve their goals.

Benefits and perks:





New Work



  • Stylish building with roof terraces

  • Canteen and ChocaVira

  • Modern office concept






Learning & Development



  • Unlimited access to Udemy

  • Trainings & Conferences

  • Specialist Career






Health & Wellbeing



  • Gym and fitness courses

  • “JobRad” bike leasing

  • Medical checkups






Family & Living



  • Relocation Package

  • Vacation child care

  • Avira Prime licences






Events



  • Onboarding events

  • Monthly Employee Meetings

  • Summer & Christmas parties





Location: Tettnang

title: Senior Software Engineer/Cloud at Atomwise (San Francisco, CA)
description:
At Atomwise, we invented the first deep learning neural networks for structure-based small molecule drug discovery, and we’re currently deploying it in one of the largest applications of machine learning for life sciences. We work on Alzheimer’s, cancer, diabetes, drug-resistant antibiotics, and safe pesticides, among treatments for other diseases. We’ve partnered with 4 of the top-10 US pharma companies, raised over $50M from top VCs, and have 100+ diverse projects currently running.


You should think about joining us if you care about enabling the application of machine learning to essential problems. For example, we are not constrained by latency or uptime but by scaling and parallelization. Today we can analyze more than 100 million molecules per day, but there are about 10^24 synthetically-accessible molecules. Come help us pick up a couple of orders-of-magnitude.


Our team has over 30 Ph.D. scientists who contribute to a high-performance academic-like culture that fosters robust scientific and technical excellence. We strongly believe that data wins over opinions, and aim for as little dogma as possible in our decision making.


Our Engineering team is small and growing quickly. As a result, there’s plenty of opportunities for career growth and to have a significant impact on our success.


You will



  • Have the opportunity to learn and improve how we run machine learning at scale to deliver new drugs

  • Play an essential role in designing and building cloud-based solutions consisting of 1000+ CPU and GPU instances in a highly dynamic scaling environment

  • Foster high-quality and adaptable software and systems using code reviews, scrum, and tests

  • Interact closely with scientists at the company (your users) to iteratively determine goals for your projects and to evaluate progress


Required Qualifications



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science with 5+ years of software engineering experience

  • High proficiency in Python and a compiled language (e.g., C++, golang, Java, etc)

  • A record of designing and implementing cloud software using docker containers

  • Experience mentoring other software engineers

  • High proficiency with the Linux command-line environment


Preferred Qualifications



  • Experience building and deploying batch computing workloads or microservices onto Kubernetes


Compensation & benefits



  • Competitive salary, commensurate with experience

  • Stock compensation plan – you’ll be an Atomwise co-owner

  • Platinum health, dental, and vision benefits

  • 401k with 4% match

  • Funding for professional development and conference attendance

  • Flexible work schedule

  • Generous parental leave

  • Strong emphasis on collaborative learning and career development


Atomwise is not currently offering visa sponsorships for any position. Please only apply if eligible to work in the U.S.

title: Head of Applied AI at Software Engineering Institute (Pittsburgh, PA)
description:
What We Do:

The Software Engineering Institute is creating a movement to mature the discipline of AI Engineering for Defense and National Security. As our government customers adopt artificial intelligence and machine learning to provide leap-ahead mission capabilities, we are working to provide the processes, practices, and tools to support operationalizing AI for robust and trustworthy mission capabilities. Our work includes scalable AI and ML; the tailoring of modern software practices for AI-enabled systems; architectures, design patterns, modeling, and representations; building tools and processes for trustworthy development of AI-enabled capabilities; and test, evaluation, verification, and validation of AI systems. Of course, building and maturing the discipline of AI Engineering also requires applying AI technologies to build real-world, mission-scale capabilities through envisioning creative solutions, solving practical engineering problems, and learning from those experiences.

Are you creative, curious, energetic, collaborative, technology-focused, and hard-working? Are you interested in making a difference by supporting the adoption of innovation across the government? Apply to join our team.

Position Summary: As the Head of Applied AI on our team, you will lead, shape, and direct a portfolio of research, technology, and engineering projects to apply and discover best practices in AI Engineering in order to demonstrate and build next generation mission capabilities.

Requirements:



  • BS in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering, or a related quantitative field of study with fifteen (15) years of applicable experience; or MS in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering, or a related quantitative field of study with ten (10) years of applicable experience; or PhD in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering, or related quantitive field of study with seven (7) years of applicable experience.

  • Willingness to travel to Pittsburgh and Washington, D.C., sponsor sites, conferences, and other meetings. Moderate (20-40%) travel outside of your home location.

  • Movement between buildings within the SEI and CMU community required.

  • You will be subject to a background investigation and must be eligible to obtain and maintain a Department of Defense security clearance.


Desired Experience:


  • Technical Leadership and Portfolio Management: You have created, grown, and led research and advanced technology initiatives and portfolios. You have mentored, managed, and led teams of researchers and technology developers.

  • Deep technical knowledge: You have performed and led extensive work in applied machine learning, artificial intelligence, computer vision, data science, data engineering, or related fields. You have worked with tools, software, and programming languages associated with your field. You have built, deployed, or fielded operational AI/ML capabilities.

  • Research and advanced technology practices and publications: You have a track record that includes leading applied research and developing advanced technologies. You have a reputation for the highest level of integrity. You have demonstrated technical contributions and you have showcased your work across multiple fields.

  • Engagement: You regularly scan and maintain awareness of technology trends and opportunities. You are familiar with technical challenges and emerging trends in computing and information science, and you are aware of opportunities in government and industry.

  • Idea Generation and Proposal Creation: You have experience participating in and leading idea creation processes, have formulated and delivered successful research or advanced technology proposals to government funding agencies, and led the resulting projects.

  • Government projects: You have knowledge of and experience working with government mission organizations and funding agencies such as DARPA, IARPA, Service Labs, or other government research, development, and engineering sponsors.


Duties:


  • Research, Development, and Engineering Leadership: You will develop and lead a portfolio of projects applying artificial intelligence and machine learning to create and demonstrate leap-ahead mission capabilities while both using and developing best practices for AI Engineering.

  • Talent Development: You will help identify, recruit, retain, mentor, and develop a high-caliber, interdisciplinary team of engineers, research scientists, and advanced technology developers.

  • Strategy: You will lead the process to plan, develop, and carry out an overall research and technology development strategy, and influence the national research agenda on the use and engineering of AI systems.

  • Customer and Innovation Community Engagement:You will engage with customers and stakeholders. You will represent the SEI’s applied AI/ML portfolio regularly presenting our work at collaboration venues and to customers. You will build and maintain relationships with the DoD innovation and technology ecosystem including relevant engineering, research, and technology development communities.

  • Collaboration: You'll actively participate on teams of software developers, researchers, designers, and technical leads. You'll collaborate with researchers and our government customers to understand challenges, needs, and possible solutions. You'll contribute to improving the overall technical capabilities of the SEI by mentoring and teaching others, participating in design (software and otherwise) sessions, and sharing insights and wisdom across the SEI. You will work closely with other senior AI researchers and engineers across a variety of focus areas.


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


  • Communication and Collaboration: You are an exceptional communicator and can interact collaboratively and diplomatically with customers and colleagues at all levels of experience and knowledge. You grasp the big picture, direction, and goals of an effort while having the natural ability to dig into the details on problems and technical concepts and provide clear direction. You can present complex ideas to people who may not have a deep understanding of the subject area.

  • Dedication and Motivation: You can meet deadlines while multi-tasking–sometimes under pressure and with shifting priorities. You are self-motivated and can work toward a common vision with little oversight.

  • Creativity and Innovation: You are creative and curious, and you are inspired by the prospect of collaborating with premier researchers and visionaries at Carnegie Mellon University and innovation-focused organizations. You quickly learn new procedures, techniques, and approaches. You are forward-looking and can connect research with practical challenges.

  • Knowledge and Learning: You possess broad technical interests along with a deep knowledge of a particular field such as computer vision, data science and machine learning, advanced computing, and autonomy and artificial intelligence.


More Information

Please visit “Why Carnegie Mellon” to learn more about becoming part of an institution inspiring innovations that change the world.

A listing of employee benefits is available at: www.cmu.edu/jobs/benefits-at-a-glance/.

Carnegie Mellon University is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran.

title: Change Engineer at Philip Morris International (Buenos Aires, Argentina)
description:
Change Engineer - Buenos Aires

At PMI, we've chosen to do something incredible. We're totally transforming our business, and building our future on smoke-free products with the power to improve the lives of a billion smokers worldwide.

With huge change, comes huge opportunity. So, wherever you join us, you'll enjoy the freedom to dream up and deliver better, brighter solutions and the space to move your career forward in endlessly different directions.

PMI's journey to a smoke-free future is fueled by technology.

The total transformation we're going through means that there are unique IT projects here to match all levels of skills and ambitions - from pace-setting global pilot projects to vital local updates. Whether you want to pursue a personal passion or build an international career, there's space here to develop in any number of directions.

To join us in IT you'll need to be driven and equally happy whether you're taking the strategic view or diving deep into processes. We'll make sure you're set up to succeed whatever your project is, our culture is agile and collaborative, and we genuinely believe our people are some of the best you'll ever work with.


Your 'day to day'

As a Change Engineer you will work with Service Partners across IT Consumer TechOps, MarketingOps, CommerceOps & WebOps to deploy an effective change governance team and partner with them to provide an overall view of the demand upon our environment. As a member of the wider Service Delivery team, and the ultimate guardian of the customer experience, you will hold a significant role with accountability to make decisions on both an operational and project-level basis with the impact felt across the business.

More specifically you will:

* Ultimate ownership and accountability for the execution of all change activity across the Consumer IT technology, service and process landscape
* Perform delegate duties on behalf of the Manager IT Consumer, Change Management such as chairing the 'Change Advisory Group' and setting the agenda for changes that will be presented for deployment in the production landscape
* Partner with the Service Engineering and IT Consumer ops verticals to deliver integrated reporting based on departmental KPIs. Ensuring full alignment with the Consumer IT service hierarchy
* Influence, coaching and mentor leaders (of all seniorities) about the benefits of Change Management and looking at ways to further improve this framework to ensure more robust and scalable services
* Partner with Infosys to deliver a fully operational change management service that scales across our markets, functions, technologies and services
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of the change management service employing both a qualitative and quantitative approach to developing the offering. A deep focus on reducing waste.
* Ensure all communications and alerts are aligned with standard templates, simple and easy for our customers to digest
* Relentlessly be in the pursuit of zero-defects and ensure our platforms and services are robust, reliable, resilient and predictable
Who we're looking for
* Significant successful experience in the field of Change Management with a vast knowledge of the overall ITSM and ITIL service space
* Preferable for candidates to have B2C experience although a must-have is running a very busy change environment across a large multi-national or global organization
* Demonstrable and meaningful experience of developing a change function into more simple approaches and integrated into a wider service framework
* Experience of Lean Sigma principles and a mindset to deliver improvement with a customer and consumer focus
* Deep experience in the ITSM tooling (particularly ServiceNow and JIRA) areas with the ability to apply complex workflows and models into simple technology solutions
* Experience working within an Agile environment delivering faster at a higher quality level
* Proven ability to manage conflict and prioritisation in an ambiguous setup
* An understanding of cloud-based technology stacks and the application of these services to meet business outcomes and problems
* Willingness to travel across Europe, Latin America and Asia Pacific
* Fluent English

What we offer
Our success depends on the men and women who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join PMI and you too can:
* Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We'll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
* Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone's contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world's best people and feel like you belong.
* Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business - our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
* Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to improve the lives of a billion smokers
#LIJobs

title: Director of Technology at Ascension (St. Louis, MO)
description:
Why Join Ascension?


Ascension Technologies  leverages technology to create collaborative solutions that improve everyday health decisions. The technology enables seamless access to data across all applications transforming the customer experience when interacting with technology and enhancing our ability across Ascension to better serve communities with greater agility and responsiveness.  It is used to provide insightful use of automation and data-drive improvements to enhance the provider, patient and consumer experience as well as keeping cybersecruity with a strong posture to protect data and other valuable assets.  


Ascension is a faith-based healthcare organization dedicated to transformation through innovation across the continuum of care. As one of the leading non-profit and Catholic health systems in the U.S., Ascension is committed to delivering compassionate, personalized care to all, especially to those most in need. In FY2018, Ascension provided nearly $2 billion in care of persons living in poverty and other community benefit programs. 


What You Will Do


As an Associate with Ascension Technologies, you will have the opportunity to direct and oversee demand, resource planning, estimation and capacity planning.


The Director of Demand & Resource Planning works to translate business strategy into IT demand and prioritize projects and initiatives. He/she allocates staff and assesses capacity to reduce delivery issues and increase resource utilization. In addition to identifying and managing demand, the Demand Manager builds and maintains relationships with key stakeholders, acts as a critical point of contact for stakeholder questions and issues, and helps to ensure that the end product meets the requirements of the stakeholder. The Demand Manager serves as a thought leader for business partners, working to proactively suggest new ways technology can support business needs, defining high level requirements, and set business partner expectations about IT opportunities and limitations.


Responsibilities:



  • Develops departmental goals, plans and standards consistent with the technological, clinical, administrative, legal and ethical requirements/objectives of the organization.

  • Plans,organizes and directs all operational planning activities, demand forecasting to meet business objectives of productivity and profitability. 

  • Develops operations planning processes, demand resource planning and capacity requirements planning.

  • Manage direct reports for teams of demand planners, analysts, estimation and resource management.

  • Prepares departmental budgets and ensures the department operates in compliance with allocated funding.

  • Coordinates and directs internal/external audits.

  • Directs and evaluates all departmental activities including research, design and development of new technologies, service level determination and complaint management.

  • Develops partnership with senior management. Works with other senior managers and senior users in strategic technology issues.

  • Collaborates with technology leadership and business leadership in confirming demand requirements and planning.

  • Directsreporting process and leadership KPIs for demand resource planning and capacity.

  • Prepares demand forecasting for annual review and strategic planning.

  • Establishes strategic direction and oversight to ensure that technology resources will be optimized and expenses managed.

  • Strong knowledge of ITIL processes and frameworks


Preferred Qualifications


ITIL Certification, Six Sigma, SolarWinds, Service Now or Planview experience


What You Will Need


Education:



  • High school diploma/GED with 2 years of experience, or Associate's degree, or Bachelor's degree required

  • Master's degree preferred


Work Experience:



  • 5 years of experience required.

  • 10 years of experience preferred.

  • 2 years of leadership or management experience required.

  • 5 years of leadership or management experience preferred.


Equal Employment Opportunity

title: Manager, Security Software Engineering at SpaceX (Los Angeles, CA)
description:
SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.


MANAGER, SECURITY SOFTWARE ENGINEERING


We are looking for people passionate about defending SpaceX’s security, including enterprise systems, vehicle and ground software, and satellite constellation. If you are one of those people, you have the chance to be among the first to secure some of the world’s most innovative technology.  You will guard our perimeter, defend our users, and harden our network.


It will be your responsibility to constantly research emerging attacks and threats; to create offensive and defensive tools and methodologies; and to evaluate risks from the everyday to the exotic.


If you seek a fast-paced environment, crave impact, love the hunt for vulnerabilities, and/or love the challenge of defense, SpaceX may be your next career step.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Directly manage team of security software engineers

  • Own all aspects, including threat modeling, mitigation, validation, including software and hardware penetration testing Develop tools to assist in modeling, analysis, detection, and prevention of security threats

  • Work with development teams to design security into the system and drive security reviews

  • Code in Python, Java, and C/C++

  • Secure the system while ensuring ease of use for the user and network operations

  • Stay current on industry developments affecting security and privacy policy

  • Provide strong technical leadership with a focus on continuous improvement

  • Maintain highest standards of excellence, never settle for the status quo


BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:



  • High school degree or GED

  • 5+ years of professional experience in exploit development or mitigation

  • 5+ years of professional experience designing and implementing software in at least one software language, such as C, C++, Java, or Python

  • 5+ years of professional experience designing and implementing security solutions for operating and/or distributed systems

  • Experience leading teams in an operational or technical capacity


PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:



  • Bachelor’s degree in a technical or engineering discipline

  • Experienced in navigating large, complex, interactive systems.

  • Experience with disassemblers and/or reverse engineering

  • Knowledge of security models and network protocol analysis

  • Physical penetration testing experience

  • Security operations experience

  • Demonstrated skill in hardware and software security

  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal

  • Able to ramp up quickly on new technologies

  • Able to deal with ambiguity

  • Great creative and innovative problem-solving skills

  • Effectively worked as a team lead and/or manager                                 


ITAR REQUIREMENTS:



  • To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here.  


SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.


Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX’s Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application/interview process should notify the Human Resources Department at (310) 363-6000.

title: Senior Python Engineer (m/f/x) ComputerVision / AI Scalability at AVANTGARDE - "Creating Fans" (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
PROMISE - Just Technology - Passion - AI - Real World Challenges - No Spam!


For our AI unit in Berlin we hire a Senior Software Engineer (m/f/x) for an inhouse researched ComputerVision/AI product! - IMPORTANT You will NOT research on AI/ML models! -


YOU INTEGRATE & SCALE BLEEDING-EDGE AI RESEARCH WITH YOUR SKILLS IN

TRUTH


The Python role seems the same like in many other companies, BUT we have a special for you:


Work hand-in-hand with an AI Research team, creating an innovative anonymization approach for +1.1bn public cameras worldwide - using deep neural networks.



  • the Research team creates new models and AI and hand them over to you

  • then you decide what needs to be done to implement/run it properly and to scale it

The product is a solution for 'data privacy vs. analytics' with a high-performance stream processing pipeline generating artificial faces and license plates indistinguishable from real ones. Value: Compliant data handling, data use without constraints to extract customer insights, infinite new business models

  • Working in a rapid prototyping area where the ability to pivot is a must

  • Handling Computer Vision (image processing) Innovations

  • Mentoring junior software engineers 


FACTS



  • Team: CTO, AI Research, Data Engineering, Software Engineering

  • Engineering culture, future-driven vision and AI Community, strong teamwork

  • Training and personal development budget, flexible work times

title: Data Engineer at Equinor ASA (Oslo, Norway)
description:
We're Equinor, an international energy company with a proud history. Formerly Statoil, we are 20,000 committed colleagues developing oil, gas, wind and solar energy in more than 30 countries worldwide. We're the largest operator in Norway, among the world's largest offshore operators, and a growing force in renewables. Driven by our Nordic urge to explore beyond the horizon, and our dedication to safety, equality and sustainability, we're building a global business on our values and the energy needs of the future.


 Data engineering is key in our drive to transform Equinor into a digital leader in the Energy Sector. Through the creation of modern data pipelines, software and services, data engineering enables us to achieve our vision of creating a data driven business and as an enabler for advanced analytics. To meet this new demand, we are actively looking to recruit within our established data focussed teams.  

In Equinor we have one of Scandinavia’s leading IT environments both in terms of innovation and competence. Our skilled data engineering teams work in a rapidly growing cloud-based environment using the latest tools, technologies and industry best practices. Data Engineers work across disciplines and in close collaboration with software developers, data scientists and others in a dynamic and exciting environment. We also have close contact and partnerships with many of the leading suppliers and providers within IT.

We offer a unique possibility to grow personally and professionally across a wide range of technical and business disciplines. Learning and competence sharing is key to the way in which we work.

We are on the lookout for people who are passionate about data, data engineering and software development, who are interested to develop and using that knowledge, and are seeking an exciting and rewarding working environment.

This ad is part of an ongoing recruitment. Applications will be looked into and handled on a continuous basis.


Job Description


• Design and build modern data pipelines, solutions and software
• Making data available through the movement, combining, transforming and exposing of data including framework and API creation
• Develop and maintain solutions within our Microsoft Azure cloud-based data platform
• Work to implement the company’s new data strategy and data architecture
• Follow best practices within data engineering, software development and security
• Champion the company adoption and ongoing use of our data platform
• Participate in a dynamic Agile team-based environment
• Focus on continuous improvement
• Participate in vendor landscape and technology assessments
• Participate in relevant IT and data networks across the company  
• Work and collaborate closely with data architects, data scientists, software engineers and digital projects across the business


Qualifications


Candidates should either have experience with; an understanding of; or desire to work with the following:
• API first development
• Designing and building Big Data solutions
• Cloud architecture and development
• Databases and SQL / NoSQL
• Data streaming frameworks
• Coding in Python, C# or similar
• Scripting in PowerShell or bash
• DevOps including CI /CD and infrastructure as code
• Visualisation and Reporting
• Data architecture, modelling, security and quality
• Understanding of traditional ETL and ELT
• Understanding of efficient algorithms and data structures
• Machine learning fundamentals
• Strong interest in growing your own technology skills  
• We are open to receive applications from candidates with different seniority levels  
• Master’s or bachelors degree in computer science


Personal Qualities


• Curious and open minded  
• Positive attitude to take on challenges in unknown territory ·  
• Service minded and have a good business understanding ·  
• Team player: open and willingly sharing knowledge and experience ·  
• Self-sufficient and rich in initiative  
• Creative in finding workable solutions
• Systematic and analytical
• Holistic approach to solutions  
• Ability to live by our safety and security expectations


We Offer


Not just a job: a career. We encourage you to take advantage of the many opportunities our global company offers, and empower you to build your career across multiple disciplines and geographies, exchange ideas and learn from others.

Rewards. We offer a range of reward programmes within one Equinor framework adapted to the local market. This includes competitive salary, variable pay schemes and a share savings plan.

Wellness and work-life balance. Our employees’ health and well- being are a priority and we appreciate that our employees have commitments outside of work. Whether for family or individual needs, flexibility is important to us all. We recognise that in order for you to be the best version of yourself in the workplace, being able to collect your children, attend a class or simply enjoy social time can be invaluable. We offer opportunities for flexible working.

An inclusive culture. We believe embracing our differences makes us stronger and an inclusive culture is a vital part of our working environment. Diversity for us embraces experience, competence, age, gender, education, cultural background, religion, sexual orientation, disabilities, and more – everything that helps shape our thoughts and perspectives. True inclusion means being able to bring your whole self to work, and for everyone to feel accepted and valued.


General Information


Click here if you want to know more about how we work in Equinor IT.

Make sure that we are able to give your application consideration: Please attach copies of your diplomas, certificates and grades in English or Norwegian (or another Scandinavian language). Applications submitted without such attachments will unfortunately not be evaluated. If you are in the process of completing a degree, please upload an official temporary transcript or other document describing subjects and grades completed to this point.

Our values are to be courageous, open, collaborative and caring. We believe in these qualities, which are essential for building an even stronger Equinor. If you can identify with them, you could be the one to strengthen our team. Candidates are expected to openly offer all relevant information about themselves during the recruitment process.

All permanent and temporary hires will be screened against relevant sanctions lists to ensure compliance with sanctions law and increase security.

title: Senior Python Engineer - Data License at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
description:
Every day, trillions of dollars pass through the Bloomberg Terminal. As a result, hundreds of thousands of financial professionals rely on our 500+ enterprise applications to manage their portfolios, execute their trades and analyze the markets.


As engineers, we're the ones who build the applications our clients rely on to not just stay informed, but stay ahead of the market. We connect supply and demand across all asset classes on worldwide exchanges. The applications and infrastructure we build embody the speed, agility and financial data that makes Bloomberg the go-to for financial professionals across the globe.


Bloomberg Enterprise Content data products drive the financial industry. Enterprise Content is used worldwide by thousands of our clients, and is a rapidly growing business that provides rich programmatic access to the best financial data and services in the industry. Our products span a wide variety of asset classes and data products including Pricing, Corporate Actions, Regulatory and Reference data content sets (https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/product/reference-data/). We build high-performance systems that feed billions of data points per day to our customers that include key financial players.


We interact very closely with our business and sales teams using agile and iterative development. We have many opportunities to design and develop innovative solutions to accomplish ever-growing customer requirements. We’re continuing to grow rapidly, and have opportunities on the following team:


Core Processing Team


Our clients make hundreds of thousands of requests for data on a daily basis, which translates to billions of data points that flow through our system. Each of these requests may have different parameters asking for different data types, how and when it should be fetched, and various transformations to be performed. Additionally, we generate thousands of data sets that nearly span the full range of the financial industry on an ongoing basis.


To meet these demands, this team designs and maintains a microservice architecture that runs across hundreds of machines to execute large, distributed systems which can perform these operations efficiently and robustly. This is the central workflow generator which works across the Data License architecture to power our data engines. This team also builds a graph of metadata using semantic web concepts (https://www.w3.org/standards/semanticweb/) and open standards that allows our clients to understand how our data is connected, and their applications to directly interface with our systems.


This team will design Python-based services and workflows that are used across Data License to execute data gathering and provide metadata. This metadata is primarily focused on open standards such as RDF (https://www.w3.org/RDF/) including the implementation of related open source libaries such as CSVW (https://github.com/bloomberg/pycsvw). The workflows are built on top of Celery (http://www.celeryproject.org/) and RabbitMQ (https://www.rabbitmq.com/) with visualizations using the Flask web server (http://flask.pocoo.org/). This role will be a good fit if you’re interested in designing complex workflows in code, building robust microservices and scaling distributed architectures to handle massive data pipelines.


As an engineer:


You’ll have the opportunity to work with a huge array of technologies developed primarily in Python, along with C++, Java, Javascript and SQL as needed. Additionally you’ll gain experience with Flask, RabbitMQ, Celery, Git, Jenkins, Robot Framework, PostgreSQL, OpenStack, Chef – whatever technology it takes to get the job done. Our work atmosphere is fast paced, high-energy and friendly.


You'll need to have


3+ years of experience with the following:



  •  Python development, including writing idiomatic code, large scale project organization and unit testing

  •  Completing projects that required significant problem solving, communication skills and the ability to work with a team

  •  Use of development tools such as debuggers, memory profilers, and performance measurement

  •  BA, BS, MS, PhD in Computer Science, Engineering or related technology field


We'd love to see



  •  Experience with compiled languages such as C, C++ or Java

  •  Relational database experience (SQL and table design)

  •  Experience developing software in a UNIX environment

  •  Experience with low-latency, high-volume, and highly-availability distributed systems


We are extremely proud of our diverse and open culture, and value diversity of thought and perspective in every form. We're looking for engineers with a real passion for writing reusable, efficient solutions to complex problems, who can adapt to an ever-changing market landscape, and who can collaborate and work effectively on small teams to develop software that impacts thousands of power users around the world.


If this sounds like you, please apply!

title: Senior iOS Software Engineer (m/f/d) Berlin at Gastrofix GmbH (Berlin, Germany)

In some cases, our HR team is checking some details about your application in a previous call with a maximum of 5 minutes.
