title: System and Network Engineer at Babbel (Lesson Nine GmbH) (Berlin, Germany)
description:
Whether on the go, in the subway or at home on the sofa, Babbel supports those who enjoy learning outside of work or school. Since its founding in 2007, the company has grown to become the market leader in app-based language learning.


In total, Babbel offers 14 learning languages, from English to Indonesian. Professional courses are readily available via the Babbel website as well as on your smartphone or tablet. At Babbel, more than 750 team members from over 50 different countries work hard to set standards for creating a new learning experience.


There’s still so much to do.


Babbel is for everyone, not some niche or elite strata of learners. Everyone. As our user base has grown, so has what they need from us. Their learning needs, life experiences, and reference points become more varied and colourful by the day. Meeting that means ensuring users see themselves reflected —not just in our product— but the world it allows them to imagine with us. That means reflecting the dynamism and diversity of our users, as much as possible, in the production of Babbel. We currently have 750 people from more than 50 nationalities working in our Berlin and New York offices, challenging and learning from each other at every step. A culture of difference and dignity is critical to how we’ve connected with millions of users, in every hemisphere.


We are looking for a System and Network Engineer to join our Team in Berlin!


In this role, you will help to build up and run our growing IT infrastructure that Babbelonians make use of every day. You will also be trying out new domains, technologies and ways of working in a fast-moving and diverse environment.


 You are:



  • Communicative and collaborative

  • Pragmatic, with action bias and can-do attitude

  • Self-directed with the ability to develop action plans, projects, reports, status, and presentation material


You will:



  • Help develop Babbel's internal technology infrastructure

  • Define and execute technology projects that impact all Babbelonians

  • Provide support for network deployment and maintenance projects and upgrade server, network, hardware and software components as needed with limited assistance

  • Perform custom configuration for servers, security devices, databases, storage appliances (SAN), IP telephony (PBX), network devices such as switches, firewalls and wireless controllers

  • Re-configure network equipment as necessary to handle environmental changes

  • Independently design, build, maintain and take ownership of new internal services used by our colleagues

  • Create, and test security measures (e.g. access authentication and disaster recovery)

  • Identify and implement automation and configuration management tools as well as innovative solutions with a strong focus on long-term stability and maintainability of our infrastructure


You have: 



  • More than 2 years experience in general system administration and network administration (e.g. Server management, Firewalls/Routers/Switching, Wireless, DHCP and DNS)

  • Expertise in cloud computing (AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform)

  • Experience in solving security problems, including certificate management (e.g. 802.1x, SSL) and network/firewall configuration and encryption

  • More than 2 years experience in Linux environments and with Microsoft Server Technologies

  • An analytical mindset and ability to communicate complex matters in a structured way

  • Intermediate knowledge of scripting languages (e.g. Python, JavaScript, Bash, PowerShell)

  • Excellent written and spoken English skills

  • Knowledge of macOS and Windows desktop operating systems


Nice to have: 



  • Intermediate knowledge of networking security (experience with IDS)

  • Experience with identity management (e.g. LDAP, AD, SAML, OAuth) and source control (e.g. GIT, SVN, etc)

  • Confidence in setting up and handling relational databases (e.g. maintenance, migration and troubleshooting

  • Used Atlassian and Microsoft products before (e.g. JIRA and Confluence, Office365)

  • German language skills


Why Babbel?


Babbel is the world’s most successful language learning app. Work with us to make a real impact in the world, in a meaningful way.



  • We’re motivated by a bold challenge

  • We solve meaningful problems - at scale

  • Diversity and difference are our strengths; lifelong learning is our life’s blood

  • Work within a high-performing team at Babbel

  • Tackle a steep learning-curve – personally and professionally

  • Work in a challenging environment and where you’re expected to bring your game face

  • Take advantage of a lively startup atmosphere with friendly working hours

  • Draw from a vibrant international company with people from over 50 different nationalities

  • We offer great company benefits (high-end company bike, fresh fruit & drinks)


Sounds good? We are already looking forward to hearing from you! Check out our jobs page, our blog, and our techblog!

  • Discounts portal giving access to a wide range of extras such as heavily discounted home technology, travel insurance, corporate gym membership, cinema tickets, holidays, trips out and Ikea vouchers

  • Amazing studio parties such as our CA Summer Festival, a Christmas Party for you and your partner plus a separate Children’s Christmas Party. We also have our wrap parties for all our releases.

title: DevOps Engineer at Trumid Technologies LLC (New York, NY) (allows remote)
description:
About the Role:


We are seeking a DevOps Engineer that is looking to join our growing team. In this role, the DevOps Engineer will be responsible for continuously improving the developer and support experience across the entire technology group. 


Who You Are:


You are someone who is committed to an “automate all the things” approach in engineering.  You want to collaborate with developers to understand their needs and transform those needs into real, friction-reducing processes.  You are someone who is proficient in at least one programming language (such as Python or Go), works primarily from a shell, and prefers ephemeral infrastructure to fixed.


What A Typical Day Might Look Like:


You go online at the beginning of the day to see that a dev environment reported blue/green maintenance issues overnight to Slack.  Product testers are reaching out to the team for help, and you jump on it.  You dig into logs from the Jenkins job that failed, and you ultimately fix it by pushing a Terraform change to GitHub and re-triggering the pipeline.


After standup, you jump on a Zoom to help troubleshoot deployment of a new service.  You’re the expert - after all, you built the pipeline yourself.  You check logs in Elasticsearch, determine that Kafka hosts were incorrectly defined for that service, push changes, and redeploy.  Everybody cheers.


In the afternoon, you turn your focus to the future.  There’s a new project around Kubernetes.  You’re brought in to get your thoughts on how the tech group would be affected.  How do we get this done the right way, with the least impact on QA?  What are some strategies we can use to make things scalable so costs are kept down during normal use, but we can ramp things up at will for performance testing?


Benefits:


We provide some of the best perks in the industry, including:



  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage

  • Lively and dynamic office space with fully stocked kitchen

  • Team-oriented and collaborative company culture


 About Trumid Technologies LLC


Trumid is a rapidly growing financial technology company bringing efficiency to credit trading through data, technology and intuitively designed products. Trumid was founded in 2014 by credit professionals with over 100 years of combined trading experience and is headquartered in New York.

title: Experienced Embedded Software Engineer at Wolverine Trading (Chicago, IL)
description:
Position Summary
We are looking for strong C/C++ programmers who enjoy developing and maintaining high performance software. The candidate will excel at investigating, debugging and fixing mission critical problems as they occur in real time. This is a hands-on position which will involve full development cycles, from requirements collection to final deployment and includes ongoing support for internal users. This team works to develop industry-leading trading systems that respond in real time to changing market conditions, with equal emphasis on performance, risk-management, and stability.  Experience with Linux kernel programming and embedded systems is a must.


In addition to experience and expertise in the field, we are also looking for, initiative, enthusiasm, versatility, and most importantly a passion for technology.


Responsibilities
•    Develop Linux device drivers, interfacing with custom hardware
•    Squeeze performance out of the Linux kernel
•    Interface with system DMA, interrupts, and low level kernel programming
•    Perform full lifecycle development and deployment of C/C++ drivers/applications/libraries related to order execution, risk management, and exchange feeds
•    Support, maintain and improve performance, integrity and reliability of existing software
•    Develop and maintain systems to ensure application performance, integrity and reliability for maintaining maximal up-time
•    Develop and maintain systems to investigate potential problems with production systems in real-time
•    Data analysis to verify valid and reproducible results
•    Collaborate with technical and business peers to determine application requirements
•    Communicate technical knowledge so that both technical and business peers can understand


Qualifications
•    Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related fields or similar professional experience
•    3+ years relevant work experience, ideally within a similar field
•    Linux kernel support
•    Linux device driver development
•    Embedded system development, Assembly language is a plus
•    Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with a solid foundation in data structures
•    Strong C/C++ coding skills on Linux/UNIX and experience in scripting and database systems (SQL), including multi-threaded programming
•    Experience with STL and Boost
•    Experience with developing systems to be stable at the unit level and the system level
•    Interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed
•    Familiarity and interest with networking programming (TCP/UDP, unicast and multicast)
•    Familiarity with software development tools such as version control (Git) and project management (JIRA)
•    Experience with financial exchange data feed and order entry protocols is a plus


Visa sponsorship is not available

title: Build & Release Engineer (f/m/d) at Silexica (Kln, Deutschland)
description:
At Silexica’s headquarters in Cologne, we are currently looking for a passionate and experienced Build & Release Engineer (f/m/d), to ensure the smooth running of our software development and release processes. You have a direct impact on the quality of our products and processes that enable our customers within Automotive, Aerospace & Defense and Wireless Communication to win markets! At Silexica you get the freedom to work independently and implement your own ideas by designing and building innovative new systems using bleeding edge technologies. If you are excited about being a force multiplier in a team of talented engineers working on cutting edge problems, we should talk!


Your role:



  • You develop, extend and improve continuous integration processes, tools, and practices to sustain the development workflows and ensuring high-quality standards in the SLX build and test infrastructure. This includes performance optimization, benchmarking and server monitoring

  • You plan, design and create system tests together with the development teams, QA and customer teams

  • You support our Field Application Engineers debugging at the customer sites

Requirements


Your strengths & qualifications:



  • You have a sound Software Engineering and IT technical skill set based on a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or a related field

  • You are devoted to quality and passionate about receiving great results

  • You love to explain your code and are glad with feedback from code review

  • You have gained several years of relevant work experience as Release Engineer, DevOps Engineer or you are a Software Engineer allrounder with expertise in build and test automation

  • You feel at home in the Linux environment and you master software versioning

  • You have excellent Python scripting skills and are familiar with Bash

  • You enjoy collaborating across different teams being a force multiplier and working on cutting edge problems

  • You have strong communication skills and good conflict-resolution abilities

  • You have an inquisitive mind and can make the right decisions on the spur of the moment

  • You are highly organized and love to learn every day


Plus if:



  • Familiarity with C/C++ programming and its build and debugging processes

  • Relevant experience with CMake, CTest and Boost.test

  • A good understanding of continuous integration systems, ideally Jenkins
    (Big plus: including experience in Groovy scripting)

  • A proven track record in managing open source projects

  • Knowledge about Docker and cross-building for Windows

  • Experience with Eclipse and knowledge of Java.

  • Experience with issue tracking systems, preferably Jira

  • You have already worked in an agile development environment


Benefits


We offer:



  • An integration into our daily work processes from day one with support by your own mentor

  • An opportunity to work with a leading breakthrough product that is shaping a new era of computing

  • A competitive salary and an awesome work environment with an outstanding multi-cultural team

  • A technical key role within our fast-paced and entrepreneurial organization, which supports your professional and personal development

  • The opportunity to become a Silexican -- come and find out what that means


Are you ready for the next challenge? Grow your career as you shape the future of Silexica! To apply please upload your CV, your motivation for this position and outline your availability via our recruiting system.


To learn more about Silexica head to www.silexica.com/careers


We live and love diversity! We have a team of brilliant minds from over 20 countries. We believe that the more diverse we are, the better we get. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: DevOps Engineer - Security at Stratifyd (Charlotte, NC)
description:
DevOps Engineer - Security


Do you want to join a fast-paced tech company? 


Stratifyd, Inc. is a B2B tech company located in Charlotte, NC and is fundamentally changing the way brands analyze their data. Stratifyd delivers the most comprehensive, unbiased insights from structured and unstructured data in real time which enables our clients to make confident business decisions faster.


We are members of the 2018 Mastercard Start Path class and the Microsoft ScaleUp program. Additionally, we were named a Cool Vendor in Analytics by Gartner and we were just awarded one of "Charlotte's Best Places to Work" as well as one of the fastest growing companies in Charlotte by the Charlotte Business Journal!

As a DevOps Engineer - Securitywith Stratifyd, Inc. you will be part of an agile and growing team, playing a critical role in helping us grow our business. In this role, you will be our first line of defense, protecting our network, systems, applications, and employees from damaging threats to our company.   


Key Responsibilities



  • Create and implement a strategy for the deployment of information security technologies in the cloud

  • Help to make security an integral part of the SDLC.

  • Perform security risk assessments and report on ways to minimize threats

  • Develop a process for the investigation of reported security breaches

  • Develop strategies to detect security incidents and trigger investigations


Required Skills & Experience 



  • Associate degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or related field

  • Strong experience using Python as a high level programming language

  • In depth knowledge of AWS IAM and an understanding of AWS security tools

  • Infrastructure as a code (IaC) such as Terraform/CloudFormation

Preferred Skills & Experience

Stratifyd, Inc. offers employees a competitive salary along with paid time off, healthcare, vision, dental, 401(k), and fun and collaborative work environment.  


Stratifyd is an equal opportunity employer all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

title: Senior QA Engineer at Mobiquity Europe (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Are you passionate about testing new technologies? Do you want to work for an innovative player in the digital field? Do you think your personal and professional developments never end and that you should keep on learning? Then read on!


We are a group of peers who leverage modern methodologies, state-of-the-art technologies, (Big Data) cloud solutions, IoT projects and we are even a Premier Consulting Partner of Amazon Web Services.


As our Senior Quality Assurance Engineer, you have extensive experience in software testing. You will be responsible for the testing of mobile and web applications, combined with back-end integration testing. Projects include Fintech and online banking solutions, sensor and data-driven solutions in personal and professional healthcare, retail and loyalty solutions, and more.


This is a hands-on role. You will prepare test plans and create, maintain, and execute test cases. You will work closely with other QA engineers and developers in the USA, India and the Netherlands. You will be a part of a client-facing team.


Technical skills



  • 3+ years of work experience as a QA engineer

  • Hands-on experience in testing mobile or/and web applications

  • Experience with test automation

  • Experience in setting up test environments and test data to execute test cases

  • Experience in API testing

  • Experience working within Agile teams

  • Excellent communication and analytical skills

  • Fluency in English


Bonus



  • Experience in defining test strategies: identify what needs to be tested when, how - and the corresponding risks

  • Experience in setting up test frameworks

  • Experience in non-functional testing (performance and security)

  • Experience in Behavior Driven Development (BDD)

  • Experience in testing cloud-based solutions

  • Advanced or native level of Dutch


You don’t take “no” for an answer, and if you have a good sense of humor and a passion for technology, then we’re looking for you!


Lead role


Quality and learning are two critically important parts of our DNA, we have embedded them in the way our agile delivery teams work. We structured our delivery organization in competency teams (e.g. front-end development, back-end development, testing, etc.). The competency teams are used for coaching and personal development, to share professional experiences, and to standardize and innovate our way of working across the various delivery teams. Some of our senior and principal professionals are offered the opportunity to become a competency team lead. In this role, you spend approximately 20% of your time coaching up to 8 of your peers and developing your team's competency. In this role, you will contribute also to the delivery management within Mobiquity. 


Offer


We offer a challenging learning environment and cool creative and innovative projects. You join a growing team of creatives, all working to bring their expertise to the customer. We coop in teams, learn from each other and our employees represent the best talent from around Europe and beyond, and we are very proud of what we have achieved already!


We offer you a range of nice perks too: a competitive salary, training via our Mobiquity Academy, health insurance compensation, a free pension plan, 25 holidays + bank holidays, travel costs compensation, free fruit, Friday afternoon drinks, and lots of fun in the office! And with 30+ different nationalities in our Amsterdam office, you could say we have a diverse culture, and we are proud of it! For knowledge migrants, we offer relocation compensation and help in obtaining a knowledge migrant status including the favorable 30% tax ruling for foreign knowledge workers in the Netherlands.


Apply


Here is what you need to do to apply: Please, upload your resume and details in the section below.

title: Data Scientist at Strong Analytics (Chicago, IL)
description:
Strong Analytics is seeking a data scientist to join our team in developing machine learning pipelines, building  statistical models, and generally helping our clients discover value in their data.


At Strong, we pride ourselves not only in building the right solutions for our clients through research and development, but in implementing and scaling up those solutions through strong engineering. This role thus requires a deep expertise in applying statistics and machine learning to real-world problems where data must be gathered, transformed, cleaned, and integrated into some larger architecture.


We offer a comprehensive compensation package, including:



  • Competitive salary

  • Profit sharing or equity, based on experience

  • Health insurance

  • Four weeks paid vacation

  • Work-from-Home Wednesdays


Requirements


Candidates will be evaluated based on their experience in the following areas (though no one is expected to be an expert in each of these):



  • Statistical modeling and hypothesis testing

  • Applying machine learning to real-world problems

  • Writing clean SQL and ETL pipelines

  • Building Python applications

  • Building deep neural networks with modern tools, such as PyTorch or Tensorflow

  • Integrating with various RDBMS (e.g., Postgres, MySQL) and distributed data stores (e.g., Hadoop)

  • Deploying applications into cloud-based infrastructures (e.g., AWS)

  • Creating and interacting with RESTful APIs

  • Managing *nix servers

  • Writing unit tests

  • Collaborating via Git


Applicants with a PhD in a quantitative field are preferred; however, all applicants will be considered based on their experience and demonstrated skill/aptitude.


Applicants should have the ability to travel infrequently (<5% of your time) for team meetings, conferences, and occasional client site visits.
